ModelScan is an open source project that scans predictive model artifact files to determine if they contain unsafe code. It is the first model scanning tool to support multiple model formats. Test containers are RHELs software that allows Delta applications to be designed, developed, and tested in smaller deployments. Today, applications will have to deploy to AWS or ROSA which can take time and has various complexity which slows down the developer

SAP Cloud Integration (CI) Suite is an platform-as-a-service (iPaaS) enabling SAP and non-SAP integration leveraging the SAP Business Transformation Platform (BTP).
The CI suite is the consolidation of BTP’s predecessor services CPI (ETL like) and Data Integration (API gateway) and following the industry trend.
The key factors are the availability of certified connectors enabling integration SAP products (ECC, EWM, HCM, SuccessFactors, Ariba, et al.) and ERP like product like (ServiceNow and Salesforce), allowing the development to focus integration work. BTP also provide predefine standard integrations (HCM to SF, ECC to ARIBA, etc..) or accelerators specific for common integration (HCM to SNOW’s HR module or Sales Forces to ECC).
Finaly, if offers heavy data / high volume end-point API capabilities (mainly ODATAv2/v4) for SAP platform.

This solution is geared toward ERP and ERP Like products with push (real-time) / pull (batch) capabilities having existing vendor approved endpoint allowing the respective development to focus on the data transformation and transfer.

Dataverse is part of Microsoft’s Power Platform. It is a cloud-based data management solution. It allows users to securely store and manage data used by Power Platform
Microsoft Dataverse provides a unified platform for managing and utilizing data. Integrating Dataverse effectively ensures robust, scalable, and secure data management across Microsoft’s Power Platform.

Currently users of the Power Platform make use of SharePoint lists as a data source.  This does not provide the security or scalability Dataverse will allow.

1.	Data Modeling and Storage:
o	Dataverse allows you to create custom tables to model your data.
o	You can define relationships between tables, set data types, and enforce business rules.
o	It provides secure cloud-based storage for your data.
2.	Integration and Connectivity:
o	Dataverse integrates seamlessly with other Microsoft services (Azure, Dynamics 365, Power Platform).
o	You can build connectors to external systems and APIs.
o	It supports data import/export and synchronization.
3.	Security and Compliance:
o	Dataverse ensures data security through role-based access control.
o	It complies with industry standards and regulations.
o	Auditing and monitoring features enhance data governance.
4.	App Development and Automation:
o	Dataverse enables low-code/no-code app development.
o	You can create canvas apps, model-driven apps, and automate workflows.
o	It supports Power Apps and Power Automate integration.

AWS Bedrock only, 6-week POC

The Model (distilBERT) is a distilled version of BERT and in the family of Transformer models. This model will be used in AI Solution being built for GEN AI Based Knowledge management for RES and would be used in Production
Enterprise AI team is working on project ‘GEN AI Based Knowledge Management for RES’ – Block Code ‘  DPEAIEGAKR’. 

Current solution is in Prod for Pilot users.  Team has identified and explored this model which a distilled version of BERT and comparatively smaller, faster, cheaper, and lighter. Utilizing this model in the solution will offer improved accuracy for identifying and displaying responses to the User’s Natural language queries from the Verified Response Bank which will eventually influence the reduction in CHT (Call handling time ) of the Reservation Agents. 

The intent is to use this ‘Fine Tuned Bi-Encoder’ along with existing solution and invoke this Model for the cases where current Solution is giving ‘No Match’.  Ths model  DistilBERT will be used to fine tune the bi-encoder. The current version of GEN AI Solution in PROD uses ADA002 for the bi-encoding task from which likely candidates are then evaluated using a cross-encoder (RoBERTa-Large).

In the initial tests conducted, there seems to be positive improvement of the AI Solution after utilizing this model and specific to the semantic search where solution is able to identify responses to the similar queries from Verified Response Bank (VRB)

BlinkOps SOAR is a platform used to design automated workflows. Apart from that it provides a streamlined incident response process and security case management. It minimizes manual work through autonomous triage. 
The Cyber Monitoring and Incident Response team currently lacks a Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) solution. Implementing a SOAR solution would replace manual processes with automated workflows, leading to faster response times and reduced human errors. Additionally, the SOAR solution includes case management capabilities, allowing efficient tracking of ongoing incidents and the creation of incident tickets. The existing solution lacks essential features, robustness and is unreliable.

Swimlane Turbine (SOAR) is a security automation platform designed to unify security operation and serve as a system of record.
The Cyber Monitoring and Incident Response team currently lacks a Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) solution. Implementing a SOAR solution would replace manual processes with automated workflows, leading to faster response times and reduced human errors. Additionally, the SOAR solution includes case management capabilities, allowing efficient tracking of ongoing incidents and the creation of incident tickets. The existing solution lacks essential features, robustness and is unreliable.

D3 Security’s Smart SOAR is a platform designed to unify security operation by ingesting, normalizing and prioritizing alerts from our tools. It minimizes manual work through autonomous triage.

The drones are leased. The cloud platform for the storage and analysis of the images is included in the cost of the lease. The drone conducts an automated flight path around an aircraft and takes images for review by a technician or inspector. Video capabilities are present, but not used as a primary function or for inspection. Images are captured via the drone’s camera and uploaded through the vendor’s iPad app, which is connected to the Mainblades server. The iPad app, or the web portal, is where the images are reviewed.
column40:
The drone conducts an automated flight path around an aircraft and takes images for review by a technician or inspector. Video capabilities are present, but not used as a primary function or for inspection. Images are captured via the drone’s camera and uploaded through the vendor’s iPad app, which is connected to the Mainblades server. The iPad app, or the web portal, is where the images are reviewed. 

Product is capable of inspecting an A/C 75% to 82% more quickly – directly drives reduction in high time non-routine AOS and IROP items, such as lightning strike inspections; completely removes Delta technicians and inspectors from having to access the top of the A/C for these tasks, which increases the inherent safety of accomplishment. Improves ability for engineer to assess aircraft condition.

No software needs to be loaded to Delta machines, no network access required as vendor has SIM card enabled iPad’s, no interfaces to Delta systems at this time. Should the need arise for us to request a data dump of our aircraft images, we would need to setup a pipeline to do so. Access is granted to vendor system through a registered email and password; Mainblades and TechOps Engineering jointly own permissions and access as well as enabling features for users based on qualifications. 

Computer Vision (CV) is an application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) that trains computers to identify, interpret and track objects in photos and videos. The technology is primarily driven by recognizing patterns that repeat themselves over a given set of data. In Mainblades’ case that means identifying different kinds of damages on the fuselage of aircraft. To do that reliably, algorithms need to be trained by feeding large quantities of images with labeled objects. This allows the algorithm to establish a unique profile for each object. If this is repeated often enough it is eventually able to identify the objects in unlabeled images.
column41: Reduction in AOS due to high inspection time reduction, safety benefit and risk reduction by removing people from top of aircraft to accomplish task, increased quality of aircraft condition data that allows engineering and inspection to make more informed decision about aircraft through high resolution images
column42: Conditional GVI for whole fleet, Lightning Strike Inspections for whole fleet, paint quality inspection for composite aircraft/components, high resolution images of aircraft in exact locations over inspection life cycle

Canvs AI, a SaaS vendor, provides emotion analysis on open ended feedback . We want to explore and validate Canvs AI capabilities for a pilot for 30 days.
We get millions of survey responses from customers which includes numerous open-ended feedback including transcribed video feedback. While a number of analyses is done on quantitative data for performance tracking and qualitative data for understanding larger thematic issues, customer emotional needs during travel have NOT been explored and understood. Plenty of research available for positive CX outcomes when CX Design incorporates understanding of customer emotional state.
Canvs AI provides us that emotional understanding of open-ended customer feedback which we aim to use for insight generation and ultimately effective CX Design

FlatBuffers is a free software library implementing a serialization format and supports “zero-copy” deserialization, so that accessing the serialized data does not require first copying it into a separate part of memory. This makes accessing data in these formats much faster than data in formats requiring more extensive processing. The serialized format allows random access to specific data elements (e.g. individual string or integer properties) without parsing all data.

Realm DB is a mobile database running directly inside mobile applications. The repository supports iOS native Swift and Objective-C languages. FitMe is a new assessment vendor and their product is the ValueFit assessment, an online-based assessment which evaluates alignment between a candidate's core values with the company's core values. After a successful pilot with RES, leadership agreed to implement the ValueFit assessment as part of the RES Customer Experience Specialist hiring process going forward.
The ValueFit assessment asks candidates to rank their work-related values, and the candidate’s values are compared to a benchmark aggregate profile of values that is based on assessment responses of an internal benchmark group of longer-tenured high-performing employees. A values fit score is then determined based on comparing the candidate values ranking to the aggregate benchmark values ranking

Currently, when Merit employees hit the limit, if Payroll does not stop when they should, there are heavy admin efforts to fix. Additionally, after employees reach the current annual limit, they are able to spill-over into a savings account, but the contributions are pre-taxed. The new plan will allow employees to add contributions into an independent retirement account with tax-free benefits.

ICoupon is a digital voucher technology solution that will be used when Delta is required to give meal voucher compensation to customers for a delayed or cancelled flight.
DL Agents will access the tool via a URL on their GX Pros or common use workstations. They can then activate the iCoupon for a full flight or specific customers. The technology assigns monetary value to the customers boarding pass barcode. Customers can then scan their boarding pass (whether it’s paper or digital) at participating retailers to pay for their meals. 
The technology assigns value to the barcode via flight number, flight date, and BCN.
ICoupon is used by many airlines, including Air France in CDG.
Currently stations use manual processing of vouchers via delta term or paper vouchers which has a high risk of fraud.

column9:
Riverbed NetIM is a solution for discovering, mapping, monitoring and troubleshooting your infrastructure. It enables companies to capture infrastructure topology, detect performance and configuration issues, map application network paths, 
diagram your network and troubleshoot infrastructure problems. NetIM helps to right-size IT infrastructure capacity, 
analyze network usage to identify trends, threshold violations, inefficiencies, and other atypical behavior. 
NetIM is built on a modern, containerized architecture to provide horizontal scalability, high performance and an option of cloud deployment for operational agility. 

Riverbed NetProfiler is a solution for Network flow monitoring to help you understand how a network is performing. Network flow offers up-to-the-minute information about communications occurring over the network, including who is sending how much data to whom, as well as how and when. Flow data is available from routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers and it is collected enterprise wide, including the cloud, by a centralized flow analysis and reporting solution.

column9:
The IBM® SevOne® Network Performance Management (NPM) solution helps you spot, address, and prevent hybrid network performance issues early from a single source. Boost on-premise, SDN, SD-WAN, and Wi-Fi network performance and improve user application experience by proactively monitoring multivendor end-to-end networks. Transform raw network performance data into intelligent and actionable insights across enterprise, communication, and managed service provider networks. The SevOne NPM solution goes beyond detection, combining industry-leading expertise and advanced technology to help the IT team plan, optimize the network and act on what matters.

SevOne Data Insight is an integrated component of IBM® SevOne® Network Performance Management (NPM), which leverages real-time monitoring coupled with easy ways for any user to find, use and share valuable network performance insights. Data Insight delivers simple, reusable, and scalable reporting, utilizing easy-to-use troubleshooting workflows while unifying SevOne NPM with third-party data. A major component of Data Insight, LiveMaps elevates the most significant network problems so that IT professionals can quickly see incidents from a single source.

Policies & Insights for Microsoft 365 helps you identify, prioritize, and resolve permissions, membership, and configuration issues across your workspaces. It monitors various Microsoft 365 objects, including Teams, Groups, users, SharePoint, and OneDrive, to automatically detect and notify you of configuration drifts or security risks. This capability gives you greater control over your content, external sharing, and settings.

With Policies & Insights for Microsoft 365, generating tenant-wide security reports becomes straightforward. It enhances traditional security reporting by providing additional context. The tool aggregates sensitivity and activity data across Microsoft objects, ensuring that your most critical issues are prioritized for action. You can easily edit permissions and settings in bulk and set policies that will be enforced automatically.

These controls are designed to ensure access with the right level of privileges and context. Amazon DataZone makes it easier for engineers, data scientists, product managers, analysts, and business users to access data throughout an organization so that they can discover, use, and collaborate to derive data-driven insights.

column1: S3 Object Lambda Access Point (AWS Service)
column9:
SERVICE FOR DATA MASKING OF PII

This service will be used by data scientists and will mask PII information when data is requested from s3

S3 object lambda access point creates an alias to the bucket name. The only difference is that this lets a lambda sit in between the object and the client. This lambda can then be used for various use cases. One special use case we are looking at is having the lambda redact the object or even deny the object If the requested object has PII. If we have 3 different business groups, we can have 3 s3 lambda access points. While the business requests  data through s3 lambda access points, the object data is redacted differently for each groups based on the intended level of accessibility. If an admin wants to access raw data, we can use the usual method of accessing using the bucket name to get the original raw data unredacted.
column25:
5/16/25: STR approved
Pending item: PIA
From InfoSec: ensure does not violate Amber mandate rules and guardrails and that the access point is not publicly accessible
New service to be whitelisted for use in production

Air Space Intelligence (ASI) Time Machine Scope: The ASI - Flyways Product platform has 3 primary components 
1. Historical DB(Time-Machine)
2. Real-time National Air Space (NAS) Constraints effecting Airline Operational Management(Network Manager)
3. Dispatch individual flight routing suggestion with integrated solution communication to Flightdeck application(Flight Management Suite).

ASI uses an Aircraft Situational Display (ASD) to presents users with an Artificial Intelligence(AI) supported understanding of Air Traffic Control(ATC) constraints to the NAS with respect to Airline Network schedules, Flight Control - Flight Following/Planning and Pilot-in-Command enroute requests. ASI has acquired independent access to FAA data streams to support their applications AI model computations. The AI modeling can support additional Delta proprietary data sets if/when this expanded relationship is desired. The current plan is to provide NO proprietary data to ASI. ASI AI modeling will stay self-contained to their proprietary data sets.

Brand.ai is a domain-specific AI platform designed for brand builders, agencies, and Fortune 500 companies. It serves as an operating system that brings your brand to life, making it easier for teams and partners to deliver consistent and impactful brand experiences. Brand.ai synthesizes every aspect of your brand, from strategies and business plans to physical and digital touchpoints, creating a living source of truth for the entire organization
Our goal in Brand Strategy is to utilize Brand.Ai as a tool to guide and enhance our marketing and brand development, ensuring all materials are strategically aligned with our new brand guidelines, authentically connects with our target audiences, checks for brand consistency, surfaces potential cultural nuances, unifies with our new brand platform stance, and more. We'd like to use it Q1/Q2 now that we're developing new brand platform creative.

column40:
Business Goal: 
•	Our goal in Brand Strategy is to utilize Brand.Ai as a tool to guide and enhance our marketing and brand development, ensuring all materials are strategically aligned with our new brand guidelines, authentically connects with our target audiences, checks for brand consistency, surfaces potential cultural nuances, unifies with our new brand platform stance, and more. We'd like to use it Q1/Q2 now that we're developing new brand platform creative.
o	Given the 100 years Delta anniversary, the brand strategy team is working on a new brand VIS ID for Delta. It’s exciting to see the team is working on how we evolve the brand for the next 100 years by elevating the Delta brand for a holistic overall premium brand experience.
column41:
Brand Opportunity with Vendor
•	Reason for working on this is that there hasn’t been a strong consistency across marketing, digital, CX, so this brand platform is truly meant to unify everything that we do at Delta to make sure everything feels cohesive. We are all marching to this idea of expanding people’s potential every day, so there is a new logo, color, tone of voice, etc. Therefore, we want to train Brand.ai to truly understand our new brand guidelines, who our audiences are, is this right for Spanish same as in English, does this celebrate diversity, etc. This is a tool we are hoping to use to drive that consistency, because with consistency comes strong brand power differentiation and more revenue. So, this is our way to adopt an AI tool of us unifying everything we can do.
column42:
Capabilities include: analyze business data, market trends, and cultural shifts to inform brand and creative strategy throughout the lifecycle of a brand

Delta/Vendor Engagement: 
•	A beta test relationship was offered to Delta mid last year. It’s important to find a mutually acceptable opportunity to test out some of this functionality. 
•	If we find Brand.ai incredibly helpful, we will want the license as an MVP user list for them and cost manageable. Internally, to have adoption we would need to have a couple of super users on there to evangelize and be able to share out the capabilities and opportunities. 
o	We don’t envision us going full scale for this in a fair amount of time 12-18 months if that is the course we take. It does have a lot of type of value with what we are doing with the new VIS ID and the new brand strategy to give us a certain level of consistency and gut checking on that 
•	Nathan Smith and Ryan McFerrin did connect on budget allocation for this POC and are both aligned from the cost perspective.

column40:
XR training will enhance learning and training for airline employees by providing immersive, interactive, and scalable training experiences. VR enables employees to practice complex procedures in a risk-free environment, improving knowledge retention, reducing training costs, and increasing operational efficiency. 

From a technical standpoint, Unity3D is a top choice for XR development due to its real-time rendering engine, which enables smooth, high-performance experiences. Its C# scripting with Mono/.NET allows for flexible, efficient coding, while the XR Interaction Toolkit simplifies development for VR and AR. Unity supports OpenXR, ARKit, and ARCore, ensuring broad hardware compatibility. Features like spatial mapping, hand tracking, physics, and AI integration enhance interactivity. The extensive asset store and robust community support accelerate development, while cross-platform deployment makes it easy to target multiple devices, from standalone headsets to mobile AR and PC VR.
column41: The use of VR headsets for airline employee training enhances engagement, retention, and efficiency by providing immersive, hands-on learning experiences. VR reduces the need for costly in-person training sessions, minimizes operational disruptions, and allows employees to practice complex procedures in a safe, controlled environment. This technology improves overall training effectiveness, accelerates onboarding, and ensures consistency across global teams, ultimately leading to better-prepared employees and improved operational performance.
column42:
Immersive Training Simulations: Enables employees to practice real-world scenarios, such as emergency procedures, aircraft maintenance, and customer service interactions, in a controlled and engaging environment. 
 
Scalable and Remote Learning: Supports training across multiple locations without the need for physical classrooms, reducing travel and logistical costs. 
 
Real-Time Performance Tracking: Allows trainers to monitor employee progress and provide data-driven feedback for continuous improvement. 
 
Hands-Free Interaction & Hand-Tracking: Enhances realism and engagement by enabling natural interactions without the need for controllers. 
 
Mixed Reality Integration: Combines virtual and real-world elements, allowing for blended training experiences that improve situational awareness. 
 
Cost and Time Efficiency: Reduces the need for expensive physical training equipment and minimizes time spent in traditional training sessions, improving overall operational efficiency.

column9: VULCAN Cyber is a vulnerability consolidation and remediation tool that focuses remediation efforts, improves reporting efficiency, and reports remediation progress. The Vulcan Cyber Platform utilizes AI Technology in order to “enhance our efficiency and productivity” as it pertains to searching and reporting within the Console. These AI features are applied to their Global Search Engine to allow us to search more easily or find critical reports within the Console. How Vulcan AI operates: AI operations are conducted locally within Vulcan Cyber’s secure Azure infrastructure. OpenAI models are hosted securely in Azure and do NOT interact with any external OpenAI services (e.g., ChatGPT or the OpenAI API). All data is processed in real-time, ensuring no customer data is exposed or shared externally. The Criticality of this solution is minimal because this tool simply connects to and consolidates information from Delta’s origin vulnerability scanning sources (Qualys, Armis, Wiz, AWS Config, Veracode, and Tenable CIEM). At this time, this product does not require any AWS services to be hosted.

LoadStar Server Enterprise (LSE) is a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution provided by the vendor Teledyne Technologies. It provides a Configuration Management program for Loadable Software Airplane Parts (LSAPs) to support Delta’s Navigation Database Management & Data Distribution. LSE provides web user interface for software configuration control throughout the entire fleet and delivers automated load reporting, which facilitates regulatory compliance, increases efficiency and loading capacity. All load devices are integrated with Teledyne’s Loadstar® Server Enterprise (LSE) software part management and distribution system that automatically transfers parts to the load device over Ethernet, Cellular or Wi-Fi network.

The solution includes the following software components that will be installed on
Delta workstations:
•	LSE Media Image Maker - An application within LSE that enables operators to create USB drives containing software parts for upload onto A380/A350 aircraft directly from the LSE web application.
•	LSE Part Importer - An application that enables operators to import software parts from a local machine directory or external media to the LSE web application.
•	LSE eADL USB Image Burner - An application within LSE that enables operators to create USB drives containing software parts for upload onto an eADL. This feature serves as a backup loading option when the WQAR cannot receive parts.
•	eADL XS USB Creator – An application allows loading the Loadable Software Parts (LSPs) onto a USB in a proprietary format.
•	eADL XS Programming Tool - An application is used to create a LSP’s for the eADL. This eADL LSP serves for updating the Trust Sore (update p12 files/certs for signing LSPs), 615A targets (add or remove 615A ethernet loadable targets), LSE license (if using eADL XS without WQAR), AMI (select wireless communication; WQAR, Cell, Wi-Fi, or None), 615 (add updates to the regular 615 loading engine).

column1: Disconnected Scanner for IBM License Metric Tool (ILMT)
column9:
IBM provides a tool named “IBM License Management Tool” (ILMT) to track PVU license consumption.
IBM mandates that a BigFix Agent is installed on each server to track PVU license consumption regardless of the environment. Each BigFix Agent scans IBM software that is installed on each server every 30 minutes and the result is then saved on the server. The unique data generated from each server is collected and processed by ILMT at the end of the day automatically for PVU subcapacity tracking and audit purposes.
IBM recognizes that there are times when a server cannot provide PVU license consumption to ILMT. Thus, IBM has established a method to provide consumption data to ILMT through the “Disconnected Scanner” method, which requires the execution of a script that scans and collects PVU license consumption every 30 minutes on each server that cannot connect automatically to ILMT. The results are then packaged into a single file that will be later transmitted to ILMT.

column9:
Postman is a popular tool designed for developers and testers to streamline the process of building, testing, and managing APIs. It provides a user-friendly interface and a suite of features aimed at enhancing productivity and collaboration. Here's a quick overview of its key features:
Key Features of Postman:
1.	API Testing and Debugging: Easily create and execute API requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.) and inspect responses.
2.	Collections: Organize API requests into collections for better management and reusability.
3.	Environment Variables: Simplify testing by using variables to store values like base URLs, tokens, and parameters.
4.	Automated Testing: Write scripts for testing workflows and automate tests using Postman collections and monitors.
5.	Collaboration Tools: Share collections, environments, and documentation with your team through workspaces.
6.	Mock Servers: Simulate API responses without needing a live API, enabling faster development and testing.
7.	API Documentation: Automatically generate and maintain comprehensive API documentation.
8.	Postman API: Leverage Postman's own API to interact programmatically with your Postman data.
9.	Integrations: Connect Postman with tools like GitHub, Jenkins, and Slack for seamless workflows.
10.	Postman CLI: Use newman, Postman's command-line tool, to run collections in CI/CD pipelines.
Postman operates as a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform, offering cloud-based solutions for API development and collaboration. It simplifies the API lifecycle by providing tools for designing, testing, documenting, and sharing APIs

column1: GenAI Powered Service for Flight Crew Report (FCR)
column9:
Flight Crew Reports (FCRs) are instrumental in driving operational improvements, bolstering safety, and maximizing efficiency. Pilots utilize FCRs to provide crucial feedback on their flights, offering detailed accounts of incidents, irregularities, and valuable insights.
Misclassified Reports – Incorrect FCRs categorization can delay the response to critical issues, as the reports may not be routed to the appropriate departments promptly. Long text entries with incorrect categories can cause communication breakdowns, as the relevant information may not be easily accessible to the right personnel.

To address the request for a Generative AI (Gen AI) service for Flight Crew Reports using AWS services, the solution comprises two main components: a core FCR Gen AI Service built with AWS Bedrock, and an additional integration using Amazon Q Business and Amazon QuickSight for insights and visualization. Below is a comprehensive breakdown of how these requirements will be met and integrated into the FCR web application.

column40:
The current process uses middleware that retrieves agent data, schedule and Login/logout from Amazon connect, to files used by SAP to generate paychecks for resagents.  As a result of the middleware process, we process payrolls, and timekeepers use that data to reconcile and ensure compliance. This POC is intended to automate that reconciliation process. After the payroll run, the middleware sends a list of PPRs processed with warnings. Timekeepers review this list and compare data across Calabrio, SVOE-R, and SAP to correct schedules and ensure compliance. This iterative process continues until all PPRs are satisfactorily resolved. On an average, Timekeepers handle 400 PPRs daily.

The POC aims to leverage the AI capabilities of AWS-Q business to automate data comparison and provide meaningful insights, thereby freeing up Timekeepers to focus on more critical activities.



1.	Generative AI assistance for business intelligence
a.	Build Resops Payroll Data sets 
b.	Data Analysis and Transformation with Amazon Athena - 
i.	Connect Athena to Data Lake, use SQL queries in Athena to analyze the cataloged data, transform data into a new model, and create views to provide a logical representation of data
c.	Visualization and Insight with Amazon QuickSight - 
i.	Connect QuickSight to Athena and choose the tables to visualize, and create dashboards  
d.	Amazon Q business integrates cutting-edge generative AI technology into Amazon QuickSight, AWS's cloud-based business intelligence (BI) service. This enhancement provides a generative BI assistant, enabling them to create BI dashboards, visualizations, and complex calculations swiftly and intuitively using natural language.
2.	Operational insights from AWS Using Amazon Q Business

a.	Build Resops Payroll Data sets
b.	Payroll datasets are then indexed using the Amazon Q Business S3 connector. The Amazon Q Business S3 connector creates a searchable index of your AWS Support datasets, and gathers relevant important details related to keywords like case titles, descriptions, best practices, keywords, dates, and so on. 
c.	The generative AI capabilities of Amazon Q Business enable it to synthesize insights and generate natural language responses available for users in the Amazon Q Business web chat experience.

column40: Copilot is Microsoft's AI assistant designed to enhance productivity, creativity, and efficiency across Microsoft 365 applications like Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. By automating repetitive tasks, generating content, analyzing data, and offering intelligent suggestions, Copilot simplifies complex tasks and helps users work faster and more effectively.
column41: Copilot provides benefits by streamlining workflows, reducing manual effort, and speeding up decision-making. Since it's built right into Microsoft 365 tools, it helps users create content, analyze data, and manage communications more efficiently. This leads to increased productivity, quicker turnaround times, and better accuracy—freeing up individuals and teams to focus on higher-value, strategic work.
column42:
General Capabilities:
- Content Generation: Drafts emails, documents, and presentations based on prompts or existing content.
- Summarization: Summarizes long emails, documents, meeting notes, and chat threads.
- Data Analysis: Analyzes and visualizes data in Excel, including trends, forecasts, and pivot tables.
- Task Automation: Automates repetitive tasks like formatting, scheduling, and data entry.
- Smart Suggestions: Offers context-aware suggestions for writing, editing, and decision-making.
- Search & Insights: Pulls relevant information from files, emails, and chats using Microsoft Graph.
App-Specific Capabilities:
- Word: Writes, rewrites, summarizes, and edits text; generates reports or proposals from bullet points.
- Excel: Creates formulas, builds charts, explains data trends, and generates summaries.
- PowerPoint: Designs slides, generates speaker notes, and transforms documents into presentations.
- Outlook: Drafts emails, summarizes threads, and suggests replies.
- Teams: Summarizes meetings, generates action items, and helps with follow-ups. (Unless recording and transcription is enabled this will not work at Delta)
column43:
Interactions with Microsoft Copilot, including user prompts and Copilot’s responses, are stored at rest in the Local Region Geography based on the Microsoft 365 tenant’s sign-up country or region. For Delta, this means data is stored in the East US region, ensuring compliance with data residency requirements and supporting secure, region-specific data handling.

Microsoft Copilot is built with data privacy and security protections. It will not use our data (prompts, responses, or files) to train its AI models. All content stays within our Microsoft 365 environment and respects existing permissions, so users only see what they’re allowed to access.

column9: Amazon Q Business is the most capable generative AI-powered assistant for finding information, gaining insight, and taking action at work. column40:
The new version of pro.delta.com that is being delivered in Q4 2025 is being developed on Salesforce Experience Cloud and features a robust reporting suite via CRMA. The business wants to enable users to effortlessly find and understand the data that’s most relevant to them via a natural language search feature to provide account specific data from within the b2b platform (Delta Professional). Search capabilities will be limited to data from within the Delta Global Sales CRM (Salesforce) and Sales Decision Support databases.

Agency and Corporate accounts have requested improvement in search capabilities on the site that is comparable to Other Airline sites. Lack of accurate search result on the site drives more than 150k calls per year to the sales support center which requires agents to answer. Also inconsistent agent response to frequently ask questions leads to customer dissatisfaction and dropped bookings. AI assisted search is expected to deflect 450 calls per day and provide consistent accurate answers concerning account status, benefits, contract performance and Delta policies.

This requirement can be fulfilled via zero-retention architecture that leverages Q Business and Bedrock Agent.

column61:
1. Pilot Programs
•	Select Pilot Groups: Identify key members from Delta Pro to participate in pilot programs.
•	Monitor and Evaluate: Gather feedback from pilot groups and make necessary adjustments.
•	Showcase Results: Use positive outcomes from pilot programs to build confidence and encourage wider adoption.
2 Training and support
•	Comprehensive Training: Provide extensive training sessions and materials tailored to Delta Pro users.
•	Dedicated Support: Establish dedicated support channels to assist users with any issues or questions.
•	User Community: Create a user community or forum for Delta Pro users to share tips, ask questions, and collaborate.
3. Integration and Customization
•	Seamless Integration: Ensure Amazon Q Business integrates smoothly with existing systems and workflows.
•	Customization: Customize the platform to meet the specific needs of Delta Pro users.
•	Continuous Improvement: Regularly update and improve the platform based on user feedback and evolving needs.
5. Incentives and Recognition
•	Incentives: Offer incentives for early adopters within Delta Pro.
•	Recognition Programs: Implement recognition programs to highlight and reward users who effectively leverage Amazon Q Business.
6. Communication and Feedback
•	Regular Updates: Provide regular updates on new features, improvements, and success stories.
•	Feedback Loop: Establish a continuous feedback loop to gather user insights and make necessary adjustments.
•	Transparent Communication: Maintain transparent communication about the adoption process and any changes.
7. Evaluation and Scaling
•	Evaluate Success: Regularly evaluate the success of the adoption plan against predefined metrics.
•	Scale Up: Gradually scale up the adoption to include more members of Delta Pro based on the success of initial phases.
•	Long-Term Strategy: Develop a long-term strategy to ensure sustained use and continuous improvement of Amazon Q Business.
column62:
1.	Pilot Programs
o	Expand Pilot Groups: Increase the number of pilot groups to include diverse departments and roles within Delta Pro.
o	Detailed Monitoring: Implement robust monitoring tools to track usage, performance, and feedback from pilot groups.
o	Showcase Success Stories: Create detailed case studies and presentations to highlight the positive outcomes and benefits observed during the pilot phase.
2.	Training and Support
o	Advanced Training Modules: Develop advanced training modules for different levels of expertise, ensuring all users can maximize AWS Q Business capabilities.
o	24/7 Support: Establish round-the-clock support channels, including live chat, email, and phone support.
o	Interactive User Community: Foster an interactive user community with regular webinars, Q&A sessions, and forums to encourage collaboration and knowledge sharing.
3.	Integration and Customization
o	Enhanced Integration: Work closely with IT teams to ensure seamless integration with all existing systems, minimizing disruptions.
o	Tailored Customization: Continuously gather user feedback to refine and customize AWS Q Business features to better meet the specific needs of Delta Pro users.
o	Agile Improvement: Adopt an agile approach to continuously update and improve the platform based on evolving user needs and technological advancements.
4.	Incentives and Recognition
o	Reward Programs: Implement reward programs for early adopters and power users, including bonuses, gift cards, and public recognition.
o	Achievement Badges: Create a system of achievement badges to recognize users who effectively leverage AWS Q Business, fostering a sense of accomplishment and motivation.
5.	Communication and Feedback
o	Regular Newsletters: Send out regular newsletters with updates on new features, user tips, and success stories.
o	Feedback Surveys: Conduct periodic surveys to gather user insights and identify areas for improvement.
o	Transparent Updates: Maintain transparent communication about the adoption process, addressing any concerns and providing clear timelines for upcoming changes.
6.	Evaluation and Scaling
o	Performance Metrics: Define clear performance metrics to evaluate the success of the adoption plan, such as user engagement, productivity improvements, and ROI.
o	Gradual Scaling: Gradually scale up the adoption to include more members of Delta Pro, ensuring each phase is successful before expanding further.
o	Sustainable Strategy: Develop a long-term strategy to ensure sustained use and continuous improvement of AWS Q Business, including regular updates and ongoing support.

column9:
This Internally built application leverages AWS managed services—Connect, Lex V2, Bedrock, DynamoDB, and Lambda—together with Delta’s APIs and payment services to redirect flight-booking calls to an AI-driven Lex bot. The bot gathers all booking details (origin, destination, trip type, travel dates, preferred departure/return times, cabin class, etc.) and recommends optimal flight options. Once an itinerary is chosen, the system texts the customer a secure, mobile-friendly link to collect passenger information and complete payment.
The AI Based Flight Booking Lex Bot is intended to reduce and eliminate the time a customer service representative spends assisting customers with flight bookings, by using AI to guide the customer through a complete booking, look up flight information, and make ultimately make the customers' reservations.
The AI via Lex is a chatbot that uses natural language processing to understand customer questions and make reservations.
The bot will be able to handle a variety of customer questions, look up flight information when it collects enough information, suggest the best flight options, and make the reservation.

column65:
Analysis: Deploying an AI‑driven Lex booking bot has the potential to cut call‑handle time, deflect routine traffic from human agents, and create a modern self‑service channel that scales with demand. The MVP will confirm two critical points: (1) technical feasibility—latency, speech‑to‑intent accuracy, and payment hand‑off reliability within an all‑AWS stack; (2) economic viability—containment rate vs. agent savings and cloud cost. Positive results position the solution as a potential of integrating next-gen AI and modernizing current bot architecture.

Recommended action:  Deploy the MVP in a lower‑tier AWS environment and enable it only for calls that meet these business‑defined eligibility gates: gold members or above, travel date before 29 Sep, maximum 2 passengers, one‑way or round‑trip itineraries only, and credit‑card payment. Monitor accuracy, containment, latency, and cost before widening access.

Approved by Ali Khan

The in-house built application leverages Generative AI to map skills to jobs and generate position skills and interview questions based on trends and emerging skills. In addition, AI will be used for paraphrasing.
There GENAI solution will comprise of following 3 new capabilities for Hiring Mangers (users of the Position Assistant): 
1.	Skills generation: generate one position skill per job skill
2.	Interview question generation: generate five interview questions for each job skills and position description
3.	Paraphrasing: allow users to input text on job descriptions and receive a paraphrased version

The project is foundational to the Skills First strategy which is approved.

column65: The Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) is the world’s largest professional association focused on advancing the field of human resource management. While Delta Air Lines is not contributing content to this initiative, it is being referenced as a valuable source of HR-related practices and insights. It is important to note that SHRM does not provide Single Sign-On (SSO) or Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) capabilities as part of this solution. However, this is not a limitation, as the product is intended for a limited user base, and user management will be handled directly by the HR team, ensuring secure and efficient access control
column84: Vendor provides Service does not exchange data with Delta, therefore vendor contends they are not a SAAS, they are a membership association for the human resource profession. per SHRM: SHRM is not supporting Delta under a SaaS model. We are providing content and not exchanging information between our systems and Delta's systems or hosting any critical business information for Delta. They do not support SSO. Application Name & Blockcode: No. Mandate Description Evidence/ comments about how this is achieved S1 End-to-End Encryption - All data in transit and at rest must be encrypted, in compliance with our policies. This applies to data within the SaaS platform, and the integration or access to Delta systems. Data at rest is encyrpted with 256-bit AES encryption. TLS 1.2 is used to encrypt data in transit. S2 Authentication and Authorization S2.A: All Delta users must be authenticated by Global Auth, including MFA if required by Delta security standards. This requires a federated authentication integration with the SaaS provider. Delta does not have a direct integration into the SHRM membership services. Each user is provided with their own account that requires a user name and password to access. S2.B: Credentials used for outbound APIs (i.e. Delta to SaaS provider) must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Not Applicable. There is no API integration S2.C: All inbound APIs (i.e. SaaS provider to Delta) must be authorized using the Delta API Authorizer and must be processed through Akamai for our standard WAF and DDoS protection. Not Applicable. There is no API integration S2.D: Access to the SaaS solution, and roles within the SaaS solution must be controlled using AD groups managed by SailPoint, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved Not Applicable. Each Delta user is provided with a standard customer account. There are not varying roles assigned to Delta users. S2.E: Authorization controls within the SaaS solution must be managed to enforce least privilege. For example, general users should not have "tenant" admin privileges. Not Applicable. Each Delta user is provided with a standard customer account. There are not varying roles assigned to Delta users. S3 Cloud Access Security Broker - The SaaS solution must be integrated with the Delta CASB, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved. Not Applicable. There is no data being directly exchanged between the SHRM and Delta systems. Each Delta user is provided with a standard customer account to access content from the SHRM sites. S4 Direct Data Connections (this includes any direct data connectivity such as to databases, message queues, cache services, service bus, file systems, object stores, file transfers, etc.) S4.A: Inbound connections from the SaaS provider to Delta data sources directly via the Internet are not permitted. API, proxy, or other intermediary connectivity solutions must be included so the data sources do not need to be publicly accessible. Not Applicable. There is no connections to Delta data sources. S4.B: Credentials used to authenticate all direct data traffic must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Not Applicable. There is no connections to Delta data sources. S4.C: Data access controls, and data that is uploaded to the SaaS platform must be strictly limited to only the data necessary for the SaaS solution to function correctly. Not Applicable. There is no connections to Delta data sources. S5 Logging - The SaaS provider must offer logging or a way to view events for important transactions (e.g. logins, high-value transactions, administrative changes, etc.) Not Applicable. There is no connections to Delta data sources. S6 Restrict Network Access - The Delta tenant of the SaaS solution must only be accessible from the Delta network unless there is a business requirement to allow access from the public Internet. Not Applicable. There is no connections to Delta data sources.

Kiro IDE is an AI-powered integrated development environment (IDE) from AWS that provides advanced code editing capabilities with built-in AI assistance. It offers intelligent code completion, natural language to code generation, and multi-file editing with contextual awareness across entire codebases.
Implementation of Kiro IDE as the primary AI-powered development environment for Delta developers.

column40:
Kiro IDE is needed to provide our developers with a comprehensive, AI-powered development environment that goes beyond simple code completion. As a full IDE with integrated AI capabilities, Kiro IDE offers advanced features that significantly enhance developer productivity and code quality.
Key business drivers and technical reasons include: - Complete IDE replacement with built-in AI assistance, eliminating the need for separate tools and extensions - Advanced multi-file editing with contextual awareness across entire codebases - Natural language to code generation for rapid prototyping and development - Intelligent code refactoring and optimization suggestions - Integrated chat interface for real-time coding assistance and problem-solving - Enhanced codebase understanding and navigation capabilities - Reduced context switching by having all development tools in one unified environment - Support for modern development workflows and AWS service integration
column41:
Based on similar AI-powered IDE implementations, Kiro IDE can deliver significant productivity gains and cost savings:
•	30-40% reduction in development time through AI-assisted coding and intelligent autocomplete
•	Decreased onboarding time for new developers with built-in codebase understanding features
•	Reduced technical debt through AI-powered code optimization suggestions
•	Lower bug rates due to intelligent error detection and prevention
•	Improved developer satisfaction and retention by providing cutting-edge development tools
•	Consolidated tooling costs by replacing multiple separate tools with one integrated solution
•	Faster feature delivery through natural language to code capabilities
column42:
Kiro IDE offers comprehensive business capabilities as a full-featured AI-powered IDE:

•	Natural language to code generation allowing developers to describe functionality in plain English
•	Multi-file editing with contextual awareness across entire projects and repositories
•	Intelligent code completion that understands project context and coding patterns
•	Integrated chat interface for real-time coding assistance, debugging help, and architectural guidance
•	Advanced refactoring capabilities with AI-powered suggestions for code optimization
•	Built-in terminal and debugging tools with AI assistance
•	Seamless AWS service integration and deployment capabilities
•	Support for all major programming languages and frameworks
•	Collaborative features for team development with shared AI context

column65:
After reviewing the request for Kiro IDE, I recommend approval for implementation with a phased rollout approach. This AI-powered IDE represents a significant advancement in developer tooling that aligns with Delta’s digital transformation and developer experience initiatives.

The business case demonstrates strong potential ROI through projected 30-40% productivity gains and consolidated tooling costs. As an AWS product in tech preview, Kiro IDE offers Delta the opportunity to influence product development while gaining early access to cutting-edge AI development capabilities.
The solution adheres to both Delta’s AI Security Mandates and SaaS Security Mandates. The estimated cost of $25-30 per developer per month is reasonable given the comprehensive feature set and potential to replace multiple separate tools.

Key recommendations: 
1.	Start with a controlled pilot program (50 developers) in Q2 2025 
2.	Establish success metrics early to validate productivity claims 
3.	Develop comprehensive training program before mainstream rollout 
4.	Maintain existing IDE options during tech preview phase 
5.	Create feedback loop with AWS to influence product development
This implementation positions Delta at the forefront of AI-powered development practices while maintaining appropriate risk management through the phased approach.

column9:
Agentforce is a proactive, conversational AI solution, made up of autonomous agents, that sits on the Salesforce Platform.  

With Agentforce sitting on the Salesforce Platform it has secure access to Salesforce data through built-in access security controls of Profiles, Permissions and role-based security that can leverage the principle of least privilege.

Agentforce is integrated with a Trust Layer to mitigate Generative AI risks. The Trust Layer ensures that responses your agents generate are grounded in your trusted company data. And its zero-data retention policy means that your company and customer information will never be released into the wild.

The Trust Layer detects potentially harmful LLM responses and includes event log monitoring for transparency in each user interaction. Topic instructions that define agent behavior also act as guardrails to prevent hallucinations and malicious attacks. The record and field access agents have, are permissions-based and can be set for different agent types and actions.

column44:
Murf Ai is a similar product that is currently being used by the TechOps team. However, Learning and Development teams' business needs are not met by Murf AI, and it was determined that WellSaid Corps solution better meets the learning needs of L and D team. 

WellSaid Vs Muph AI: While WellSaid is great for English language eLearning, Murf.AI has the advantage if you are going to have your eLearning converted into a different language. Murf.AI is pay one price for all of the various languages that we use for our eLearning while WellSaid wanted to charge for the development of and the usage of each language. So, if you are just going to develop your eLearning in English then WellSaid is you program. For non-english languages, its Murf.AI.

WellSaid VS AWS Polly: Yes, WellSaid is an existing vendor that was missing on quality checks, and we are making sure it is properly vetted. Please note the AI technology is not a new offering but was part of the original implementation and use case. This is the preferred vendor for eLearning voiceovers in English.

As we already had a contract with this vendor, we did not consider an alternate vendor. This vendor was identified in the 2023 audit as a finding of a contract signed without proper vendor validation and we've been working since then to get this resolved.
column45:
We already have an existing contract with WellSaid Corp. WellSaid Corp vendor was identified in the 2023 audit as a finding of a contract signed without proper vendor validation and this STR is being presented to get this audit finding remediated.

We are considering AWS Polly as an alternate product. Demos with AWS team have been scheduled to understand Delta business needs and arrange subsequent deep dives with AWS Polly expert SMEs.

After a lot of experimentation with Amazon Nova Sonic and reading up on recent Polly improvements, I think Delta’s best option is to go with a third-party tool built specifically for this use case, like WellSaid. 
 
•	As of today, Nova Sonic is built for speech-to-speech use cases, where the model decides how to respond. While you can influence it with prompting and tooling, it’s not deterministic in nature and would not lend itself well to scripted training uses cases.
•	The recent Polly improvements have been focused on additional languages and voices, nothing that is substantially different from the POC last fall.

This integral feature to the recognition engine will provide flexibility and adaptability to business needs and guide conversations for flight attendants when interacting with passengers. This feature will provide critical context and a custom script to interact with passengers and elevate their personalized experience when doing a recognition.

column9: Apache Superset is a modern, enterprise-ready open-source data exploration and visualization platform. It combines a powerful no-code chart builder with a state-of-the-art SQL IDE (SQL Lab), offers a lightweight semantic layer for reusable datasets and metrics, built-in caching, granular role-based access control, plugin-based extensibility, and native connectivity to over 40 SQL-speaking databases at petabyte scale
column25:
5/30/25: STR approved
Pending item: PIA
column40:
Business Drivers
•	Cost Efficiency: Avoid the high per‐query and storage costs of Athena + QuickSight and the licensing fees of Power BI. Superset is fully open source, eliminating vendor lock-in and reducing ongoing BI expenses.
•	Speed to Insight: Empower analysts with immediate, self-service dashboard creation—no waiting on costly integrations or IT provisioning.
•	Data Accessibility: Leverage our existing DynamoDB stores directly to tap into real-time PaaS metrics without ETL overhead.
Technical Reasons
•	Direct DynamoDB Connectivity: Use open-source query engines to query DynamoDB tables in place, sidestepping expensive data transfers.
•	Lightweight Deployment: Runs in containers with minimal dependencies—can be stood up via Helm charts or Docker Compose in hours.
•	Scalability & Performance: Built-in caching layers and async query support keep dashboards responsive at scale.
•	Extensibility: Custom visualizations, authentication, and theming via plugins let us tailor Superset to our ecosystem
column41:
By adopting Apache Superset for our PaaS reporting, we realize immediate, tangible savings and strategic advantages:
•	Cost Avoidance: Eliminates cost to power bi or AWS quick insights.
•	Zero Marginal Costs: As an open-source solution with no per-user or per-query charges, every additional dashboard or user adds no incremental expense.
•	Faster Time-to-Insight: Analysts can stand up new dashboards in hours rather than days, accelerating data-driven decisions, reducing project cycle times, and enabling quicker response to operational events.
column42: Superset empowers our teams to turn raw operational data into actionable insights. Being able to quickly understand what is provisioned in the environment
column43: All analytics data remains entirely within our AWS environment. Superset persists only lightweight metadata—dashboard definitions, user roles, and optional cache entries—in a Postgres backing store and a Redis cache. All query execution, caching, and dashboard rendering occur inside the ROSA environment, ensuring that no data at rest or in motion ever leaves the Delta environment.

column9: The monday.com software product is a Work Operating System (Work OS) that enables teams to build, run, and scale workflows and projects with ease. monday.com is a cloud-based platform designed to help teams manage tasks, projects, and workflows in a highly customizable and collaborative environment. It provides visual tools and automation to streamline work across departments.
column25: Business Unit is ROCE - Reservation Operations and Customer Engagement​
column40:
Monday.com is in production and never went through the governance process. The team is seeking an incremental change to integrate Outlook to the platform.
Monday.com is a cloud-based Work Operating System (Work OS) designed to help organizations centralize and streamline their work management processes. It addresses key business needs such as improving visibility, accountability, and collaboration across teams, while supporting scalability and remote work. By offering customizable workflows, real-time dashboards, and automation tools, it enables faster decision-making and reduces reliance on fragmented systems. Technically, Monday.com stands out with its no-code/low-code interface, robust integration capabilities, and developer-friendly tools like APIs and webhooks. It also meets enterprise-grade security and compliance standards, making it suitable for businesses of all sizes and industries. Overall, Monday.com empowers teams to work more efficiently, adapt quickly, and maintain alignment across complex projects and operations. 
​​The integration of monday.com with Outlook can significantly enhance Delta Air Lines' operational efficiency by streamlining communication and automating workflows. It allows emails and calendar events to be seamlessly converted into actionable tasks within monday.com, improving task tracking, cross-department collaboration, and response times. This leads to better coordination, reduced manual work, and improved service delivery across the organization.​
column41:
​​Implementing Monday.com provides significant business benefits by streamlining work management and enhancing team collaboration. It boosts productivity by automating repetitive tasks and centralizing communication, allowing teams to focus on high-value activities. The platform fosters transparency and accountability through clear task ownership and real-time status updates, which helps reduce delays and miscommunication. With customizable dashboards and data visualization tools, decision-makers gain immediate insights into project progress and resource allocation, enabling faster and more informed decisions. Monday.com also supports scalability, adapting to the needs of growing teams and complex workflows, while its cloud-based accessibility makes it ideal for remote and hybrid work environments. Overall, it empowers organizations to operate more efficiently, stay aligned across departments, and respond quickly to changing business needs.​ 
​​The integration of monday.com with Outlook can significantly enhance Delta Air Lines' operational efficiency by streamlining communication and automating workflows.
column42: Monday.com offers a comprehensive suite of business capabilities that support efficient work management and cross-functional collaboration. It enables teams to manage projects and tasks through customizable workflows, timelines, and dependencies, while automating repetitive actions like status updates and approvals to save time and reduce errors. The platform enhances communication by centralizing discussions, file sharing, and updates within tasks, eliminating the need for scattered tools. It also supports resource and capacity planning by providing visibility into team workloads, helping managers allocate resources effectively. With built-in dashboards and reporting tools, businesses can visualize key metrics and make data-driven decisions. Monday.com extends its functionality to CRM and sales pipeline management, time tracking, document management, and even custom app development through its open API and integration capabilities. These features make it a versatile solution for aligning departments, improving productivity, and scaling operations across the organization.
column43: ​​Monday.com stores and processes customer data using the Vendor Hosted Cloud Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure, with data centers located in multiple global regions to support performance, compliance, and data residency requirements. By default, most customer data is hosted in the United States, specifically in the AWS Northern Virginia region. However, Monday.com also offers data residency options in the European Union for enterprise customers and for certain users who signed up after January 2023, ensuring compliance with regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Some accounts in the Asia-Pacific region may also be hosted locally, although Japanese accounts are typically hosted in the U.S. All data is encrypted both in transit and at rest, and Monday.com adheres to strict security standards, including SOC 2 Type II, ISO/IEC 27001, and HIPAA. This infrastructure ensures that customer data is handled securely and in accordance with regional compliance requirements.​
column44: Monday.com has several comparable alternatives that organizations like Delta Air Lines may already use or have approved. Tools such as Microsoft Project and Microsoft Planner are commonly adopted in enterprise environments due to their deep integration with Microsoft 365 and robust project planning features. Smartsheet is another strong alternative, offering a spreadsheet-like interface with powerful automation and reporting capabilities, often favored for its flexibility and compliance readiness. Asana and ClickUp provide intuitive task and workflow management, while Wrike excels in project portfolio management and resource planning. Other options like Airtable and Trello offer more lightweight, visual approaches to task tracking, and Notion combines documentation with task management for knowledge-centric teams. For enterprise-grade needs, Adobe Workfront and ServiceNow are often used for managing complex workflows, particularly in marketing, IT, and operations. These tools offer varying levels of customization, scalability, and integration, making them viable alternatives depending on the specific needs and existing infrastructure of the organization.

column9:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol that enables seamless integration between LLM applications and external data sources and tools. It standardizes how applications provide context to LLMs. MCP provides a standardized way to connect AI models to different data sources and tools. It helps build agents and complex workflows on top of LLMs. MCP provides a standardized way for applications to:
1. Pre-built integrations that LLMs can directly plug into
2. Share contextual information with language models
3. Expose tools and capabilities to AI systems
4. Build composable integrations and workflows
5. Best practices for securing your data within your infrastructure

column40: CCoE is creating an MCP Server that can run in devspaces and be used by Q CLI, that can provide documentation resources related to specific constructs.
column41:
These servers enable Large Language Models (LLMs) to securely access tools and data sources and enables standardized integration between AI models and tools. The goal of an MCP server is to abstract over common LLM-driven workflows:
1. Prompt execution with variable injection
2. Session tracking and context persistence
3. Calling tools (shell commands, APIs, or internal functions)
4. Searching memory — both vector and structured
5. Switching LLMs on demand

column1: ​​Salesforce Marketing Cloud – Einstein Send Time Optimization (STO)​
column9: ​​Einstein Send Time Optimization (STO) is a feature within Salesforce Marketing Cloud that uses artificial intelligence to determine the optimal time to send marketing emails to each individual recipient. By analyzing historical engagement data, STO predicts when users are most likely to open and interact with emails, helping improve engagement rates and campaign performance.​
column25:
6/10/25: STR approved

Einstein Send Time Optimization (STO) is a native Salesforce Platform feature. This feature leverages AI/ML to analyze historical engagement data and predict the optimal time to deliver emails to recipients.

The diagram attached shows two aspects of the STO feature. The top process "Process for Sending Email Campaigns in Salesforce Marketing Cloud with & Without STO" outlines the people and systems involved in using this feature to illustrate it in a business context. The key element to highlight is the STO Score Assignment subprocess below the first diagram. As shown in the expanded diagram, the model can be run in two ways:
•	Using local (Delta-only) engagement data
•	Using a broader, anonymized dataset from all Salesforce customers (our preferred option)
Opting into the global model provides a richer dataset, which is especially beneficial when sending to new recipients without prior engagement history.

column9:
Agentforce is a proactive, conversational AI solution, made up of autonomous agents, that sits on the Salesforce Platform.   
 
With Agentforce sitting on the Salesforce Platform it has secure access to Salesforce data through built-in access security controls of Profiles, Permissions and role-based security that can leverage the principle of least privilege. 
 
Agentforce is integrated with a Trust Layer to mitigate Generative AI risks. The Trust Layer ensures that responses your agents generate are grounded in your trusted company data. And its zero-data retention policy means that your company and customer information will never be released into the wild. 
 
The Trust Layer detects potentially harmful LLM responses and includes event log monitoring for transparency in each user interaction. Topic instructions that define agent behavior also act as guardrails to prevent hallucinations and malicious attacks. The record and field access agents have, are permissions-based and can be set for different agent types and actions.

column9: This is a pilot initiative aimed at enhancing voice of the customer (VoC) verbatim text analysis using generative AI capabilities. The project focuses on automating comment summarization, categorization, and trend identification to derive deeper insights from customer feedback. The team would like to use Bedrock for this Pilot and the following account will need access: aws account cust-insight-dev-559749451084 (559749451084).
column25:
6/18/25: PIA-37452503 approved
6/10/25: STR approved

Business Unit: Customer Experience Design (CXD)
column40:
Problem Statement: 

Our leaders rely heavily on data-driven decision-making. However, current tools and processes are not equipped to handle the scale, complexity, and speed required for analyzing qualitative text data such as customer verbatims. We need a scalable, secure, and easily integrable solution that enables advanced natural language capabilities—such as summarization, categorization, and sentiment detection—to extract actionable insights from unstructured textual data.

Example of data requests:  Teams frequently need to process large volumes of customer comments to uncover key themes, summarize feedback, and identify emerging sentiment. For instance, we may want to assess customer sentiment related to a specific KPI, while support teams need to categorize feedback to prioritize product or service improvements. These tasks require advanced natural language understanding and generation capabilities that exceed the functionality of traditional analytics tools.

How this is currently Handled:  Currently, we leverage model developed by Delta's Enterprise AI team, as we don’t own the process, its not scalable. When deeper insights are needed, team relies on data scientists to build custom models or scripts, which delays delivery and limits agility. There is no scalable platform for deploying generative AI models across teams.

Solution That Leverages AWS Bedrock:
By adopting AWS Bedrock, we can access a variety of foundation models (FMs) from leading providers (e.g., Anthropic, Meta, Stability AI) through a fully managed API-based service. This allows us to build and scale generative AI applications—such as comment summarization, feedback categorization, and sentiment detection—without managing infrastructure or training models from scratch.
1.	Model Flexibility and Choice:  Access to multiple foundation models for different use cases (text, image, chat, etc.)
2.	No Infrastructure Overhead: Fully managed service with no need to provision or maintain servers
3.	Customizability: Support for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and fine-tuning for domain-specific use
4.	Enterprise-Grade Security and Scalability: Built-in compliance, encryption, and access controls. Scales with usage and demand
column41:
1.	 Improved Decision-Making:
•	Real-time insights from unstructured data
•	Faster identification of customer needs and pain points
2.	Operational Efficiency:
•	Reduces manual effort in analyzing and categorizing feedback
•	Frees up analysts and support teams to focus on high-value tasks
3.	Cost Savings:
•	Pay-as-you-go model eliminates upfront infrastructure costs
•	Reduces reliance on specialized AI/ML resources
column42:
What are the specific business capabilities this product offers?
 Optimizes the customers verbatim analysis process, enabling the team to provide timely and actionable insights to leaders on a large scale.

column45:
Custom Model Development from Scratch:
In-House Development:  Developing custom generative AI models from scratch. This approach requires significant investment in infrastructure, specialized talent, and time to build, train, and deploy models. It also introduces challenges around scalability, security, and ongoing maintenance. Compared to AWS Bedrock’s fully managed, scalable, and secure platform, building in-house models would delay time-to-value and increase operational complexity.

column9:
Use Case Walkthrough:
Signifi Solutions is a vendor supplying smart modular locker system solutions to manage and track important assets available to users 24/7. Inflight Services Flight Attendant SkyPro loaner program leverages this solution ensuring that Flight Attendants have their operationally required SkyPro available for each flight. From an IFS base, a Flight Attendant approaches a Signifi kiosk. They will use the Emplifi solution (see Emplifi) to create a video chat session from the onboard tablet exposed within the kiosk. A SkyProfessor from the SkyPro Operations Support Center receives the chat request and validates the identity of the Flight Attendant. The SkyProfessor uses Impravata (GroundControl) to select and configure a device for the flight attendant. Impravata will call Omnissa Workspace ONE to retrieve the most recent configuration for the IFS Loaner Device. Once the device is configured, Impravata calls a Signifi API to release the appropriate drawer to the Flight Attendant. The Flight Attendant retrieves the device from the kiosk and continues to their flight.

When the loaner is no longer required, at any IFS base, the Flight Attendant will return to a Signifi kiosk. They will use Emplifi to create a video session. The SkyProfessor receives the chat and validates the identity of the Flight Attendant. The SkyProfessor will use Impravata to select a drawer and release the lock. The Flight Attendant will open the drawer and plug the device into the available charging cable. The Flight Attendant's loaner is marked returned and they continue with their day. Impravata will wipe the returned loaner and update iOS, if required.

Technology: 
Vision UI - Signifi software that is available to users to manage the kiosk transactions, but is replaced by the Emplifi interaction with the SkyProfessor. The kiosk runs a Chromium browser app using Ubuntu LTS. The kiosk software does not save any data locally beyond cached data for the kiosk cameras. All transactional data is sent/retrieved real time with their Vision Server. 
Vision Portal UI - Signifi companion back office software used by the cabinet administrator to configure the kiosk. A web application that manages users, transactions, and products. The SkyProfessor support team will have access to support the kiosks via this application. Control is enforced by user authentication and roles/groups. The Portal UI will be integrated with Delta SSO.
Vision Server - Central tool used for data aggregation and distribution. The server software has a heartbeat to the kiosk enabled to inform the server about the kiosk status. All transactions between the server and kiosk are executed using HTTPS with TLS 1.2 or 1.3. The servers run on ubuntu server with a PostgreSQL database. Data is encrypted at rest using full disk partition encryption (256-bit keys).

Signifi Solutions is approved for PCI compliance and undergoes annual penetration tests and assessments for their server and kiosk solutions. The Signifi IT team self-scans their production servers biweekly. Signifi undergoes SOC 2 Type II audits yearly.
column25:
Signifi is a solution is already used by Flight Operations under iServer D0022692 / CRMCDVMPDL.

Technology Descriptions:
* Signifi - Hardware provider. Provides a secured cabinet that houses Flight Attendant devices. It is composed of 16-32 locked drawers, appropriate charging cords for the support device, a charging hub, 2 internal Delta Windows computers (1 with Emplifi and Impravata installed), 1 with Signifi installed) with an exposed tablet for each.
* Emplifi (formerly Astute) - Video and ticketing software solution used by the Flight Attendant and the SkyProfessor
* Impravata (formerly GroundControl) - software solution that interacts with the USB hub to charge, monitor, and maintain Flight Attendant devices. Able to remotely issue commands to wipe, restore, and configure connected devices

We are evaluating AI Security tools.  We previously evaluated Protect AI, and we need to evaluate the next vendor product, which is Cisco AI Defense.  There are 12 primary use cases and 3 qualitative factors we're evaluating:
1. API-based runtime scanning of AI workloads to identify security weaknesses
2. SDK-based runtime scanning of AI workloads to identify security weaknesses
3. Agent-based runtime scanning of AI workloads to identify security weaknesses
4. Network-based runtime scanning of AI workloads to identify security weaknesses
5. Inspect 1st Party AI/ML models for security weaknesses within MLOps pipelines and ad-hoc
6. Inspect 3rd Party AI/ML models for security weaknesses within MLOps pipelines and ad-hoc
7. Policy enforcement to block insecure AI/ML model use and processing at runtime and in pipelines
8. Automated red-team testing of AI /ML models and applications
9. Threat intelligence to enable research about known security weaknesses in AI/ML models
10. Visibility of end-user AI usage
11. Logging and alerting to enable incident response
12. Dashboards and reporting for communication and prioritization

Qualitative: Ease of integration with AWS services and platforms
Qualitative: Comprehensive coverage for all Security Weaknesses
Qualitative: Ease of hosting, operating, and using
