column40:
AI technologies include a variety of new security weaknesses.  We need an ability to identify and block these:

- Prompt injection (many variations)
- Malicious usability
- Jailbreaking
- Hallucinations
- Bias
- Model DoS
- Excessive agency
- Model inversion
- Guardrail evasion
- Improper output handling
- Model theft
- Model poisoning
- 3rd Party data
- Supply chain vulnerabilities
column41: By reducing the frequency and severity of these weaknesses within our applications, we reduce the risk of our data being used inappropriately, malicious use of AI technologies, and breaking guardrails to expose our technologies.
column42:
- Runtime AI Scanning
- Model Scanning
- Augmented Red-Teaming

CSAT Feedback Analyser is a AI based tool or system designed to process and interpret Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) feedback,  to extract meaningful insights.

The main goal is to analyze customer comments collected through CSAT surveys and generate a report highlighting pain points, issues, and areas for improvement. This helps businesses understand customer sentiment and take data-driven actions.

column40: We often collect Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) feedback through surveys, but manually analyzing open-ended customer comments is time-consuming, inconsistent, and prone to oversight. Traditional methods may miss critical insights hidden in qualitative data, such as recurring pain points or emerging issues. There is a growing need for an intelligent, automated solution that can efficiently process large volumes of feedback, identify sentiment trends, and extract actionable insights. The CSAT Feedback Analyzer addresses this gap by leveraging AI to transform raw customer feedback into meaningful, structured intelligence.
column41: The CSAT Feedback Analyzer empowers businesses to make data-driven decisions by providing clear visibility into customer sentiment and satisfaction trends. By automatically identifying pain points, recurring issues, and areas for improvement, the tool helps organizations enhance customer experience, reduce churn, and prioritize product or service enhancements. It also improves operational efficiency by reducing the manual effort required for feedback analysis, enabling faster response times and more strategic planning.
column42:
Automated Sentiment Analysis
Detects positive, negative, and neutral sentiments in customer comments using natural language processing (NLP).

Theme and Topic Extraction
Identifies recurring themes, topics, and keywords in feedback to highlight common customer concerns or praise.

Pain Point Detection
Flags specific issues or frustrations mentioned by customers, helping prioritize areas for improvement.

Trend Analysis Over Time
Tracks changes in customer sentiment and feedback themes over time to monitor the impact of business decisions.

Customizable Dashboards and Reports
Generates visual reports and dashboards tailored to different departments (e.g., product, support, marketing).

Real-Time Feedback Processing
Analyzes incoming feedback in real time, enabling quicker responses to emerging issues.

column85: CSAT Feedback analyzer complies with Delta’s AI governance and security standards: • Information Security: Compliant with Delta’s InfoSec Policies, Standards, and Amber/Emerald mandates. • Path to Production: Follows Delta’s Path to Production deployment process. • Secure Architecture: Built with Zero Trust and secure-by-design principles. • Risk Alignment: AI usage aligns with Delta’s risk tolerance, with human-in-the-loop controls where required. • Restricted Data Protection: All models and training data are classified and protected per Delta’s “Restricted” data classification. • Monitoring & Logging: Provides visibility into AI decisioning and supports anomaly and drift detection. • Version Control & Testing: Supports versioned rule sets and AI configurations with testing for robustness and accuracy. • Auditability: AI decisions and actions are traceable for compliance and audit purposes.

column9: ICoupon is a digital voucher technology solution that will be used when Delta is required to give meal voucher compensation to customers for a delayed or cancelled flight. ACS piloted iCoupon in CDG/YUL for 90 days, and saw significant CX gains, positive employee feedback, and meal cost savings as DL is only billed what customers actually consume vs. a flat fee. Because of the successful pilot, ACS would like to roll out iCoupon to additional stations to drive CX gains and cost savings across the international network.
column25:
8/5/25: STR #1506 was a duplicate of this request and has been deleted
6/10/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA, contract execution
Request STR for mainline adoption after successful Pilot
column40: ​​Many international stations issue meal vouchers manually via DLTerm. A digital solution would save the frontline team a lot of time and reduce reliance on DLTerm since we no longer train against that tool. The solution increases CX by allowing customers to use their existing boarding pass as a voucher, vs. standing in line to receive a paper voucher. It increases internal controls by offering accountability and fraud prevention for Delta’s service recovery dollars. ​
column41: ​​ ​Airports could fulfill the legal requirement to distribute meal vouchers in a timely fashion without further disrupting the operation. The platform only bills DL what customers actually redeem (vs. a flat fee per paper voucher in some stations), potentially reducing DL’s meal cost/IROP event. ​​
column42: ​​ ​Agents can issue meal vouchers to an entire flight of customers or to individuals. The customers’ boarding pass becomes the voucher and retailers are able to scan the boarding pass barcode to redeem the monetary value. To activate the voucher, agents use the iCoupon platform to input the causing flight number, date, and applicable BCNs or segment numbers (whether the issuance is for a full flight or individual customers). This information is read by the iCoupon scanner at the retailer to apply the monetary value from the voucher. ​
column43: ​​The data will be stored and processed by the vendor tool. iCoupon is based in the United Kingdom. ​
column44: ​​ Domestic stations use an HMT tool, owned by TAConnections which distributes digital vouchers to customers. This tool is not able to be used for International stations.
column45: ​​ INTL stations would continue to have to manually distribute meal vouchers per customer via DLTerm OR rely on current vendors who distribute paper vouchers to customer which has high risk associated to it as customers can just exchange paper vouchers as they please. This is extremely time consuming and a negative customer experience. Our international hubs need technology to support effectively handling customers during IROPs today. We do not have an internal DL built IROP solution to handle any meal vouchers, hotels, or transportation needs. Vendors are a requirement unless internal DL IT can build a tool (which we’ve previously asked and been denied). It is an operational and legal requirement that we distribute vouchers when there is a DL fault cancellation or delay of 3+ hours.
column46: ​​ ​There is no integration with DL systems beyond MFA/SSO. Costs are within the agreed upon contract for service use. There is no implementation fee since we are accessing from the URL and not integrating.​
column49: ​Station leaders will just need to manage access to the tool as agents quit or are hired
column51: ​There should be no IT support needed since there is no integration. Station leaders would only need to manage access.​
column58:
f this tool is not approved, will need to continue using paper vouchers in several international stations. There is a higher chance of fraud associated with paper vouchers.  

​ 

​The proposed vendor tool will provide compensation via boarding pass in a timely manner and prevent fraud associated with paper vouchers.
column61: ​​Piloted for 90 days in CDG/YUL, and received positive employee/customer feedback and meaningful cost savings vs. incumbent vendor. Will roll out to interested stations in Europe and those using paper vouchers in Phase 1, then expanding to other interested stations in Phase 2. ​
column62: Based on the success of the pilot in CDG/YUL, ACS will expand iCoupon to stations that have sufficient coverage by the vendor’s retail/restaurant network and that are interested in using the solution in place of their current vendor/process. ACS has already prioritized stations that meet this criteria into 3 rollout phases, with rollout planned to begin this summer.
column63: The vendor only covers ~35% of international stations (mainly in Europe, Canada, and South America), but ~50% of international passengers.
column65:
​​ACS would like to leverage iCoupon for inconvenienced passengers. International stations will be able to choose if they want to use iCoupon for their meal vouchers, as iCoupon covers ~60% of total stations (including international hubs). Our partners Air France uses iCoupon in CDG today among other airlines. Delta customers were being provided service via iCoupon while AirFrance ground handled DL thru their systems.  

​ 

​Pilot in CDG/YUL was well recieved and has proven iCoupon to be effective in servicing inconvenienced passengers.​

Dinova works like a preferred air, car or hotel program.  They have 24K+ restaurants in Canada and the US for Corporate Travel employees to choose from.  When employees dine in one of these restaurants Delta will earn rebates for their transactions.  

Employees can voluntarily sign up for the myDinova Rewards Loyalty program to earn points for every dollar spent that can be redeemed for gift cards or donated to a charity.  Signing up for myDinova Rewards Loyatly program requires the user to connect their account to spending by providing their AMEX corporate card information.

Rebates are based on the percentage of spend in the dining program and on a 1-10% sliding scale of the total check

No integration with Delta.  The following data is collected from American Express on a monthly basis:  Minimal transaction details (amount, date, last 4 digits of CC), Restaurant name, address, and merchant category code.

column9: Monte Carlo is a data observability platform designed to help organizations detect, troubleshoot, and resolve data issues efficiently. It provides automated monitoring for data pipelines, ensuring reliability for analytics.
column40: Monte Carlo is essential in an AWS environment for data observability, ensuring reliable data pipelines across services like AWS Glue, S3, and Lambda. It helps organizations detect anomalies, troubleshoot issues, and maintain data integrity without manual intervention. Monte Carlo integrates with AWS Glue Metastore to catalog and monitor data assets, providing automated freshness checks, schema monitoring, and query insights. Additionally, AWS offers serverless solutions for running Monte Carlo simulations at scale using Step Functions and Lambda, reducing infrastructure complexity

column9:
Agentforce for Developers assists you throughout the Salesforce development process with expertise learned from anonymized code patterns. Our suite of AI-powered developer tools increases productivity and provides helpful assistance for complex coding tasks. We enforce development best practices with code generation and our suite of recommended static analysis and security scanning tools. With boilerplate code generation as its foundation, AI-assisted tooling also makes it easier for new developers to onboard to the Salesforce Platform. 
 
Dev Assistant: Code with ease with the help of your Dev Assistant right beside you. Get started with code generation and Salesforce development by asking for assistance. With the help of convenient slash commands, you can also target specific tasks like understanding unfamiliar code, and improving your code documentation. 

 
Command Palette: Use the Agentforce: Generate Code command in the VS Code Command Palette to enter a question about what you want to build. Agentforce will give you Apex code suggestions right in your editor. 

Inline Code Completions: As you type, Agentforce for Developers can suggest code completions, without any interruptions to your workflow. Easily pick the suggestion that works for you. Use this feature in Apex and LWC (JavaScript, CSS, and HTML) files. 
 
Test Case Generation: Use Agentforce for Developers to easily create unit test cases for your Apex methods and LWC components. Quickly get to required Apex test coverage and get your code ready for deployment.

column85: Salesforce's Large Language Models Agentforce for Developers is powered by customized Large Language Models (LLMs) developed by Salesforce. These models are CodeGen2.5 and xGen-Code. CodeGen2.5 A member of the growing family of Salesforce CodeGen models, CodeGen2.5 shows that a small model, if trained well, can achieve surprisingly good performance. This model powers our Inline Autocomplete feature. SFR Model Dev Assistant leverages our LLM known as SFR model. It has been fine-tuned to specifically handle code-related tasks and support interactive features such as chat. SFR model is well-equipped to handle tasks that require deeper code understanding and more complex reasoning.

Data is stored and processed according to the Tricentis cloud security policy. qTest SaaS is hosted in a logically segmented AWS Virtual Private Cloud controlled by Tricentis. All customers only have access to their own data which is logically separated from other customers. All data that transferred from a customer’s datacenter to the
Tricentis cloud is encrypted over untrusted networks. The encryption is based on the FIPS 140-2 standard. Data at rest is encrypted at the block level using AES-256. Data is maintained for the duration of an agreement and removed within 60 days of contract termination

column9:
Proof of Concept. We will send Calculum an Excel file of data. They will evaluate the data and return a result.

The tool is an online platform, using AI, that provides insights from industry and banking data regarding what net payment terms various suppliers and classes of suppliers are agreeing to in their contracts. SCM CoE is considering the value of this data and the platform to inform Delta's Net Payment Terms goals and strategies.
The vendor has performed an on-site demo of the tool and offers a zero-dollar ($0) proof of concept that will allow Delta to see what their analysis returns from our data base of vendors and spend.

We want to make sure an evaluation agreement is in place that includes considerations around Delta being able to send some or all of the population of Corp-SCM supplier names and associated spend for 2024 to Calculum for evaluation. This will help Delta determine the size of the prize and if further engagement with the vendor is worthwhile.

Delta will send an encrypted MS Excel file via FTP with the password provided in a separate email.

Global MFA will not be setup for the PoC but will be if the solution is moved to production.

Vendor confirmed they would perform the following steps once we request data to be deleted: Once we receive a written request to delete the data, we will confirm receipt, and within 2 business days, I will send a follow-up confirmation after our IT team completes the data destruction.
Regarding proof of deletion, the industry standard relies on a trust-based framework, as there is no objective technical method to independently verify data destruction. However, as an alternative, we are happy to sign a formal data deletion statement, which is commonly accepted by legal and compliance teams.

column1: CoCounsel by ThomsonReuters with CoCounsel Drafting, an MS Word Add-In, and MS Outlook and MS Teams Add-Ins
column9:
The Law Department will conduct a pilot of 5 AI chatbots, ultimately selecting one or a few to perform specific tasks within the Law Department.  CoCounsel is one of the 5 pilot participants

Thomson Reuters CoCounsel Core is a legal AI assistant that helps legal professionals rapidly pinpoint key knowledge, communicate complex information, and complete essential everyday tasks. Created for the exacting needs of the legal industry, its wide range of capabilities includes document review, contract analysis, summarization, and more. Over 1,400 law firms, government organizations, and corporate legal departments use CoCounsel Core to provide advice with unwavering confidence, expertly manage risk, and achieve more in less time. 

CoCounsel by Thomson Reuters is a secure, cloud-native legal AI assistant that integrates with Microsoft Word and supports SSO via SAML 2.0 or OIDC. It helps legal teams draft, review, and summarize documents using trusted content from Westlaw and Practical Law.

User data is encrypted in transit and at rest, never used to train AI models, and remains under user control. CoCounsel uses Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and includes source citations for transparency.  RAG is a technique which improves AI models by having them retrieve information from an external knowledge base before generating a response.

The Law Department is also going to use CoCounsel Drafting, an MS Word Add-In, and MS Outlook and MS Teams, available in the Microsoft App Store.

To evaluate the effectiveness of CoCounsel, Harvey AI, and GC AI, Delta’s Law Department will measure success across four key dimensions: (1) task efficiency, (2) output quality, (3) ease of user adoption, and (4) productivity enablement. Each tool will be tested against high-impact legal workflows such as first-pass contract review, clause extraction, legal research, and litigation brief drafting. 
(1)	Efficiency will be measured by the anecdotal reduction in turnaround time for these tasks, with a target of at least 30% anecdotal improvement overline baseline. 
(2)	Output quality will be assessed through pilot participant review, with particular consideration of correctness and alignment with internal standards.
(3)	User adoption will be anecdotally tracked through usage frequency, repeat engagement, and satisfaction scores. 
(4)	Productivity enablement will focus on how well each tool supports scalable legal support, reduces manual effort, and enhances transparency in legal reasoning. 
The vendor that demonstrates the strongest alignment with legal workflows, delivers measurable efficiency gains, and earns the highest user confidence will be selected for broader implementation. This approach ensures the chosen solution not only meets technical expectations but also empowers legal teams to operate with greater agility, compliance, and innovation.

The pilot will involve approximately 15 users from the Law Department.

The MS Add-ins probably won't install through Radia, but rather via Office 365
column25: The data contained herein is for consideration for the Law Department's AI Chatbot Pilot.  Should this application be selected, it is our understanding another STR will be completed for consideration as a permanent solution
column40:
The AI chatbots are required for:
1.	General purpose, specifically for the legal function
2.	Legal productivity tool: perform first pass contract review (redlining)
3.	Writing a brief for a litigator

The Law Department is seeking an AI-powered general purpose chatbot and legal productivity solution that is purpose-built for legal professionals. While Copilot in Bing features general functionality, the legal field requires a specialized tool featuring RAG and other fine-tuning based on legal training data.  
 
These tools have specialized functionality, such as: 
 
1.	General purpose conversational chatbots, like ChatGPT or Copilot in Bing, but specifically trained for the legal function; and 
2.	Legal productivity tool: perform first pass contract review (redlining) and write a brief for a litigator.
column41:
The chatbot(s) will provide a more efficient method of doing business, particularly with contracts and other legal tasks.
The Delta Law Department is exploring the adoption of an AI-powered cloud-based legal technology platform to enhance operational efficiency, reduce costs, and support strategic legal initiatives. These tools are designed to automate high-volume, low-complexity legal tasks—such as contract review, document drafting, and legal research—thereby freeing attorneys to focus on higher-value advisory and risk management work. 
 
By accelerating legal workflows and minimizing manual review time, such platforms can help optimize internal legal bandwidth, reduce reliance on outside counsel, and improve turnaround times. This aligns with Delta’s broader enterprise goals of innovation, agility, and cost efficiency. 
 
AI legal tools built for enterprise use typically deliver professional-grade outputs with minimal prompting, enabling consistent and scalable support across transactional and litigation matters. Industry benchmarks suggest that organizations implementing these solutions can achieve: 
 
•	20–40% reduction in time spent on routine legal tasks 
•	10–30% decrease in outside counsel spend 
•	Faster contract cycle times and improved compliance consistency 
 
These benefits translate into measurable ROI while also enhancing the legal department’s ability to respond quickly to business needs. 
 
Unlike general-purpose AI tools, legal-specific platforms are designed to prioritize accuracy, traceability, and explainability, context sensitivity, and domain relevance. This is critical in minimizing the risk of “hallucinations”—instances where AI generates plausible but incorrect or misleading information—which can have serious implications in legal contexts. A tool that understands legal language, structure, and standards helps ensure that outputs are not only efficient but also reliable, reducing the risk of reputational, regulatory, or financial exposure.
column42:
This solution offers two core capabilities tailored to the legal function: 
 
•	Specialized Legal Chatbot (Use Case #1) 
A domain-trained AI assistant that can interpret and respond to complex legal queries, summarize documents, extract key clauses, and assist with legal research. It enables attorneys to interact with large volumes of legal data conversationally, improving speed, accuracy, and decision-making. 
 
•	Legal Productivity Tools (Use Case #2) 
Includes advanced contract redlining and clause comparison features that automate first-pass reviews, flag deviations from standard terms, and suggest revisions. These tools significantly reduce manual effort, enhance consistency, and accelerate contract turnaround times. In addition, this use case includes rapid context-aware legal research and generates first drafts of litigation documents, memos, and correspondence, helping attorneys move faster while maintaining quality. 
 
Together, these capabilities help legal teams work smarter and faster—reducing bottlenecks, improving quality, and enabling scalable legal support across the enterprise. 

CoCounsel by Thomson Reuters is a secure, cloud-native legal AI assistant that integrated with Microsoft Word and supports SSO via SAML 2.0 or OIDC. It helps legal teams draft, review, and summarize documents using trusted content from Westlaw and Practical Law.

User data is encrypted in transit and at rest, never used to train AI models, and remains under user control. CoCounsel uses Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and includes source citations for transparency
column43:
Customer data is securely stored in separate databases in the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Amazon Web Services (AWS). The servers hosting the third-party LLM do not retain any customer data processed by the models.

Access to CoCounsel Core is managed through OnePass.  The Thomson Reuters proprietary login solution stores the user account and password in a database table. The user account and the password are casesensitive and stored in the database as a salted hash value. The OnePass databases are encrypted to protect the confidentiality of user login credentials.  The solution provides an additional sign-on option of seamless Single Sign-On (SSO) integration using SAML, which simplifies the login process to a single platform. Utilizing SSO integration not only enhances security but also improves the user experience

Data processing is US based processing.  The data is stored in the GCP US West, and AWS East.  The data is co-mingled, but logically separated, tying each piece of data to the user or organization. Data is encrypted in transit with TLS 1.2+, and encrypted at rest with AES 256.  The user has full control of the data retention, and can go in and delete data in the UI at any time. Post pilot, the Law Department can request that data be sent back to the user or request that the data is deleted.  They are GDPR compliant.  

CoCounsel's cloud providers are GCP and AWS, with OCR processing in Azure. All pilot training is handled by CoCounsel's dedicated pilot team, with individual training sessions.

CoCounsel has 3 possible integration points with the Delta network: MFA/SSO, the Law Dept's document repository system, and with MS O365

As mentioned earlier, the Law Department will use CoCounsel Drafting, an MS Word Add-In during this pilot.  CoCounsel Drafting is a M365 add-in within the user’s Word application.  CoCounsel Drafting is hosted in Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).  

 Security is embedded throughout the product with a focus on secure access, data privacy, 
and data security.  Customers are provided with secure login capabilities with encryption of 
customer data at rest and in transit throughout the product.  Key highlights of the product 
architecture include:
 • Customer content and user input are securely processed through the Word add-in, which 
is a web application that is hosted in the user’s browser
 • Word document storage remains within the ecosystem configured by the customer for 
their version of Word, ie, local hard drive, LAN shares, Data Management System (DMS), 
MS O365 tenant
 • Features invoked by the user may result in selected portions or the entire document content 
being securely transmitted to Thomson Reuters’ back-end service APIs in the cloud for 
fulfillment and execution of the features
 • AI Chat features are first securely processed in GCP, where the CoCounsel Chat service and 
the skills executor are hosted.  User prompt data is stored by the CoCounsel Chat service in 
the customer-specific database provisioned in CoCounsel to facilitate user review of chat 
history and to recall/refine previous prompts. This data is not used for any other purpose
 • Finally, user prompts (along with Word document data, if selected by the user) are then 
securely processed on our partner LLM servers.  Such servers hosting the AI models are 
contractually prohibited from retaining data or using it for any other purpose

 Customer content and data processed by CoCounsel Drafting is stored in regional 
databases in the US, the United Kingdom, Canada, and Australia. The servers hosting the AI 
models do not retain any customer data processed by the models, and the models are not 
trained on any customer data.

All data is encrypted both at rest using AES-256 and in transit with TLS 12 or higher. We utilize 
native Key Management Service (KMS) with Customer Managed Keys (CMK) on each of the 
respective cloud platforms for encryption. The keys generated by GCP and AWS KMS, as well 
as Azure KeyVault are validated according to FIPS-140-2 standards.

 Access to CoCounsel Drafting is managed through OnePass and your Thomson Reuters 
Account. The Thomson Reuters proprietary login solution stores the user account and 
password in a database table. The user account and the password are case sensitive and 
stored in the database as a salted hash value. The OnePass databases are encrypted to 
protect the confidentiality of the login credentials provided by the user
 The solution additionally provides another sign-on option of seamless Single Sign-On (SSO) 
integration supporting any SAMLv2

CoCounsel does not use MCP servers.

GC AI is a secure, cloud-native legal assistant that supports document summarization, knowledge retrieval, and chat-based legal workflows. Hosted on Google Cloud and Vercel, it integrates with enterprise identity providers via SSO and MFA through WorkOS.

GC AI uses OpenAI and Anthropic models with zero data retention and no training. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest. The platform is SOC 2 Type 2 compliant, supports audit logging, and avoids processing personal or sensitive data.

The Law Department will also use GC AI for Word, a Microsoft Word Add-In for this pilot.  There will be approximately 15 pilot participants from the Law Department.  

GC.AI does not use MCP servers

column43:
GC AI and all its servers are located exclusively in the United States. This means:

All data processing occurs within US borders
No data transfer to international locations
US legal and regulatory frameworks apply
Simplified compliance for US-based organizations

GC AI uses WorkOS to provide enterprise-grade authentication:

Individual secure accounts
Organization-level administration
Account-specific login restrictions
Multi-factor authentication support
SSO

All data is stored and processed in the US only.  GC AI employs a few different providers that store data in different places across the US:  Google Cloud storage, Google Cloud servers, Vercel servers, also they use Neon which wraps over AWS servers in US East, Ohio, Turbopuffer, which stores embeddings of documents uploaded and also stored in the US.  They are GDPR and SOC2 compliant.  Delta data will be in a shared database that’s logically isolated.  Data is “kept indefinitely until Delta asks them to delete it”.  Once the deletion request is made, the data will be deleted within 30 days.  During the pilot, GC AI engineering team will have access to Delta’s data. Regarding the potential for data leakage, all providers used by GC AI have agreements in place to never train model on our data

GC AI for Word is an official Microsoft Word add-in that brings GC AI directly into Microsoft Word. It lets you analyze your documents, draft new language, get redlines, and review comments inside of Word. Data and documents in GC AI for Word are private, protected with enterprise-grade AES-256 encryption, and never used for AI model training. GC AI is SOC 2 compliant and follows strict enterprise-grade security protocols.

GC.AI does not employ MCP servers

column9: AWS Resilience Hub is a centralized service designed to help you manage and enhance the resilience of your AWS applications. It enables you to define resilience goals, assess your application's resilience posture, and implement recommendations to improve it.
column25:
7/18/25: STR approved
Pending item: PIA if there are any changes from the POC
Story to sunrise service: B-1224186
Revenue Management and SRE guild were the business units that tested this service
column40:
Upon a successful POC conducted by Delta’s SRE Guild to test solving the problem of evaluating various RPO/RTO patterns to be able to determine where improvements are required, recommending to whitelist/sunrise this service in AWS. AWS resilience hub service evaluated our workloads deployed on the AWS, analyzed and provided the report score as well as recommendation on required improvements. The services uses generative capabilities to translate technical reports into natural language summaries. 

AWS Resilience Hub is essential for managing RPO (Recovery Point Objective) and RTO (Recovery Time Objective) for several reasons:
1.	Customizable Resiliency Policies: AWS Resilience Hub allows you to define and customize resiliency policies with specific RPO and RTO targets for each application. This ensures that your recovery objectives align with your business needs
2.	Continuous Assessment: The service continuously assesses your applications against the defined RPO and RTO targets, helping you identify potential gaps and areas for improvement
3.	Actionable Recommendations: AWS Resilience Hub provides actionable recommendations to enhance your application's resilience, ensuring that you can meet your RPO and RTO targets more effectively.
4.	Automated Testing: Integration with AWS Fault Injection Simulator (FIS) allows you to run fault-injection simulations, validating your application's resilience and ensuring that your RPO and RTO targets are achievable.
5.	Centralized Management: It offers a centralized platform to manage and monitor the resilience of all your applications, making it easier to maintain and improve your overall resilience posture
.
By leveraging AWS Resilience Hub, you can ensure that your applications are better prepared to handle disruptions, minimizing downtime and data loss, which is crucial for maintaining business continuity and customer trust.
column41:
This helps all the teams who is running their workload on aws can evaluate their RTO/RPO on the DR scenario’s and improve based on the AWS resilience hub evaluation and adopt the recommendations to avoid any delay on the recovery.

AWS Resilience Hub offers several business benefits:
1.	Reduced Outages: By continuously validating and tracking the resilience of your applications, AWS Resilience Hub helps reduce the likelihood of outages
2.	Proactive Issue Management: It identifies and resolves potential issues before they occur in production, ensuring smoother operations
3.	Optimized Business Continuity: The service helps optimize business continuity while reducing recovery costs by providing actionable recommendations based on the AWS Well-Architected Framework
4.	Centralized Management: AWS Resilience Hub provides a central location to manage and improve the resilience posture of your applications, making it easier to define resilience goals and assess your applications against those goals
5.	Enhanced Testing: Integration with AWS Fault Injection Simulator (FIS) allows you to run fault-injection simulations, helping you understand dependencies and uncover potential weaknesses
These benefits collectively help businesses maintain high availability and reliability of their applications, ultimately supporting better customer experiences and operational efficiency.
column42:
AWS Resilience Hub offers several business capabilities to help organizations ensure their applications are resilient and can recover quickly from disruptions. Here are some key features:
1.	Resilience Assessment: AWS Resilience Hub evaluates your application's resilience posture against defined goals using best practices from the AWS Well-Architected Framework. This helps identify potential weaknesses and areas for improvement.
2.	Proactive Issue Management: It allows you to identify and resolve issues before they occur in production, reducing the risk of outages.
3.	Business Continuity Optimization: The hub helps optimize business continuity while reducing recovery costs by continuously validating and tracking application resilience.
4.	Resilience Policies: You can define resilience policies for your applications, including Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and Recovery Point Objective (RPO) targets.
5.	Actionable Recommendations: AWS Resilience Hub provides actionable recommendations to improve resilience, including code snippets for recovery procedures and recommended Amazon CloudWatch monitors and alarms.
6.	Validation and Testing: It integrates with AWS Fault Injection Simulator (FIS) to provide fault-injection simulations of real-world failures, ensuring your application can meet its resilience targets before going into production.

column9: The monday.com software product is a Work Operating System (Work OS) that enables teams to build, run, and scale workflows and projects with ease. monday.com is a cloud-based platform designed to help teams manage tasks, projects, and workflows in a highly customizable and collaborative environment. It provides visual tools and automation to streamline work across departments.

column40:
Monday.com is in production and never went through the governance process. The team is seeking an incremental change to integrate Outlook to the platform. The platform is not integrated with any other applications or systems currently.
Monday.com is a cloud-based Work Operating System (Work OS) designed to help organizations centralize and streamline their work management processes. It addresses key business needs such as improving visibility, accountability, and collaboration across teams, while supporting scalability and remote work. By offering customizable workflows, real-time dashboards, and automation tools, it enables faster decision-making and reduces reliance on fragmented systems. Technically, Monday.com stands out with its no-code/low-code interface, robust integration capabilities, and developer-friendly tools like APIs and webhooks. It also meets enterprise-grade security and compliance standards, making it suitable for businesses of all sizes and industries. Overall, Monday.com empowers teams to work more efficiently, adapt quickly, and maintain alignment across complex projects and operations. 
​​The integration of monday.com with Outlook can significantly enhance Delta Air Lines' operational efficiency by streamlining communication and automating workflows. It allows emails and calendar events to be seamlessly converted into actionable tasks within monday.com, improving task tracking, cross-department collaboration, and response times. This leads to better coordination, reduced manual work, and improved service delivery across the organization.​
column41:
Monday.com can integrate with other systems like Outlook, Teams, Zendesk, Gitlab, etc. None of those integrations are currently in use. Integrating Monday.com with Outlook streamlines communication and project management by bridging the gap between email and workflow automation. This integration enables users to convert emails into actionable tasks, sync calendars for real-time scheduling, and maintain seamless collaboration without switching platforms. By centralizing updates and reducing manual data entry, teams can boost productivity, enhance transparency, and ensure that critical information never falls through the cracks.
​​The integration of monday.com with Outlook can significantly enhance Delta Air Lines' operational efficiency by streamlining communication and automating workflows.
column42: Monday.com offers a comprehensive suite of business capabilities that support efficient work management and cross-functional collaboration. It enables teams to manage projects and tasks through customizable workflows, timelines, and dependencies, while automating repetitive actions like status updates and approvals to save time and reduce errors. The platform enhances communication by centralizing discussions, file sharing, and updates within tasks, eliminating the need for scattered tools. It also supports resource and capacity planning by providing visibility into team workloads, helping managers allocate resources effectively. With built-in dashboards and reporting tools, businesses can visualize key metrics and make data-driven decisions. Monday.com extends its functionality to CRM and sales pipeline management, time tracking, document management, and even custom app development through its open API and integration capabilities. These features make it a versatile solution for aligning departments, improving productivity, and scaling operations across the organization.
column43: ​​Monday.com stores and processes customer data using the Vendor Hosted Cloud Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure, with data centers located in multiple global regions to support performance, compliance, and data residency requirements. By default, most customer data is hosted in the United States, specifically in the AWS Northern Virginia region. However, Monday.com also offers data residency options in the European Union for enterprise customers and for certain users who signed up after January 2023, ensuring compliance with regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Some accounts in the Asia-Pacific region may also be hosted locally, although Japanese accounts are typically hosted in the U.S. All data is encrypted both in transit and at rest, and Monday.com adheres to strict security standards, including SOC 2 Type II, ISO/IEC 27001, and HIPAA. This infrastructure ensures that customer data is handled securely and in accordance with regional compliance requirements.​
column44: Monday.com has several comparable alternatives that organizations like Delta Air Lines may already use or have approved. Tools such as Microsoft Project and Microsoft Planner are commonly adopted in enterprise environments due to their deep integration with Microsoft 365 and robust project planning features. Smartsheet is another strong alternative, offering a spreadsheet-like interface with powerful automation and reporting capabilities, often favored for its flexibility and compliance readiness. Asana and ClickUp provide intuitive task and workflow management, while Wrike excels in project portfolio management and resource planning. Other options like Airtable and Trello offer more lightweight, visual approaches to task tracking, and Notion combines documentation with task management for knowledge-centric teams. For enterprise-grade needs, Adobe Workfront and ServiceNow are often used for managing complex workflows, particularly in marketing, IT, and operations. These tools offer varying levels of customization, scalability, and integration, making them viable alternatives depending on the specific needs and existing infrastructure of the organization.

column1: Optimizing Flight Attendant Hiring with AI
column9:
Delta's Talent Acquisition partners have signed a SOW with Slalom to onboard a data scientist who will have access to Delta's AWS data stack to analyze the quality of Flight Attendant (FA) hiring for the last two years. 

Data that currently exists in a Delta private S3 bucket and will be static for this one-time analysis, will be dropped in a restricted AWS data lake instance with pre-approved enterprise AWS tools (S3, Glue, Lambda, SageMaker, Bedrock or Amazon Q Business). 

The data was sourced from Avature (applicant data and resumes) and OAP teams (employee metrics and scoring via spreadsheets) and uploaded to the bucket earlier this week and will be purged once analysis is completed.

Sagemaker notebooks will be used as an environment to access data, process data with LLM frameworks and python code, perform statistical modeling, and then conduct analyses. 

Slalom will only use Delta AWS AI tools.
column25:
6/27/25: STR approved
PIA not required
column40:
Delta’s Talent Acquisition team is looking for ways to improve Flight Attendant (FA) hiring, with an emphasis on raising the standard of quality of candidates in their talent pipeline. Flight Attendants have daily, direct interaction with Delta’s 200 million annual passengers, with a significant impact on the airline’s NPS scores. Their recognition as the #1 ranked US airline and a Top 15 ‘Company to Work For’ drives hundreds of thousands of FA applicants to apply. But this volume can create challenges in identifying the candidates who will provide the elite service which Delta expects.

The TA team is interested in exploring how technology and advanced analytics (including AI/ML) may help them establish standard benchmarks for FA talent, define “Candidate Quality””, ensure consistency over time, and better predict success in the role. This will aid the TA team in targeting the right talent for their pipeline, improving hiring rates during Event Days, and ensuring long-term success with the airline, all while positively enhancing customer experiences.
Additional areas of opportunity include:
• Assessing and optimizing the full process for FA hiring
• Benchmarking and scoring of interviews/assessments
• Augmenting human-decision making to remove potential bias
• Analyzing how current skills may translate to long-term success in the role

•	Benchmarking: Establish standardized, data-driven benchmarking for assessing Flight Attendant candidates

column9: As an AI Engineer, I need to install and configure GPU drivers (CUDA/cuDNN), Docker, cloud CLIs, and Python environments to run and fine-tune LLMs, VLMs, and local models . Admin access is also essential for setting up local inference servers, managing dependencies, and optimizing hardware for training and prototyping. This reduces IT dependency, accelerates development, and ensures compatibility with evolving GenAI workflows—restricted to dev machines and aligned with security policies.

Figma AI is a collection of features designed to help designers work more efficiently and creatively. Whether searching for inspiration, exploring multiple directions, or looking to automate tedious tasks, Figma AI was created designers can stay in the work.

Figma AI is currently in open beta so all features are free. Once available, it will become a paid feature but it will be included in Delta’s Enterprise plan.

Figma’s generative features are powered by third-party, out-of-the-box AI models. Certain AI features like Visual Search, Asset Search, and Add Interactions are fine tuned with data from public, free Community files. 

For all customer data, Figma:
•	Encrypts all data at rest and in transit
•	Uses security measures designed to protect against unauthorized access to customer data
•	Enforces tailored permissions and user access controls around who can view and access your data
When working with 3rd party companies to process data, Figma:
•	Does not permit 3rd party model providers to use data that customers upload or create on the Figma platform for training their own models
•	Limits how long vendors can store data. OpenAI and our other 3rd party model providers store data temporarily, or in some cases not at all, in order to process requests and enable AI features
Figma takes additional steps to train their AI models so that they learn general design patterns and Figma-specific concepts and tools—not your content, concepts, and ideas. For example, Figma de-identifes content and redact sensitive information including from text and images.

Admins have control over AI use and content training, which they can adjust with two new settings. Admins can turn these settings on or off at anytime. These settings control:
•	Access to AI features
o	For all plans: AI features are set to ‘on’ by default
•	Content training
o	For Enterprise, content training is set to ‘off’ by default
These are organization-level settings for Enterprise plans.
column25: VRA complete, the next assessment is due by 6/12/2029
column40:
Figma AI is essential for empowering design teams to work smarter, faster, and more collaboratively. Design work often involves repetitive, time-consuming tasks such as formatting, layout adjustments, copy generation, image manipulation, and component alignment. These manual activities can slow down productivity and divert focus from creative problem-solving.
Figma AI addresses these challenges by introducing intelligent features that automate and accelerate routine design workflows. It enhances collaboration by enabling real-time suggestions, rapid prototyping, and content generation directly within the design platform. This allows designers to iterate faster, reduce manual effort, and maintain creative momentum.
By streamlining tedious tasks and supporting intuitive, AI-powered design assistance, Figma AI frees up valuable time for design teams to focus on innovation and higher-value work—ultimately improving efficiency, quality, and time-to-market for digital products.
column41:
Figma AI helps design teams save time by automating repetitive tasks, improving collaboration, and accelerating the design process. This leads to faster time-to-market, better resource utilization, and higher-quality outputs.

column84: Adobe Journey Optimizer meets Delta’s SaaS platform requirements: • Encryption: All data in transit and at rest is encrypted in accordance with Delta’s security policies. • Authentication & Authorization: • Delta users authenticate via Global Auth with MFA support. • API credentials are securely stored, controlled, and rotated. • Role-based access is supported; AJO can be integrated with AD groups or alternative controls are in place. • CASB Integration: Integrated with Delta’s Cloud Access Security Broker. • Data Connectivity: • No direct inbound access to Delta; data flows via secure APIs/proxies. • Data access is limited to minimum required for business use. • Logging & Visibility: Provides detailed logs for campaign activity, data syncs, and user actions. • Data Residency: All data is stored and processed within U.S.-based data centers, in compliance with Delta’s residency requirements. • Network Access: Delta’s AJO tenant is restricted to approved networks or business-justified exceptions.
column85: Adobe Journey Optimizer (AJO) complies with Delta’s AI governance and security standards: • Information Security: Compliant with Delta’s InfoSec Policies, Standards, and Amber/Emerald mandates. • Path to Production: Follows Delta’s Path to Production deployment process. • AI Controls: AI capabilities (e.g., real-time personalization, predictive decisioning) use explainable, governed logic within Adobe’s AI framework. • Secure Architecture: Built with Zero Trust and secure-by-design principles. • Risk Alignment: AI usage aligns with Delta’s risk tolerance, with human-in-the-loop controls where required. • Threat Modeling: Covered under Adobe’s centrally managed security and threat model. • Restricted Data Protection: All models and training data are classified and protected per Delta’s “Restricted” data classification. • Monitoring & Logging: Provides visibility into AI decisioning and supports anomaly and drift detection. • Version Control & Testing: Supports versioned rule sets and AI configurations with testing for robustness and accuracy. • Auditability: AI decisions and actions are traceable for compliance and audit purposes.

column9: Predictive Intelligence is ServiceNow's AI Machine Learning capability which will allow functionality for auto-routing tickets, identifying automation opportunities, and detecting similar issues across multiple tickets which will improve service efficiency for the Service Desk.  Delta already owns the license for this functionality as part of the purchase made at end of 2024.
column40: Service Desk receives thousands of incidents a day, and functionality such as Predictive Intelligence will allow more efficient operations.
column41: ROI would be received in less manual effort and less staff required to receive and route tickets that need to go to other teams in IT.
column42:
• Compare the similarity of text within open incidents across the enterprise so IT workers can quickly identify and then propose new major incidents.
• Automatically prioritize product issues and incoming field requests so customer service agents can stay focused on the most pressing issues.
• Identify automation opportunities where ServiceNow capabilities, such as Virtual Agent and auto-routing can be applied. End the struggle of how and when to turn on automation solutions and increase deflection while lowering MTTR.
• Predictive Intelligence comes equipped with powerful analytics that give administrators insights into the value of machine learning and how each prediction improves service efficiency. column1: Optimizing Flight Attendant Hiring with AI
column9:
Delta's Talent Acquisition partners have signed a SOW with Slalom to onboard a data scientist who will have access to Delta's AWS data stack to analyze the quality of Flight Attendant (FA) hiring for the last two years. Data will be dropped in a restricted AWS data lake instance with pre-approved enterprise AWS tools (S3, Glue, Lambda, SageMaker, Bedrock or Amazon Q Business). 

The data scientist will have access to Delta's AWS data stack to analyze the quality of Flight Attendant (FA) hiring for the last two years.

Data used for this analysis currently exists in a Delta private S3 bucket and will be static for this one-time analysis, will be dropped in a restricted AWS data lake instance with pre-approved enterprise AWS tools (S3, Glue, Lambda, SageMaker, Bedrock or Amazon Q Business).

The data was sourced from Avature (applicant data and resumes) and OAP teams (employee metrics and scoring via spreadsheets) and uploaded to the bucket earlier this week and will be purged once analysis is completed.

Sagemaker notebooks will be used as an environment to access data, process data with LLM frameworks and python code, perform statistical modeling, and then conduct analyses.

Slalom will only use Delta AWS AI tools.

column40:
Delta’s Talent Acquisition team is looking for ways to improve Flight Attendant (FA) hiring, with an emphasis on raising the standard of quality of candidates in their talent pipeline. Flight Attendants have daily, direct interaction with Delta’s 200 million annual passengers, with a significant impact on the airline’s NPS scores. Their recognition as the #1 ranked US airline and a Top 15 ‘Company to Work For’ drives hundreds of thousands of FA applicants to apply. But this volume can create challenges in identifying the candidates who will provide the elite service which Delta expects.

The TA team is interested in exploring how technology and advanced analytics (including AI/ML) may help them establish standard benchmarks for FA talent, define “Candidate Quality””, ensure consistency over time, and better predict success in the role. This will aid the TA team in targeting the right talent for their pipeline, improving hiring rates during Event Days, and ensuring long-term success with the airline, all while positively enhancing customer experiences.
Additional areas of opportunity include:
• Assessing and optimizing the full process for FA hiring
• Benchmarking and scoring of interviews/assessments
• Augmenting human-decision making to remove potential bias
• Analyzing how current skills may translate to long-term success in the role

column9:
Figma AI is a collection of features designed to help designers work more efficiently and creatively. Whether searching for inspiration, exploring multiple directions, or looking to automate tedious tasks, Figma AI was created designers can stay in the work.

Figma AI is currently in open beta so all features are free. Once available, it will become a paid feature but it will be included in Delta’s Enterprise plan.

Figma’s generative features are powered by third-party, out-of-the-box AI models. Certain AI features like Visual Search, Asset Search, and Add Interactions are fine tuned with data from public, free Community files. 

For all customer data, Figma:
•	Encrypts all data at rest and in transit
•	Uses security measures designed to protect against unauthorized access to customer data
•	Enforces tailored permissions and user access controls around who can view and access your data
When working with 3rd party companies to process data, Figma:
•	Does not permit 3rd party model providers to use data that customers upload or create on the Figma platform for training their own models
•	Limits how long vendors can store data. OpenAI and our other 3rd party model providers store data temporarily, or in some cases not at all, in order to process requests and enable AI features
Figma takes additional steps to train their AI models so that they learn general design patterns and Figma-specific concepts and tools—not your content, concepts, and ideas. For example, Figma de-identifes content and redact sensitive information including from text and images.

Admins have control over AI use and content training, which they can adjust with two new settings. Admins can turn these settings on or off at anytime. These settings control:
•	Access to AI features
o	For all plans: AI features are set to ‘on’ by default
•	Content training
o	For Enterprise, content training is set to ‘off’ by default
These are organization-level settings for Enterprise plans.
column25: VRA complete, the next assessment is due by 6/12/2029
column40:
Figma AI is essential for empowering design teams to work smarter, faster, and more collaboratively. Design work often involves repetitive, time-consuming tasks such as formatting, layout adjustments, copy generation, image manipulation, and component alignment. These manual activities can slow down productivity and divert focus from creative problem-solving.
Figma AI addresses these challenges by introducing intelligent features that automate and accelerate routine design workflows. It enhances collaboration by enabling real-time suggestions, rapid prototyping, and content generation directly within the design platform. This allows designers to iterate faster, reduce manual effort, and maintain creative momentum.
By streamlining tedious tasks and supporting intuitive, AI-powered design assistance, Figma AI frees up valuable time for design teams to focus on innovation and higher-value work—ultimately improving efficiency, quality, and time-to-market for digital products.
column41:
Figma AI helps design teams save time by automating repetitive tasks, improving collaboration, and accelerating the design process. This leads to faster time-to-market, better resource utilization, and higher-quality outputs.
ROI: By saving hours weekly per designer and reducing the need for rework or additional headcount, Figma AI delivers strong cost savings and efficiency—providing a clear return on investment.
column42:
1. AI-Powered Design Assistance
Autosuggest Text: Automatically generates placeholder or contextual text for UI elements.
Edit Image: Allows users to make AI-driven edits to images directly within Figma.
Content Replacement: Improved AI tools can now replace content without requiring autolayout 
 
2. Agentic AI
Figma is embracing agentic AI, which goes beyond simple generation to perform multi-step tasks like:
Automating design workflows
Managing repetitive tasks
Making decisions based on user input
Over 50% of AI product builders on Figma are now working on agentic tools 
 
3. Figma Draw
A new suite of illustration tools including:
Brushes, pattern fills, text on a path
Shape builder, lasso, and multi-edit tools
Dynamic strokes and visual effects like texture and noise 
 
4. Grid System
A responsive layout system that supports:
Two-dimensional design (rows and columns)
Fixed track sizing
CSS alignment for better design-to-dev handoff 
 
5. Figma Sites & Figma Buzz
Figma Sites: Turn designs into live websites.
Figma Buzz: Manage and share brand assets at scale, with AI helping maintain consistency 
 
6. Figma Make
A prompt-to-code tool that uses AI to generate code from natural language prompts, streamlining the design-to-development process

column9: SAP Transportation Management (SAP TM) is an SAP software application used to plan, execute, and optimize transportation processes within a supply chain. It helps businesses manage and control the movement of goods across different modes of transport, such as road, rail, sea, and air. SAP TM integrates with other SAP modules and external systems to streamline transportation processes and improve efficiency.
column25:
7/23/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA, VRA
column40:
Currently Delta struggles with the following inefficiencies
*	Increasing Transportation Costs: Fragmented transportation management across the enterprise has led to suboptimal transportation decisions.
*	Lack of Shipment Visibility: Limited tracking of spare parts movement caused disruptions in maintenance schedules.
*	Compliance & Documentation Issues: Handling global shipments requires extensive regulatory compliance, often leading to delays, penalties and overpayment of taxes.
column41:
*	Implement SAP Transportation Management for Delta Airlines for improved shipment tracking, optimized routing, cost reduction, avoiding delays due to compliance failures and to avoid AOG situations)
*	SAP Transportation Management to drive achieve 8-10% savings in transportation spend.
*	Give our teams and leaders the visibility, next level of tools, information and processes to support our business and lead the industry.
column42:
Optimized Carrier Selection & Freight Procurement	
              SAP TM uses automated carrier selection to choose the most cost-effective option based on our Delta routing guide.

Route Optimization & Load Consolidation	SAP TM minimizes distance traveled and fuel consumption. It also consolidates shipments by:
            - Maximizing container/truck space to reduce empty mileage.
            - Grouping shipments to avoid unnecessary partial-load costs.

Automated Freight Cost Calculation & Settlement	
            - Prevents billing errors & overcharges by automatically calculating accurate freight costs. 
            - Reduces manual effort by automating invoice matching & cost reconciliation with pre-agreed rates.

Real-Time Shipment Visibility & Risk Reduction (Global Track & Trace)	
            - Avoids expensive last-minute express shipping by tracking shipments proactively.
            - Minimizes disruptions by predicting delays and adjusting shipments accordingly.

Compliance & Customs Cost Savings	
            - Reduces penalties & delays by automating regulatory compliance.
            - Ensures accurate duty & tax calculations, avoiding unexpected fees.

Data-Driven Decision Making & Cost Analysis	
            - Predictive analytics help forecast demand, reducing unnecessary expedited orders.
            - Performance tracking identifies high-cost carriers & inefficient routes for cost-saving adjustments.

Sustainability & Fuel Cost Reduction	
            - Uses eco-friendly routing to reduce fuel consumption.
            - Encourages multi-modal transport (road, rail, air, sea) to optimize costs based on urgency & price.

Avoid Rogue Spend	Every order gets processed through TM to ensure we are leveraging company negotiated contracts

Carrier collaboration 	Allowing carriers to view, accept or reject freight tenders, provide status updates, and submit invoices

column65:
SAP TMS provides a robust and scalable platform for optimizing transportation operations, with integrated planning, execution, and real-time visibility. Its connection to the SAP Business Network for Logistics (BN4L) SaaS platform enhances collaboration across logistics partners, aligning with Delta’s strategic goals for digital supply chain transformation. However, this implementation presents several architectural and operational concerns that must be addressed to ensure a secure, maintainable, and cost-effective deployment. The following is a non-exhaustive list of key issues identified:

A. Architectural Concerns
- Contractual Oversight: The contract was signed with minimal IT involvement, with no opportunity to assess perpetual licensing or AWS hosting under Delta’s account. The solution is not a true SaaS offering, despite being presented as a subscription model.
- Hosting Model Misalignment: SAP’s AWS-managed environment deviates from Delta’s cloud and security standards, where all systems are typically deployed under a single account with security groups used for isolation.
- Connectivity Ambiguity / Network Integration Gaps: SAP requires a delegated subdomain and dedicated IP ranges, introducing DNS and security complexities. Delta’s preferred AWS PrivateLink setup is not currently supported; VPN is the only viable alternative. If Delta cannot provide a dedicated subnet, it is unclear whether SAP will support NAT-based configurations, which introduce additional complexity and risk. Internal name resolution may also be problematic, especially as SAP will not be aware of NAT IP mappings on Delta’s side.
- System Build Inconsistencies: SAP’s initial configuration requirements (e.g., SID, client number, hostnames, security settings, Cloud Connector, Cloud ALM) remain unclear, increasing the risk of conflicts and support challenges.
- Security & SSO: Web UI must integrate with Delta’s IDP. SAP GUI requires either a security exception or use of BTP Secure Login. Dynamic user provisioning is not currently supported.
- Data Governance Risk: The absence of the SAP MDG add-on may lead to data quality degradation unless strong business-side controls are implemented (see STR for Westernacher / Syniti).

B. Operational Concerns
- No Sandbox Environment: Development systems must be tightly governed; irreversible changes require strict approval processes.
- System Refresh Limitations: The CPE contract limits the number of annual refreshes and introduces downtime before Delta teams can perform post-refresh tasks.
- Scheduling Constraints: Control-M cannot be installed on SAP-managed systems, requiring separate infrastructure for job scheduling.
- Monitoring & Change Management: SAP Cloud ALM is new to Delta and lacks a sandbox environment. Integration with PagerDuty and ServiceNow is still pending.
- User Provisioning Gaps: GRC 10.1 does not support S/4HANA. Until the AC12 upgrade (in progress), manual provisioning will be required.
- ECC Integration Complexity: DRF retrofit from EhP7 to EhP6 must be documented and validated in the ECC sandbox.
- BTP CPI Setup: Requires new IAS, SailPoint integration, and three CPI instances (Dev/QA/Prod), with estimated baseline costs of $15K/month, plus consumption charges.
- GTT Integration Challenges: Limited tenant availability (typically only QA and Prod), unclear 3rd-party integration (e.g., UPS, FedEx), and shared QA environment raise concerns.
- Data Lifecycle Management: No current ILM strategy exists. HANA performance and integration with Delta’s data lake remain unaddressed.
column84: Application Name & Blockcode: No. Mandate Description Evidence/ comments about how this is achieved S1 End-to-End Encryption - All data in transit and at rest must be encrypted, in compliance with our policies. This applies to data within the SaaS platform, and the integration or access to Delta systems. SAP ensures robust encryption for both data in transit and at rest using AES-256 encryption standards and secure protocols like TLS 1.2 and SAP SNC. SAP HANA databases use built-in volume encryption, with keys securely managed via SAP’s Secure Storage File System or hyperscaler-native services like AWS KMS or Azure Key Vault, following strict segregation of duties. The SAP Private Cloud operates as an extension of the customer’s on-premise network, with the customer responsible for managing secure connectivity—commonly through VPN, MPLS, or cloud peering options. S2 Authentication and Authorization S2.A: All Delta users must be authenticated by Global Auth, including MFA if required by Delta security standards. This requires a federated authentication integration with the SaaS provider. SAP supports Multi-Factor Authentication through SAP Identity Authentication Service. If a customer uses their own Identity Provider that supports MFA, SAP solutions can inherit and enforce those MFA policies through standard integration, such as SAML 2.0. This allows customers to maintain control over their authentication requirements while leveraging SAP's secure infrastructure. S2.B: Credentials used for outbound APIs (i.e. Delta to SaaS provider) must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Credentials used for outbound APIs (from customer to SaaS providers) are typically managed by the customer through their chosen middleware or integration layer. When using SAP Integration Suite or SAP API Management, customers retain control over credential storage, rotation, and access policies, aligning with their internal security standards. SAP provides secure options for credential handling, including encrypted storage and integration with identity providers, but credential lifecycle management remains the customer's responsibility. S2.C: All inbound APIs (i.e. SaaS provider to Delta) must be authorized using the Delta API Authorizer and must be processed through Akamai for our standard WAF and DDoS protection. See above. S2.D: Access to the SaaS solution, and roles within the SaaS solution must be controlled using AD groups managed by SailPoint, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved SAP cloud solutions offer flexible role-based permission controls to manage user access and responsibilities within the application. Roles can be configured to align with business workflows. Additionally, SAP Identity Provisioning Service enables integration with external identity systems, supporting automated role and user provisioning for efficient access management. S2.E: Authorization controls within the SaaS solution must be managed to enforce least privilege. For example, general users should not have "tenant" admin privileges. Access Management. Access controls provide identity management and grant appropriate access rights (“Access Management Controls”). Access Management Controls are designed to follow the principles of “least privilege,” “need-to-know,” and “segregation of duties.” Personnel Access. SAP personnel are issued a unique identifier to access SAP’s systems. SAP maintains written procedures to administer access authorization changes and access rights are revoked when personnel are no longer authorized to access applicable systems (e.g., termination of employment). Administrative Rights. Administrative rights are only assigned to privileged and technical SAP users on a “least privilege” and “need-to-know” basis. Please see the SAP Cloud solution in scope SOC2 report as these processes are attested to within. https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center/certification-compliance.html#soc S3 Cloud Access Security Broker - The SaaS solution must be integrated with the Delta CASB, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved. This needs to be discussed on what CASB Delta is using and how it's being used. S4 Direct Data Connections (this includes any direct data connectivity such as to databases, message queues, cache services, service bus, file systems, object stores, file transfers, etc.) S4.A: Inbound connections from the SaaS provider to Delta data sources directly via the Internet are not permitted. API, proxy, or other intermediary connectivity solutions must be included so the data sources do not need to be publicly accessible. Inbound connections from SAP cloud services to customer data sources are not made directly over the public Internet. Instead, integration is handled through secure intermediaries such as SAP Integration Suite or customer-managed middleware, ensuring that data sources remain non-public and protected within the customer's controlled network. S4.B: Credentials used to authenticate all direct data traffic must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Credentials used for authenticating direct data traffic in RISE with SAP are managed by the customer when using integration services or middleware. SAP supports secure credential storage and encrypted communication, but credential lifecycle management—including storage, control, and rotation—remains the customer's responsibility to align with their internal security standards. S4.C: Data access controls, and data that is uploaded to the SaaS platform must be strictly limited to only the data necessary for the SaaS solution to function correctly. Data uploaded to SAP cloud solutions is strictly limited to what the customer, as the data owner and controller, chooses to provide. The customer manages user access and permissions, ensuring that only the necessary data required for the solution's functionality is shared and accessed. S5 Logging - The SaaS provider must offer logging or a way to view events for important transactions (e.g. logins, high-value transactions, administrative changes, etc.) SAP cloud services support multi-layered logging and audit capabilities. At the infrastructure and platform levels, SAP logs system events, configuration changes, and security-relevant activities, which are monitored through centralized Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems to help detect and respond to potential threats. These logs support SAP’s responsibility for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the service.This is attested to within the SAP Cloud SOC2. At the application level, audit trails capture changes such as data modifications, configuration updates, and integration activities, including timestamps and user IDs. These logs are accessible via the SAP cloud application. In SSO-enabled environments, user authentication and identity-related logs typically reside with the customer's Identity Provider (IdP), as identity verification is managed externally. Customers are responsible for monitoring and managing those IdP-level logs as part of their access governance and compliance processes. S6 Restrict Network Access - The Delta tenant of the SaaS solution must only be accessible from the Delta network unless there is a business requirement to allow access from the public Internet. In RISE with SAP, network access to the customer tenant is restricted by default and can be configured to allow access only from the customer’s network. Public Internet access is only enabled if explicitly required by the customer for specific business scenarios, ensuring controlled and secure connectivity.

column9:
ICoupon is a digital voucher technology solution that will be used when Delta is required to give meal voucher compensation to customers for a delayed or cancelled flight.

DL Agents will access the tool via a URL on their GX Pros or common use workstations. They can then activate the iCoupon for a full flight or specific customers. The technology assigns monetary value to the customer’s boarding pass barcode. Customers can then scan their boarding pass (whether it’s paper or digital) at participating retailers to pay for their meals or other goods.
column25:
6/10/25: STR approved
pending items: PIA, VRA, Contract
column40: Many international stations issue meal vouchers manually via DLTerm. A digital solution would save the frontline team a lot of time and reduce reliance on DLTerm since we no longer train against that tool. The solution increases CX by allowing customers to use their existing boarding pass as a voucher, vs. standing in line to receive a paper voucher. It increases internal controls by offering accountability and fraud prevention for Delta’s service recovery dollars.
column41: Airports could fulfill the legal requirement to distribute meal vouchers in a timely fashion without further disrupting the operation. The platform only bills DL what customers actually redeem (vs. a flat fee per paper voucher in some stations), potentially reducing DL’s meal cost/IROP event.
column42: Agents can issue meal vouchers to an entire flight of customers or to individuals. The customers’ boarding pass becomes the voucher and retailers are able to scan the boarding pass barcode to redeem the monetary value. To activate the voucher, agents use the iCoupon platform to input the causing flight number, date, and applicable BCNs or segment numbers (whether the issuance is for a full flight or individual customers). This information is read by the iCoupon scanner at the retailer to apply the monetary value from the voucher.
column43: The data will be stored and processed by the vendor tool. iCoupon is based in the United Kingdom.
column44: Domestic stations use an HMT tool, owned by TAConnections which distributes digital vouchers to customers. This tool is not able to be used for International stations.
column45: INTL stations would continue to have to manually distribute meal vouchers per customer via DLTerm OR rely on current vendors who distribute paper vouchers to customer which has high risk associated to it as customers can just exchange paper vouchers as they please. This is extremely time consuming and a negative customer experience. Our international hubs need technology to support effectively handling customers during IROPs today. We do not have an internal DL built IROP solution to handle any meal vouchers, hotels, or transportation needs. Vendors are a requirement unless internal DL IT can build a tool (which we’ve previously asked and been denied). It is an operational and legal requirement that we distribute vouchers when there is a DL fault cancellation or delay of 3+ hours.
column46: There is no integration with DL systems beyond MFA/SSO. Costs are within the agreed upon contract for service use. There is no implementation fee since we are accessing from the URL and not integrating.
column49: Station leaders will just need to manage access to the tool as agents quit or are hired.
column51: There should be no IT support needed since there is no integration. Station leaders would only need to manage access.
column52: There is no support needed from IT. Vendor will be contacted in case of issues. Vendor will provide 24/7 support.
column54: May potentially retire existing vendor in CDG
column58:
If this tool is not approved, will need to continue using paper vouchers in several international stations. There is a higher chance of fraud associated with paper vouchers. 

The proposed vendor tool will provide compensation via boarding pass in a timely manner and prevent fraud associated with paper vouchers
column61: Piloted for 90 days in CDG/YUL, and received positive employee/customer feedback and meaningful cost savings vs. incumbent vendor. Will roll out to interested stations in Europe and those using paper vouchers in Phase 1, then expanding to other interested stations in Phase 2.

column9: There was an incident of a worker that was working alone, and an incident occurred that resulted in the employee passing.  There is an initiative to utilize hardware and software that can proactively check in on the employee and if they need help can connect them with direct delta resources rather than going directly to 911.  They have been working with Everbridge and are to pilot with a solution with them with a pendant hardware but no phone or app, MedAire has been introduced as a possible solution. Support alone workers with some means of support if an incident occurs.Ensuring safety and providing employees a way for help when they are working independently is one of the major benefits of this solution.

column40:
This product would ensure frontline employees can get immediate help if there is an emergency while on the job.

The technology will be associated to the phone assigned to an agent who is working alone. There will be tasks for the agent to complete within a specific timeframe and the agent will need to push a button on the phone to indicate response. If there is no activity in that timeframe, the system will automatically call for help.

There will be an Admin agent that will log into the Platform (with a generic ID provided by the vendor using a delta email address) to create generic IDs for the phones assigned to agents: ACS1, ACS2, etc. that will be stored in the app so action can be taken if needed.

With only one user, MFA/PingID will not be set up
