column1: Enhanced IVR Experience With Netomi AI
column9:
This effort will be to introduce new technological infrastructure (AI) in the IVR space to improve the customer experience and overall containment rate for the product.  It will transform the infrastructure and allow the teams to deploy experiences at a fast rate.  It will use customer facing knowledge articles to enhance the products ability to answer questions.
 
This aligns to both the Elevated Cust Experience and Optimize Cost strategic pillars. We are looking to increase IVR containment by end of Second Quarter the existing containment rate and improve the customer experience in the product.  This will save the division cost by reducing inbound volume needing to be handled by a Res Specialist.
column25:
7/14/25: STR approved. All contracts, NDA, PSSA are completed
Netomi AI already been in use to consume KM APIs to provide ready to use replies and provide an AI generated summary of the conversation within LivePerson application
column40:
The Service Provider will provide Delta with Agentic AI capabilities enabled on telephony, integrated with Delta’s Amazon Connect environment to automatically respond to and resolve customer support requests, as well as escalate requests to Delta’s human support agents where required. The Service Provider will also intelligently route customer interactions to existing Delta-built intents within Amazon Lex, ensuring previously developed conversational flows are leveraged wherever applicable to maximize reusability and accelerate time-to-value. Such an agentic AI-powered telephony tool will be powered by the large language model created and hosted by Netomi (the “Netomi Hosted LLM”). Netomi Hosted LLM models used within the scope of this SOW will comply with Delta-approved LLMs as listed below: 
 
GPT 4 and 4o 
Claude V2, 
Titan XL, 
Embed Multilingual Cohere 
 
As part of this SOW, Service Provider will collaborate with Delta to enhance the existing IVR system with an agentic AI-powered solution. This engagement will include a discovery and evaluation phase during which the current IVR experience, contact drivers, and volume trends will be assessed to identify key areas for optimization in both customer experience and system performance. 
 
Additionally, Service Provider and Delta will work together to define and finalize the scope of functionality for the new AI-driven IVR experience. This will include a collaborative process to prioritize high-impact use cases, establish a solution architecture, and align on key performance objectives. 
 
While final scope of functionality will be refined collaboratively during the discovery phase of the project, the core areas of work are expected to include: 
Knowledge Agent Configuration & Deployment 
Configuration of an AI Knowledge agent capable of dynamically generating accurate, relevant responses to customer inquiries using Delta approved knowledge sources. The knowledge agent will be grounded in approved and curated content sources provided or validated by Delta. These sources may include, but are not limited to, publicly available content on Delta.com, Delta’s own Knowledge Management system in Sharepoint, and any other documents, website, or resources approved and provided by Delta. 
Action Agent Configuration & Deployment 
Design and implement AI Action Agents that integrate with Delta’s internal systems to execute tasks where required to fulfill customer requests and execute end-to-end transactions. A tiered, phased approach prioritizes integration with Delta systems according to high-impact intents. Each phase introduces additional transaction automation. The rollout plan below aligns with Delta’s current initiatives but can be adjusted as needed. 
Phase 1: Deployment of Informational Use Cases and Core Technical Integration 
In Phase 1, the Service Provider will enable the handling of informational queries while completing the technical setup required to integrate the agentic AI platform with Delta’s existing IVR infrastructure. This includes: 
Integration with Delta’s existing ecosystem, including access to backend APIs, which will serve as the foundation for deeper transactional use cases in future phases. 
Integration with Delta’s throttling logic to ensure traffic is directed to the Service Provider in a controlled and optimized manner. 
Implementation of an agreed-upon fallback approach to ensure service continuity and redundancy, maintaining a consistent experience for Delta customers at all times. 
This phase lays the groundwork for scalable automation and more advanced use case enablement in subsequent phases. 
Phase 2 and Beyond: Enablement of Transactional Experiences 
In subsequent phases, the focus will shift toward enabling transactional experiences within the Service Provider’s agentic AI platform. This will involve deeper integration with Delta’s backend systems to support personalized and action-oriented customer interactions. 
Examples of recommended use cases are provided below; however, final scope and sequencing will be subject to alignment and confirmation with the Delta team. The goal is to collaboratively prioritize high-impact experiences that drive efficiency and enhance the customer journey. 
Phase 2: Book a Ticket, Baggage - Pre Trip, Medallion / Promo Questions, Seat Selection, SSR   
Phase 3: SkyMiles Redemption, Change Booking, Upgrade, Flight Status 
Phase 4 and beyond: Book a Ticket (MFoP), Cancel (OFoP, RFC, etc.), Baggage - Post-Trip, Refund Status 
Amazon Connect Integration 
Configuration and integration with Amazon Connect to support seamless escalation of AI-handled calls to Delta’s live human support agents. 
Conversational IVR Experience Design 
Development of a natural language IVR flow that enables customers to interact conversationally. This experience will be designed to improve usability, reduce friction, and enhance customer experience.

column42: Introduce AI and LLM based processing to improve conversation experience and ability to handle customer needs in a more seamless manner.

Here is some cost information coming through for SIP integration: So it will be ~37K fixed cost per year.
 
External voice transfer requires a transfer connector, which costs $3,100 per month.  Upon creation, the connector cost is prorated for the remainder of the month.  For example, if a connector is created on May 22, then the cost for May is $3,100 / 31 x (31-22+1) = $1,100.  Similarly, the cost is prorated for the month when a connector is deleted.  For example, if a connector is deleted on August 15, the the cost is $3,100 / 31 x 15 = $1,500.

Netomi Cost would be additional.

column84: Netomi AI meets Delta’s SaaS platform requirements: • Encryption: All data in transit and at rest is encrypted in accordance with Delta’s security policies. • Authentication & Authorization: • Delta users authenticate via Global Auth with MFA support. • API credentials are securely stored, controlled, and rotated. • Role-based access is supported; AJO can be integrated with AD groups or alternative controls are in place. • CASB Integration: Integrated with Delta’s Cloud Access Security Broker. • Data Connectivity: • No direct inbound access to Delta; data flows via secure APIs/proxies. • Data access is limited to minimum required for business use. • Logging & Visibility: Provides detailed logs for campaign activity, data syncs, and user actions. • Data Residency: All data is stored and processed within U.S.-based data centers, in compliance with Delta’s residency requirements. • Network Access: Delta’s AJO tenant is restricted to approved networks or business-justified exceptions.
column85: Netomi AI complies with Delta'AI governance and security standards: • Information Security: Compliant with Delta’s InfoSec Policies, Standards, and Amber/Emerald mandates. • Path to Production: Follows Delta’s Path to Production deployment process. • AI Controls: AI capabilities (e.g., real-time personalization, predictive decisioning) use explainable, governed logic within Adobe’s AI framework. • Secure Architecture: Built with Zero Trust and secure-by-design principles. • Risk Alignment: AI usage aligns with Delta’s risk tolerance, with human-in-the-loop controls where required. • Threat Modeling: Covered under Adobe’s centrally managed security and threat model. • Restricted Data Protection: All models and training data are classified and protected per Delta’s “Restricted” data classification. • Monitoring & Logging: Provides visibility into AI decisioning and supports anomaly and drift detection. • Version Control & Testing: Supports versioned rule sets and AI configurations with testing for robustness and accuracy. • Auditability: AI decisions and actions are traceable for compliance and audit purposes.

column9:
Salesforce Data Cloud is a real-time, hyperscale data platform that unifies and activates customer data across all touchpoints. It ingests data from any source—internal systems, cloud storage, APIs, or streaming platforms—and uses identity resolution and data modeling to create unified customer profiles.  
 
Seamlessly integrated with the Salesforce ecosystem, it serves as the foundation and is Required for Salesforce Agentforce AI-driven use cases. Key features include real-time data activation and zero-copy access to external data lakes like Snowflake and Databricks.

column40:
Business Drivers: 
Our immediate use cases include the ability to analyze in-app messaging from Crew Assist and Jetstream to improve crew communication and support. Data Cloud also lays the foundation for future Salesforce Agentforce AI use cases by unifying data across systems and enabling real-time insights. 

Technical Reasons: 
Salesforce has built messaging (used to support pilots & flight attendants) such that the data of a transcript is only accessible in Data Cloud. More generally in other use cases, Data Cloud is an essential and foundational part of our future AI focused architecture plans and roadmap at Delta. It provides real-time data ingestion, identity resolution, and seamless integration with Salesforce Agentforce AI tools. It supports scalable, secure data harmonization which is essential for our AI-driven operational initiatives.

column9: Chainguard is a SaaS container security tool that provides minimal, hardened container images designed to reduce vulnerabilities and improve supply chain integrity. Its container images are often "distroless," meaning they include only the application and its runtime dependencies, omitting unnecessary components that could introduce security risks. Chainguard supports compliance with standards such as FedRAMP and PCI-DSS by continuously rebuilding images to eliminate known vulnerabilities (CVEs) and maintain a secure software development lifecycle.

These features align with Delta’s broader goals of improving observability, traceability, and policy enforcement across Kubernetes environments.

column1: SAP Business Network for Logistics BN4L
column9:
SAP BN4L (Business Network for Logistics) connects shippers, carriers, and logistics partners to streamline supply chain operations. It offers three main services:
Freight Collaboration – SAP Business Network Freight - Manages freight orders, tendering, and invoicing.
Tracking & Visibility – SAP Global Track and Trace (GTT) - Provides real-time shipment tracking and status updates.
Dock Appointment Scheduling – SAP Business Network Dock Appointment Scheduling - Coordinates loading/unloading times to reduce delays.

SAP BN4L is a supplemental component of our SAP Transportation Management suite, enhancing logistics through seamless freight collaboration, real-time visibility, and efficient dock scheduling.
column25:
7/18/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA, check on status of VRA
We will be starting with the implementation of GTT (SAP Global Track and Trace)
column40:
Currently Delta struggles with the following inefficiencies
*	Increasing Transportation Costs: Fragmented transportation management across the enterprise has led to suboptimal transportation decisions.
*	Lack of Shipment Visibility: Limited tracking of spare parts movement caused disruptions in maintenance schedules.
*	Compliance & Documentation Issues: Handling global shipments requires extensive regulatory compliance, often leading to delays, penalties and overpayment of taxes.
column41:
* Connects Us to Carriers
      BN4L lets us work directly with carriers—sending tenders, getting updates, and handling invoices—all in one place.
* Gives Real-Time Shipment Tracking
      We can see where shipments are, get alerts for delays, and share accurate ETAs with customers.
* Improves Dock Scheduling
      Carriers can book dock times, helping us avoid congestion and speed up loading/unloading.
* Reduces Manual Work
      Less email, fewer phone calls—BN4L automates communication and document exchange.
* Supports Our TM Plans
      SAP TM plans the shipments. BN4L helps make those plans happen smoothly in the real world.
column42:
BN4L Capabilities in Context of SAP TM
 1, Freight Collaboration
        * Enables real-time digital interaction with carriers: tendering, confirmation, and invoicing.
        * Reduces email/manual coordination and ensures faster response cycles.
2. Dock Appointment Scheduling
        * Allows carriers to book time slots for loading/unloading.
        * Minimizes congestion, improves warehouse throughput, and aligns with route planning from SAP TM.
3. Real-Time Shipment Visibility (via SAP GTT)
        * Tracks shipments across all legs and modes.
        * Enhances SAP TM’s planning with live updates, predictive ETAs, and exception alerts.
4. Partner Network Connectivity
        * Provides a scalable, cloud-based platform to connect with thousands of logistics partners.
        * Simplifies onboarding and standardizes communication across the supply chain.

column65: The SAP Business Network for Logistics (BN4L) SaaS solution is approved for inclusion in the Transportation Management System (TMS) Project (Product ID: 1504) based on its strong capabilities in optimizing logistics workflows, enhancing freight collaboration, and providing real-time transportation visibility. As an open and extensible platform, SAP Business Network for Logistics supports integration with other applications via standard APIs, enabling broader logistics collaboration across systems, partners, and third-party solutions. It will be implemented as a connected component within the overall TMS architecture.
column84: Application Name & Blockcode: No. Mandate Description Evidence/ comments about how this is achieved S1 End-to-End Encryption - All data in transit and at rest must be encrypted, in compliance with our policies. This applies to data within the SaaS platform, and the integration or access to Delta systems. SAP ensures robust encryption for both data in transit and at rest using AES-256 encryption standards and secure protocols like TLS 1.2 and SAP SNC. SAP HANA databases use built-in volume encryption, with keys securely managed via SAP’s Secure Storage File System or hyperscaler-native services like AWS KMS or Azure Key Vault, following strict segregation of duties. The SAP Private Cloud operates as an extension of the customer’s on-premise network, with the customer responsible for managing secure connectivity—commonly through VPN, MPLS, or cloud peering options. S2 Authentication and Authorization S2.A: All Delta users must be authenticated by Global Auth, including MFA if required by Delta security standards. This requires a federated authentication integration with the SaaS provider. SAP supports Multi-Factor Authentication through SAP Identity Authentication Service. If a customer uses their own Identity Provider that supports MFA, SAP solutions can inherit and enforce those MFA policies through standard integration, such as SAML 2.0. This allows customers to maintain control over their authentication requirements while leveraging SAP's secure infrastructure. S2.B: Credentials used for outbound APIs (i.e. Delta to SaaS provider) must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Credentials used for outbound APIs (from customer to SaaS providers) are typically managed by the customer through their chosen middleware or integration layer. When using SAP Integration Suite or SAP API Management, customers retain control over credential storage, rotation, and access policies, aligning with their internal security standards. SAP provides secure options for credential handling, including encrypted storage and integration with identity providers, but credential lifecycle management remains the customer's responsibility. S2.C: All inbound APIs (i.e. SaaS provider to Delta) must be authorized using the Delta API Authorizer and must be processed through Akamai for our standard WAF and DDoS protection. See above. S2.D: Access to the SaaS solution, and roles within the SaaS solution must be controlled using AD groups managed by SailPoint, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved SAP cloud solutions offer flexible role-based permission controls to manage user access and responsibilities within the application. Roles can be configured to align with business workflows. Additionally, SAP Identity Provisioning Service enables integration with external identity systems, supporting automated role and user provisioning for efficient access management. S2.E: Authorization controls within the SaaS solution must be managed to enforce least privilege. For example, general users should not have "tenant" admin privileges. "Access Management. Access controls provide identity management and grant appropriate access rights (“Access Management Controls”). Access Management Controls are designed to follow the principles of “least privilege,” “need-to-know,” and “segregation of duties.” Personnel Access. SAP personnel are issued a unique identifier to access SAP’s systems. SAP maintains written procedures to administer access authorization changes and access rights are revoked when personnel are no longer authorized to access applicable systems (e.g., termination of employment). Administrative Rights. Administrative rights are only assigned to privileged and technical SAP users on a “least privilege” and “need-to-know” basis. Please see the SAP Cloud soltuion in scope SOC2 report as these processes are attested to within. https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center/certification-compliance.html#soc" S3 Cloud Access Security Broker - The SaaS solution must be integrated with the Delta CASB, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved. This needs to be discussed on what CASB Delta is using and how it's being used. S4 Direct Data Connections (this includes any direct data connectivity such as to databases, message queues, cache services, service bus, file systems, object stores, file transfers, etc.) S4.A: Inbound connections from the SaaS provider to Delta data sources directly via the Internet are not permitted. API, proxy, or other intermediary connectivity solutions must be included so the data sources do not need to be publicly accessible. Inbound connections from SAP cloud services to customer data sources are not made directly over the public Internet. Instead, integration is handled through secure intermediaries such as SAP Integration Suite or customer-managed middleware, ensuring that data sources remain non-public and protected within the customer's controlled network. S4.B: Credentials used to authenticate all direct data traffic must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Credentials used for authenticating direct data traffic in RISE with SAP are managed by the customer when using integration services or middleware. SAP supports secure credential storage and encrypted communication, but credential lifecycle management—including storage, control, and rotation—remains the customer's responsibility to align with their internal security standards. S4.C: Data access controls, and data that is uploaded to the SaaS platform must be strictly limited to only the data necessary for the SaaS solution to function correctly. Data uploaded to SAP cloud solutions is strictly limited to what the customer, as the data owner and controller, chooses to provide. The customer manages user access and permissions, ensuring that only the necessary data required for the solution's functionality is shared and accessed. S5 Logging - The SaaS provider must offer logging or a way to view events for important transactions (e.g. logins, high-value transactions, administrative changes, etc.) "SAP cloud services support multi-layered logging and audit capabilities. At the infrastructure and platform levels, SAP logs system events, configuration changes, and security-relevant activities, which are monitored through centralized Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems to help detect and respond to potential threats. These logs support SAP’s responsibility for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the service.This is attested to within the SAP Cloud SOC2. At the application level, audit trails capture changes such as data modifications, configuration updates, and integration activities, including timestamps and user IDs. These logs are accessible via the SAP cloud application. In SSO-enabled environments, user authentication and identity-related logs typically reside with the customer's Identity Provider (IdP), as identity verification is managed externally. Customers are responsible for monitoring and managing those IdP-level logs as part of their access governance and compliance processes." S6 Restrict Network Access - The Delta tenant of the SaaS solution must only be accessible from the Delta network unless there is a business requirement to allow access from the public Internet. In RISE with SAP, network access to the customer tenant is restricted by default and can be configured to allow access only from the customer’s network. Public Internet access is only enabled if explicitly required by the customer for specific business scenarios, ensuring controlled and secure connectivity.

column84: Application Name & Blockcode: No. Mandate Description Evidence/ comments about how this is achieved S1 End-to-End Encryption - All data in transit and at rest must be encrypted, in compliance with our policies. This applies to data within the SaaS platform, and the integration or access to Delta systems. All data in transit and at rest is encrypted. S2 Authentication and Authorization S2.A: All Delta users must be authenticated by Global Auth, including MFA if required by Delta security standards. This requires a federated authentication integration with the SaaS provider. On Demand customers can implement Federated security for the Vertex Central UI. Customers can use their own Identity provider (IDP) and implement Federated security to the Vertex Auth0 IDP through a SAML 2.0 integration. This gives customers the ability to use SSO for the Vertex UI and leverage their own multi-factor authentication (MFA) application. S2.B: Credentials used for outbound APIs (i.e. Delta to SaaS provider) must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Customers are required to update passwords every 42 days. S2.C: All inbound APIs (i.e. SaaS provider to Delta) must be authorized using the Delta API Authorizer and must be processed through Akamai for our standard WAF and DDoS protection. see API link: https://developer.vertexinc.com/ S2.D: Access to the SaaS solution, and roles within the SaaS solution must be controlled using AD groups managed by SailPoint, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved All roles are managed within the application, they are roles based which determines user access. S2.E: Authorization controls within the SaaS solution must be managed to enforce least privilege. For example, general users should not have "tenant" admin privileges. Least Privilege utilized S3 Cloud Access Security Broker - The SaaS solution must be integrated with the Delta CASB, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved. No, this would be apart of SSO S4 Direct Data Connections (this includes any direct data connectivity such as to databases, message queues, cache services, service bus, file systems, object stores, file transfers, etc.) S4.A: Inbound connections from the SaaS provider to Delta data sources directly via the Internet are not permitted. API, proxy, or other intermediary connectivity solutions must be included so the data sources do not need to be publicly accessible. Yes S4.B: Credentials used to authenticate all direct data traffic must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Yes, stored utilizing Bcrypt5 S4.C: Data access controls, and data that is uploaded to the SaaS platform must be strictly limited to only the data necessary for the SaaS solution to function correctly. Vertex utilizes Rols-based access controls S5 Logging - The SaaS provider must offer logging or a way to view events for important transactions (e.g. logins, high-value transactions, administrative changes, etc.) Delta approved account admin will have access to activity and application logs within the UI. S6 Restrict Network Access - The Delta tenant of the SaaS solution must only be accessible from the Delta network unless there is a business requirement to allow access from the public Internet. Yes

In support of the TechOps' transportation management, Westernacher Consulting, a global leader in SAP-based Transportation Management, has been contracted by Delta to lead a data cleansing initiative. Leveraging their deep expertise in SAP TM and SAP ECC  and S/4HANA, Westernacher will operate the Syniti Data Management platform to perform a one-time clean-up of Delta’s SAP vendor master data.
Syniti’s solution is purpose-built for high-impact data quality projects—eliminating duplicates, correcting errors, and enforcing data standards. Its integration with SAP enables automated workflows and improved compliance, ensuring cleaner, more reliable vendor data.
This initial clean-up, executed by Westernacher using Syniti, will serve as a foundational step toward improved data governance. A long-term solution, such as SAP Master Data Management (MDM), will be evaluated for future implementation to support ongoing data quality and scalability.

column40:
Delta’s SAP vendor master data has degraded over 25 years without proper governance, leading to inaccurate, duplicate, and outdated supplier records. This poor data quality directly undermines the effectiveness of the Transportation Management (TM) system, which relies on clean, consistent vendor data to:
* Accurately plan and execute shipments
* Select optimal carriers and routes
* Ensure timely and compliant deliveries
* Enable cost-effective freight settlement and invoicing
Without reliable vendor data, the TM system faces delays, errors, and inefficiencies that ripple across the supply chain—impacting service levels, increasing costs, and reducing visibility.
column41:
To mitigate long-standing data quality issues, Delta is launching a one-time vendor master data cleansing initiative using the Syniti Data Management platform, operated by Westernacher Consulting. This effort aims to restore data integrity and unlock the full value of Delta’s SAP Transportation Management (TM) investment.
By cleansing the vendor master data, Delta will:
* Improve shipment accuracy and planning
* Reduce transportation costs through better carrier selection and routing
* Enhance compliance and audit readiness
* Accelerate freight settlement and reduce disputes
* Increase overall supply chain efficiency and visibility
column42:
* Data Quality Management: Cleans, standardizes, and validates data
* Master Data Governance: Centralizes control of critical data
* Deduplication & Matching: Identifies and merges duplicate records

column65:
This STR documents the engagement of Westernacher, a systems integrator (SI) specializing in SAP Transportation Management (SAP TM), to perform a one-time master data clean-up using Syniti’s data cleansing platform. This initiative is critical to ensure accurate, consistent, and high-quality data for the successful deployment of SAP TM.

However, while this one-time clean-up is necessary, it is not sufficient for long-term data integrity. In the absence of the SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) add-on, the business must implement and enforce a stringent master data management policy to sustain data quality.

Consequences of Slowly Degrading Data Quality on TMS
If data quality is not actively maintained post-cleanup, the TMS will experience a gradual decline in performance and reliability, leading to:

- Inefficient transportation planning due to outdated or incorrect location, product, or carrier data.
- Increased operational costs from delivery errors, rework, and poor carrier selection.
- Reduced automation, requiring more manual intervention and increasing the risk of human error.
- Compliance risks from inaccurate documentation or regulatory breaches.
- Unreliable analytics, undermining decision-making and strategic planning.
- User frustration, potentially leading to system abandonment and the rise of shadow processes.

column9:
Crew wants to migrate its existing Oracle Exadata DBs from on-prem to AWS.  See following paragraphs for product details. 

​Oracle Exadata is an enterprise database platform running Oracle Database workloads of any scale and criticality with high performance, availability, and security. Exadata’s scale-out design employs unique optimizations letting transaction processing, analytics, artificial intelligence, and mixed workloads run faster and more efficiently. Consolidating diverse Oracle Database workloads on Exadata platforms in enterprise data centers, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), and multicloud environments helps organizations increase operational efficiency, reduce IT administration, and lower costs. -- https://www.oracle.com/engineered-systems/exadata/  

​Oracle Database@AWS lets you migrate your Oracle Exadata workloads, including Oracle RAC workloads, to Oracle Exadata Database Service on Dedicated Infrastructure or Oracle Autonomous Database on Dedicated Exadata Infrastructure within AWS. It enables easier and quicker migrations with minimal to no database or application changes while maintaining full feature and architecture compatibility, performance, and availability. Customers can establish low-latency connections between Oracle Database@AWS and applications deployed in AWS, including on Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2).-- https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/featured-seller/oracle/

column40:
​​This product is required because Crew is moving to AWS, and existing AWS RDS DBs don’t provide the performance required by Crew apps.  This has been proven by comparing on-prem performance tests to AWS RDS Oracle 19c performance tests.​ 

-              Traffic from the Oracle Database Network(ODBN) will traverse the transit VPC and route over the Delta TGW.
•	The TGW attachment associated with the transit VPC for the associated AZ will be associated to the matching environment route table.
o	For example, if the ODBN is configured in mig-si, then the two transit VPC's will belong to the SI Route table.
•	They will adhere to all of the transit gateway routing requirements as any other application would.
o	Routing by default is allowed in like environments, if routing to another environment(ex, SI to PRD), it will traverse the Interconnect Firewall.
o	If routing to PCI in any capacity, it will go to the PCI firewall first.

Lattice is also required which is an AWS networking construct similar to privatelink but obfuscates more pieces. It is used for supporting services & connectivity to S3.
column41:

- ​Reduction in AWS costs due to software and database savings.  See page 19-22 in attached doc.

column9:
Databricks is a unified, cloud-based analytics platform designed to handle the full spectrum of
data, analytics, and AI workloads. It integrates data engineering, data science, machine learning, and
business analytics into a single collaborative environment. Databricks leverages the Lakehouse
architecture, combining the scalability of data lakes with the reliability and performance of data
warehouses. It supports both batch and streaming data, provides managed Apache Spark clusters, and
incorporates advanced governance with Unity Catalog. Generative AI capabilities are natively integrated,
allowing users to interact with data and code using natural language, and to accelerate analytics and AI
solution development.

Key components of the Databricks platform include:

Databricks Workspace: A collaborative environment for data engineering, data science, and
analytics teams to develop notebooks, dashboards, and machine learning solutions.

Lakehouse Architecture: Combines data warehousing and data lake functionalities into a single
platform, enabling flexible and performant data storage and access for batch as well as real-time
analytics.

Governance Framework: Integrated governance capabilities to manage data access, track
lineage, and ensure compliance through features like Unity Catalog for discovery, auditing, and
secure sharing of assets.

AI/ML Integration: Native support for machine learning workflows, MLOps, experiment tracking,
feature stores, and integration with popular open-source and proprietary LLMs for Gen AI use
cases.

On AWS, Databricks integrates directly with cloud-native storage (Amazon S3), security (IAM, KMS), and
networking (VPC, PrivateLink) services, ensuring compatibility with existing infrastructure and compliance
standards.

We are in alignment internally and that Databricks is the contemporary data lake solution.

column40:
AWS-native tools often face challenges such as fragmented data systems,
slow analytics, and operational inefficiencies. Databricks addresses these by unifying data processing,
analytics, and AI on a single platform, eliminating silos and streamlining workflows. Its Lakehouse
approach allows teams to access consistent, reliable data, while its integration with AWS infrastructure
ensures performance and scalability. Databricks also simplifies the deployment of generative AI and
advanced analytics, making it easier to move from experimentation to production within a governed
environment.

Fragmentation: Siloed services (e.g., Glue for ETL, Redshift for warehousing, SageMaker for
ML) create integration hurdles and inconsistencies.

Complexity: Orchestrating secure, reliable, and performant pipelines across distributed data and
teams is operationally complex.

Advancing AI Initiatives: Running Gen AI workloads at scale requires specialized infrastructure,
seamless access to fresh, high-quality data, and governance controls.

Databricks addresses these challenges by delivering a unified platform that streamlines analytics,
enforces data governance, and accelerates the adoption of generative AI and machine learning at an
enterprise level.
column41:
Databricks delivers measurable business value by:

Accelerating Time to Insights: Unified analytics and ML workflows minimize
development cycles and promote data reuse, enabling faster and more informed
decision-making.

Boosting Productivity & Collaboration: Collaborative workspaces, shared assets, and
standardized practices reduce silos and foster cross-team innovation.

Enabling Trust & Compliance: Robust governance and lineage tools reduce risk,
streamline audits, and ensure data privacy and regulatory compliance, which is
increasingly critical across industries.

Driving Innovation with Gen AI: By making generative AI accessible on enterprise
data, Databricks unlocks new revenue streams, enhances customer experience, and
streamlines operations through automation.

Reducing Operational Overhead: Fully managed infrastructure, scalable compute, and
unified security simplify operations and reduce TCO (total cost of ownership) versus maintaining separate,
piecemeal solutions.
column42:
Lakehouse Storage with ACID transaction support (via Delta Lake) for unified batch and
streaming data processing.
Interactive and Scheduled Notebooks supporting multiple languages (SQL, Python, Scala, R),
built-in visualization, and version control.
Automated Data Ingestion and ETL with job orchestration, scheduling, and built-in connectors
for common data sources (AWS S3, RDS, Redshift, external APIs).

Unified Governance through Unity Catalog for consistent access control, data discovery,
auditing, and lineage tracking across all Databricks workspaces.

Secure Data Sharing internally and externally via Delta Sharing protocol.
Advanced Analytics with built-in MLflow for experiment tracking, model management, and
production deployment.

Support for Gen AI and LLMs: Integration with open-source models, Databricks Foundation
Model APIs, vector search capabilities, and tools for building RAG (Retrieval Augmented
Generation) systems using enterprise data.

Scalable Compute: Elastic clusters managed by Databricks, optimized for both performance and
cost.

Integration with AWS Services: IAM for secure authentication/authorization, S3 for storage,
CloudWatch for monitoring, and seamless deployment in AWS-native environments.
column43:
On AWS, Databricks is deployed in the customer's own AWS account (customer-managed VPC
deployment) or as a Databricks-managed environment, depending on preferences and security
requirements.

Data Residency: All data storage, including raw, processed, and analytic datasets, remains
within AWS regions selected by the customer. Databricks operates directly on the customer's
Amazon S3 buckets, and no data is moved out of the region unless explicitly configured by the
customer.

Data Processing: Compute resources (Databricks clusters) are provisioned within the customer's
environment, using EC2 instances, ensuring compliance with AWS region residency policies and
security postures.

Security & Compliance: Databricks leverages AWS-native security features—such as
encryption at rest/in transit, KMS key management, network isolation (VPC), and PrivateLink—for
secure data access and processing. Customers retain control over data egress, storage
locations, and auditability.

Governance: Unity Catalog ensures data access is restricted according to enterprise policies,
and all activities are logged for regulatory compliance.

This architecture ensures that Databricks meets stringent enterprise requirements for data residency,
security, and sovereignty within the AWS ecosystem, while enabling secure and scalable analytics and AI
processing.

column9:
Selenium is an open-source automation tool primarily used for testing web applications across different browsers and platforms. It allows developers and testers to write test scripts in various programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, and JavaScript, making it highly versatile and widely adopted.
Below are key highlights on its advantages over other competitive tools:
-Early Bug Detection: Introducing Selenium early in the development cycle helps catch bugs before they reach production.
-Scalability: It enables scalable testing strategies, including parallel and remote execution using Selenium Grid or cloud-based services.
-Cost-Effective: Being open-source, it reduces the cost of testing tools while offering robust capabilities.
-Improved Quality Assurance: Automated testing with Selenium enhances the reliability and quality of web applications
column25:
7/17/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA
This Tool is currently used as primary Automation Support tool in Delta
column35:

Official Documentation: https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/
Selenium IDE Help: https://www.seleniumhq.org/selenium-ide/help/
column40:
- Cross-Browser Compatibility: Selenium supports major browsers like Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge, ensuring consistent behavior of web applications across platforms.
- Automation Efficiency: It automates repetitive testing tasks, reducing manual effort and increasing testing speed and accuracy.
- Integration with CI/CD: Selenium integrates seamlessly with tools like Jenkins, Maven, and Docker, supporting continuous integration and delivery pipelines.
- Language and Framework Support: It supports multiple programming languages and testing frameworks, making it adaptable to various development environments.

column9:
Cypress is a modern, open-source JavaScript-based end-to-end testing framework designed specifically for web applications. It enables developers and QA engineers to write fast, reliable, and maintainable tests directly in the browser.
Here are the reasons why Cypress needs to be introduced:
-Improves Test Reliability: Reduces flakiness common in other testing tools.
-Speeds Up Development: Faster feedback loop during development and testing.
-Enhances Collaboration: Developers and testers can work together using the same tool and language.
-Modern Architecture: Cypress doesn’t rely on external drivers, making setup and execution simpler.
-Cost-Effective: Being open-source, it reduces licensing costs while offering enterprise-grade features.
-CI/CD Integration: Easily integrates with continuous integration tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, and GitLab CI.
-Built-In Dashboard: Offers a visual interface to monitor test runs, making it easier to track failures and performance.

This tool is currently used by various teams in Delta.
column40:
-Faster Releases: Speeds up QA cycles, enabling quicker time-to-market.
-Higher Quality: Detects bugs early, improving product stability.
-Cost Savings: Reduces manual testing and QA overhead.
-Developer Productivity: Empowers developers to write and debug tests efficiently.
Technical Reasons
-Automatic Waiting: Reduces flaky tests by waiting for elements to load.
-Real-Time Feedback: Live reloading and detailed error reporting.
-Network Control: Easy mocking/stubbing of API calls.
-All-in-One Tooling: No need for external libraries or drivers.
-CI/CD Friendly: Seamless integration with modern DevOps pipelines.
column41: Adopting Cypress delivers measurable ROI by accelerating release cycles, reducing manual testing costs, and improving product quality. column9:
Playwright is a modern, open-source automation framework developed by Microsoft for testing web applications. It enables reliable end-to-end testing across multiple browsers, devices, and platforms, using a single API. Playwright supports JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, C#, and Java, making it highly versatile for developers and QA teams.
Key features:
Cross-Browser Testing: Supports Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit, ensuring wide browser coverage.
Auto-Waiting Mechanism: Automatically waits for elements to be ready, reducing flaky tests.
Headless and Headed Modes: Supports both for faster CI runs and local debugging.
Multi-Language Support: Works with popular languages like JavaScript, Python, and C#.
Built-in Test Runner: Comes with its own test runner and parallel execution support.
Mobile Emulation: Simulates mobile devices for responsive testing.
Network Interception: Allows mocking and modifying network requests for advanced testing scenarios

column9:
Care Coordinator Program –provided by Transcarent
Transcarent is a valuable resource designed to help employees access high-quality care at top-rated medical facilities. Through this program, employees are paired with a dedicated care coordinator who supports them throughout the entire process. Additionally, the program offers a single, all-inclusive cost for surgical procedures, simplifying both planning and payment.
column25:
7/30/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA, VRA, Contract
The vendor agreement began on January 1, 2020, under the name BridgeHealth Medical Inc., which has since transitioned to Transcarent Inc. There are no prior STRs (Security and Technology Reviews) on file for this vendor. Transcarent already has Single Sign-On (SSO) integration through Quantum Health, which supports SSO access for all benefit participants. Delta only brokers services for employees, who represent just a subset of the total participant population.
column40:
The primary business driver for this request is to provide employees with comprehensive support for upcoming surgeries through access to high-quality care and streamlined coordination. Transcarent (formerly BridgeHealth) offers a Care Coordinator Program that connects employees with top-performing surgical facilities and assigns a dedicated care coordinator to guide them through every step of the process. This not only improves health outcomes but also enhances the employee experience by reducing complexity and stress during a critical time.

From a technical perspective, the integration with Transcarent is supported by Single Sign-On (SSO), which has been established through Quantum Health. This ensures secure and seamless access for all benefit recipients—not just Delta employees—reflecting the broader scope of the program. The use of SSO also aligns with enterprise security standards by minimizing authentication risks and improving user experience.

Additionally, all data exchanged and retained by Transcarent is governed by HIPAA regulations, ensuring that personal health information (PHI) is protected with strict confidentiality and security measures. Data retention policies are compliant with HIPAA requirements, safeguarding information throughout its lifecycle.

To further align with enterprise IT governance, we are currently pursuing SaaS Mandate responses from Transcarent. This will help validate their compliance with our internal standards for data privacy, security, and system integration.
column41:
The integration of Transcarent’s Care Coordinator Program delivers significant value to both employees and Delta as a self-insured organization.

Improved Employee Support: Employees facing surgery are connected with a dedicated care coordinator who guides them through every step—from selecting a high-quality provider to managing logistics. This personalized support enhances the employee experience, reduces stress, and promotes better health outcomes.

Access to High-Quality, Cost-Effective Care: Transcarent partners with top-rated surgical facilities, ensuring employees receive high-quality care at predictable, bundled rates. This model helps avoid unnecessary procedures and complications, which can drive up costs.

Cost Savings for Employees and Delta: Employees benefit from reduced out-of-pocket expenses due to the fixed-cost structure for surgeries. In turn, Delta benefits from lower overall claims costs, which directly impacts the company’s bottom line as a self-insured entity. By steering care to high-value providers, the program helps control rising healthcare expenses while maintaining quality.

Secure and Compliant Integration: The program is supported by Single Sign-On (SSO) through Quantum Health, ensuring secure access for all benefit recipients. All data handling complies with HIPAA regulations, protecting personal health information and aligning with enterprise data governance standards.

Ongoing Compliance and Risk Management: Delta is actively pursuing SaaS Mandate responses from Transcarent to ensure continued alignment with internal security, privacy, and compliance requirements.
column42:

-Surgical Care Navigation: Connects employees with high-quality surgical providers and facilities.
-Personalized Care Coordination: Assigns a dedicated care coordinator to guide employees through the entire surgical journey.
-Cost Transparency and Predictability: Offers bundled, fixed pricing for surgeries, reducing financial uncertainty for employees.
-SSO-Enabled Access: Ensures secure, seamless access for all benefit recipients via Single Sign-On through Quantum Health.
-HIPAA-Compliant Data Handling: Maintains strict data privacy and security standards for all personal health information.
-Cost Containment for Delta: Reduces overall healthcare spend by steering care to high-value providers, benefiting Delta as a self-insured employer.
Planning to request a Level 3 of

column40:
Seamless voucher creation and adoption within the Lyft Platform will allow Delta to cover the cost of rides and meals for employees, teams, or customers.

Examples of voucher use:
•	Rides to and from other airports in region
•	Employee recognition and appreciation
•	Employee training programs
•	Event rides and meals
•	Elite status member recognition

Access to creating vouchers is managed manually today by SCM which creates the risk of users creating vouchers when they have changed areas and should no longer have this access.   

Access in the future will be managed by the Bogota team (SCM Corporate).  They will control who has access to the membership group that will be sent to Lyft for a Voucher dashboard to be created.  They will also confirm with Management and Finance the amount of money the Delta user is authorized to spend.  

The 4 use cases for creating the vouchers are as follows:
1.	Crew
2.	ACS IROPs
3.	Global Meetings and Events
4.	Divisional Events

This does not impact employees who have Lyft loaded to their phone and use it for meals and rides (personal and/or company business) while traveling.

column9:
Auditboard is a SaaS (AWS) solution that streamlines the audit planning, fieldwork, testing, and reporting in one intuitive platform, and enable teams to take on more strategic projects.  

AuditBoard is an application used by Corporate Audit and wants to add AI functionality to an existing product. 
 
AuditBoard AI utilizes machine learning to power two new capabilities: “Generative” and “Intelligent Recommendations”. The Generative feature allows for the AI service to propose wording for control, risk, and audit description fields in the product. The Intelligent Recommendations feature proposes mappings to consider across controls and frameworks within AuditBoard. In both cases, the user is responsible for reviewing and accepting the output. There is no automated decision making involved. 

AuditBoard can support multiple risk assessment methodologies. Upon creation of a risk assessment, users can choose which methodology to apply. Automated scoring for risk assessments exists today. Calculations can be customized to meet the needs of the customer. For example H, M, L ranking of risk factors can drive the overall inherent risk rating, and Control Strength can be used in combination with this to determine overall residual risk. 

AuditBoard has built in workflows.  

AuditBoard AI is an opt-in feature, disabled by default.
column25:
9/9/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA, Modify MSA to include AI language
Next VRA Feb 2027
column40:
Auditboard provides a cost effective SaaS solution that provides workpaper management, workflow, and dashboarding specialized to internal audit departments. 

AuditBoard AI will elevate every user of our platform by providing intelligent insights and automation driven off of a wide range of audit, risk, compliance, operational and external data sources. This rapid technology advancement is a critical unlock to organizations achieving a “Connected Risk” vision, while also giving teams enormous leverage -- improving both efficiency and efficacy of day-to-day work. 

Principles 
•  Purpose-built: AI designed specifically to address audit, risk and compliance outcomes. 
•  Connected: AI that leverages contextual data from across and outside the organization to achieve insights that no individual could be expected to gather on their own. 
•  Intuitive: Designed for humans, not computers. 
•  Safe: Designed to give maximum leverage while addressing the risks inherent to AI. 

AuditBoard AI features are not enabled by default and require customers to opt-in

column65: The Poppulo Digital Signage Toolkit is approved for continued use within Delta Air Lines' DSX-supported portfolio, as it remains a critical component in delivering dynamic and data-driven content across DeltaVision (DLV) and Flight Information Displays (FIDs). As the longstanding software provider, Poppulo (formerly FourWinds Interactive) is fully integrated with Delta’s internal systems, including API sources, SharePoint, Xovis, and Density feeds, ensuring seamless delivery of real-time metrics and operational data to both campus and public airport digital signage. This STR submission serves to align existing vendor documentation with current Delta compliance processes, recognizing the software’s established presence and essential role in Delta’s digital signage infrastructure.
column84: Validation of Databases/Code Backups Q: How often does Poppulo take backups of our digital signage database(s)? A: Database backup is done once per day between 12am – 4am. Q: What is the proper restore process procedure (engagement method/channel, etc)? A: Current process is that Tech Support is notified - (303) 313-3000. TS will work with our Dev. Operations team (back end) to implement the restored version. Poppulo will need to be told the date that Delta would like to restore to. For example, if you need to restore right now 2:30pm, we will utilize the 9/17/24 overnight record. Please note urgent to TS and we will move the case to the front of the queue. Overnight escalations (5pm MT-8am MT) will be picked up immediately at 8am. Please notify your Customer Success Manager as well for communication and escalation.

Localeez by ADVEEZ is a real-time data management platform designed to optimize the monitoring and control of ground support equipment and other fleet assets. Here's a breakdown of what it offers:
 
What Localeez does:

Real-Time Monitoring: Tracks the status of assets (e.g., inactive, in service, in use) and their performance.
Available via a web platform and mobile app, making it accessible from tablets and smartphones. 
Fleet Overview: Provides a comprehensive map view of all assets, including geofencing and real-time alerts. 
Data Analytics: Converts raw data into actionable insights with KPIs, usage reports, and maintenance reminders. 
Safety & Security: Monitors events like shocks and battery levels, helping improve operational safety and proactive maintenance.
Allows users to locate and manage ground support equipment (GSE) directly from the tarmac. 
Displays equipment by airport and division, with map-based visualization for quick location tracking.
 
Requires ADVEEZ-provided credentials for access.

column84: Articulate 360's SaaS mandate in 2025 is characterized by a commitment to providing a continually evolving, cloud-based platform that offers a comprehensive suite of tools and resources for creating, collaborating on, and distributing engaging and accessible e-learning content.
column85: Articulate has been actively expanding its AI capabilities within the Articulate 360 platform throughout 2025, focusing on streamlining e-learning content creation and enhancing accessibility. Utilize AI Assistant in Rise and Storyline to build courses significantly faster, up to 9 times quicker, by automating tasks like drafting, generating quizzes, and summarizing content. Articulate emphasizes its commitment to responsible AI, ensuring user control, zero data retention with AI subprocessors, and the non-use of customer content to train their AI models. AI Assistant is specifically built for instructional design, providing high-quality and relevant content while allowing course creators to remain in control throughout the process. These advancements in Articulate 360 AI aim to empower e-learning creators of all skill levels to develop engaging and accessible courses more efficiently while upholding ethical AI practices.

This project aims to transform Delta’s policy management framework through the deployment of AI-powered automation and centralized knowledge hubs. By integrating intelligent tools for policy classification, creation, and lifecycle management, the project will:
 
Accelerate policy publication by streamlining end-to-end workflows and significantly reducing manual effort.
Automate the policy lifecycle with AI-driven capabilities for drafting, reviewing, and updating content—ensuring consistency and compliance.
Establish centralized, structured policy hubs that act as a single source of truth—enabling collaborative editing, seamless approvals, and enterprise-wide alignment.

column40:
The core rationale for introducing Narratize centers on transforming how policy information is managed and communicated across the enterprise. 
The product is intended to:
Establish a Central Policy Hub: Narratize enables a unified, AI-ready repository for policy content, integrating enterprise-wide rules with business unit-specific nuances.
Ensure Consistency and Accuracy: By centralizing policy documentation, the platform reduces discrepancies and ensures that all stakeholders access the most current and accurate information.
Leverage Generative AI: Narratize uses GenAI to assist policy authors in drafting, tagging, and interpreting content, streamlining the creation and maintenance of policy documents.
Automate Workflows: It supports robust review and approval processes, proactively managing policy expirations and adapting to evolving business needs.
column41:
Centralized Policy Governance -( Delta Policy Hub) - Narratize creates a unified, AI-ready hub for managing enterprise-wide and business-unit-specific policies, reducing fragmentation and improving compliance.
Efficiency Gains - Automates policy drafting, review, and approval workflows—reducing manual effort and accelerating time-to-market for policy updates.
Improved ROI - By minimizing rework and compliance risks, Delta Policy Hub - Narratize helps teams focus on high-value tasks, leading to better resource utilization and cost savings.
Cross-Functional Collaboration - Enables seamless handoffs between R&D, engineering, marketing, and compliance teams, ensuring alignment and reducing delays.
AI-Driven Insights - Leverages generative AI to assist in drafting, tagging, and interpreting policy content, enhancing accuracy and reducing ambiguity.
column42:
🧠 Core Functional Capabilities
Write and edit policies from scratch or adapt existing ones for different personas.
Automatically generate metadata and tags for better search and classification.
Manage relationships between policies (e.g., parent-child, sibling links).
Detect policy conflicts and trigger updates based on expiration or business changes.
Support multi-user review and approval workflows with audit trails.
Publish policies to a centralized hub and notify users of updates.
🤖 AI & Automation Features
Assist authors with drafting and refining content using generative AI.
Enable contextual, AI-powered search across policy content.
Tailor responses based on user roles (e.g., employee vs. customer).
(Planned) Retrieve and update specific “chunks” of policy content for precision.
🔐 Security & Compliance
Encrypt data and enforce access control by user type.
Protect against AI risks like prompt injection, hallucinations, and bias.
Maintain audit trails for all actions and approvals.
Ensure data residency and process only non-sensitive, public-facing content.
🔧 Integration & Scalability
Provide APIs for integration with platforms like AWS and S3 1.
Offer omni-channel access (desktop, mobile, print).
Support intuitive version control and historical tracking.
Scale to support high volumes of users and interactions.

AutoIt is a freeware BASIC-like scripting language designed for automating the Windows GUI and general scripting. It uses a combination of simulated keystrokes, mouse movement and window/control manipulation in order to automate tasks.

The code base for the last ten years will not be recoded into Blue Prism, I will be retiring from Delta in 6 months, existing code must be turned over as is in AutoIT. 

It is up to management to determine future development in the years to come.

column40:
AutoIt is essential because it is the established language used to develop, edit, and compile the company’s existing automation scripts. Over the years, a significant investment has been made in building a robust and functional codebase using AutoIt. Introducing a new product built around AutoIt ensures continuity, minimizes disruption, and allows the company to leverage existing assets without the need for a costly and time-consuming rewrite in another language.

The code base for the last ten years will not be recoded into Blue Prism, I will be retiring from Delta in 6 months, existing code must be turned over as is in AutoIT.
It is up to management to determine future development in the years to come.
column41:
Maintaining and enhancing the current AutoIt-based solution offers several business benefits:

•	Cost Efficiency: Avoids the high cost of rewriting or migrating legacy code to a new platform.
•	Reduced Risk: Keeps proven, stable automation in place, minimizing the risk of introducing bugs or downtime.
•	Faster Turnaround: Enhancements and fixes can be implemented quickly by building on the existing framework.
•	Knowledge Retention: Preserves the institutional knowledge embedded in the current scripts, reducing the learning curve for new developers.
column42:
The AutoIt-based product provides the following capabilities:

•	Automated GUI Interaction: Automates complex Windows-based workflows that would otherwise require manual input.
•	Custom Tooling: Supports internal tools tailored to specific business processes, increasing operational efficiency.
•	Rapid Prototyping: Enables quick development and deployment of automation solutions for evolving business needs.
•	System Integration: Interfaces with legacy systems and third-party applications without requiring API access.
•	Task Scheduling and Monitoring: Automates repetitive tasks on a schedule, with built-in logging and error handling.

column9:
•	Product Description:  
The IBM® SevOne® Network Performance Management (NPM) solution helps you spot, address, and prevent hybrid network performance issues early from a single source. Boost on-premise, SDN, SD-WAN, and Wi-Fi network performance and improve user application experience by proactively monitoring multivendor end-to-end networks. Transform raw network performance data into intelligent and actionable insights across enterprise, communication, and managed service provider networks. The SevOne NPM solution goes beyond detection, combining industry-leading expertise and advanced technology to help the IT team plan, optimize the network and act on what matters.

SevOne Data Insight is an integrated component of IBM® SevOne® Network Performance Management (NPM), which leverages real-time monitoring coupled with easy ways for any user to find, use and share valuable network performance insights. Data Insight delivers simple, reusable, and scalable reporting, utilizing easy-to-use troubleshooting workflows while unifying SevOne NPM with third-party data. A major component of Data Insight, LiveMaps elevates the most significant network problems so that IT professionals can quickly see incidents from a single source.

Built into IBM® SevOne® Network Performance Management (NPM), the Data Appliance Network Management System (NMS) extracts a broad range of multivendor data from all layers of virtual (VMware), cloud (AWS and Azure), and physical networks and infrastructure. With performance metrics to flow and Application first workflows, SevOne NPM leverages a growing set of data enrichment techniques, including automated baselining, anomaly detection, and topology awareness. Data Appliance helps reduce service delivery risk through integrated alerting and reporting.

•	The scope of the project will include collecting monitoring and performance metrics from On-Premise and AWS network devices (LAN/WAN Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Load Balancers, UPS devices, etc) for monitoring tools rationalization efforts to retire legacy Broadcom DxNetOps tool suite.
•	The virtual appliances will be targeted to add to new monitoring subnet to be created in Arista network. This will require updates to firewall rules and device Access Control Lists to allow the solution to collect data from network infrastructure devices.
•	No additional onprem compute resources are required other than the VM appliances and storage.

TCS MasterCraft™ is an internal tool used by TCS for application code conversation and modernization.   It is required for a TCS Proof of Concept to convert Natural code (mainframe) to Java as part of the Detla mainframe modernization program.

NOTE:  TCS Mastercraft™ will be used only with in Revenue Accounting domain.
column25:
9/4/25: STR approved
Pending item: Evaluation agreement
VRA is due in November 2025
TCS MasterCraft provides an automated approach to modernize the legacy mainframe applications, delivering the
desired output with considerable saving in effort ,time and Cost. The product takes an AI-first approach towards Legacy modernization by
augmenting several of its core features with AI/ Gen-AI capabilities. It addresses typical challenges faced by enterprises during their
legacy modernization journey:

Application Analysis: Lack of sufficient documentation on the legacy system and/ or unavailability of Subject Matter Experts results
in gaps in application knowledge due to which there is a risk of missing out critical functionalities during the transformation to the
new system. TCS MasterCraft™ enables Application Analysis, it can automatically analyze the existing legacy code to generate
Application insights.

Natural to Java Code Conversion: Traditional Application development techniques are unable to handle the speed and complexity
of today’s dynamic business requirements. Organizations are looking for automated development platforms with Forward
Engineering capabilities to enable agility and rapid innovation. The TCS MasterCraft™ modernizes the large-scale application from
legacy to modern tech stack leveraging GenA

Why are they not using Q CLI or the other tools GenAI code assist tools?  We cannot use Amazon Q alone to get Natural/Cobol + Adabase broken down into java. We also will need to extract the files that are in Ctrl-M and batch jobs from Mainframe and Reverse engineer and then pick and choose to go forward. We will most probably have a discovery phase and involvement with Business to check if we want to add any other functions too.
column40:
Delta IT - Revenue Accounting is requesting a proof of concept from TCS in converting a 30 year old mainframe application (SOFRS) from Natural Adabase to Java.  TSC has a proprietary technology (TCS Master Craft) that they use to convet mainframe technology to modern distributed application source code (in this case Java).  Approval of TCS Master Craft for use in the POC is required.  The application will be installed temporarily (during the POC period) on AWS ECS virtual machines (standard Linux image)  and then removed (and the EC2 instances decommissioned) after the POC is complete.  

LLM Recommendation:
Anthropic models accessed via Amazon Bedrock are recommended as the preferred long-term solution.
For the pilot phase, the OpenAI GPT-4o model may be utilized alongside Anthropic models for a limited duration of up to six months.   FYI Team met with Brett Valentine to discuss the LLM model and to get guidance on this.
column41: The business benefit is a streamlined and fast process to convert 30 year old mainframe code to an modern Java source code so that  the application can be quickly migrated from the mainframe environment to a distributed environment where it can be modernized with readily available development resources.  Currently SOFRS is supported by a single Delta IT employee (developer) so there is continnual risk to the business while this application continues to run on the mainframe.  Cost is another benefit as the cost to run this application on the mainframe and pay Software AG licensing continues to be a burden for Delta Air Lines for little benefit.
column42: automated conversation of legacy software written in Natural to a modern language like Java.

column9: Delta’s Onboard Service (OBS) team currently lacks a structured method for tracking untouched food and beverage items, products that are loaded onto flights, remain unused, and are subsequently removed and discarded. To enhance visibility into passenger inventory consumption and optimize Pre and Post flight catering operations, Delta aims to continue its collaboration with Countifi. Leveraging AI-driven solutions, Countifi will provide the Inventory Platform, an advanced, accurate technology system designed to improve verification and transparency across these processes.
column40:
The Aviation Sustainability Forum has reported that the airline industry wastes over $4 billion dollars annually on untouched food and beverages (items that go on the plane, are never touched, taken off the plane and thrown away). Delta’s Onboard Service (OBS) team currently has no systematic way to track onboard passenger consumption and would like to continue to work with Countifi to gain additional visibility into passenger inventory consumption and pre and post flight catering processes. The OBS team stated the following issues with the current inventory management processes:
 
·      No consistent data around passenger consumption and product seasonality needs
·      Minimal visibility to determine accuracy of inventory orders by product
·      Minimal visibility to validate in preflight tray set up (TSU) accuracy
·      Minimal visibility into quantifiable food waste post flight
 
To provide Delta with a consistent, accurate AI based technology platform to increase its verification of and visibility into these processes, Countifi will provide the Countifi Inventory Platform (CiP).
column41:
Countifi’s AI-powered platform delivers product-level visibility into passenger consumption, a capability currently unavailable to Delta. By providing actionable data, the platform enables Delta to identify consumption trends, gain insight into customer preferences, detect and address anomalies in inventory usage, and confirm tray specifications. These insights have empowered Delta’s Onboard Service team to streamline operations, reduce costs and fuel consumption, and uphold consistent, high-quality service standards.
Over the course of a 6-month proof of concept with Countifi, Delta leveraged platform-driven insights to optimize inventory loading on flights under 900 miles. These adjustments delivered a one-time CASM savings of $6 per flight—affecting an estimated 40% of Delta’s flight network
column42:
Countifi is an AI-powered inventory management and analytics platform designed to integrate effortlessly into existing operations. It streamlines data management while delivering real-time visibility into inventory levels, passenger consumption, customer preferences, and broader usage trends. More than just an inventory tool, Countifi equips clients to make smarter decisions through accurate, data-driven insights and advanced analytics.

Its robust ecosystem includes both web and mobile interfaces, installed hardware capable of capturing still images and video, and a fully customizable reporting dashboard. The platform also supports media ingestion from external sources via upload or API, ensuring seamless data integration across channels

column25: This solution will leverage the DevTools service to be developed
column40: Copado is a Salesforce-SaaS hosted application that enables DevOps within the Salesforce platform. Delta Global Sales would like to pursue this platform to help manage their deployments, particularly for admin-side configuration, to ensure rollback is possible (very cumbersome in standard Salesforce) and it is easier to control change. Delta is looking to utilize Copado as a DevOps solution to help manage deployments, including of configuration-based functionality, within the Salesforce core/CRM platform.
column41: Copado delivers significant business value by accelerating release cycles through automated CI/CD pipelines, which reduces deployment time and increases delivery speed. Its integrated toolset improves developer productivity by minimizing manual work and rework, while fostering better collaboration across cross-functional teams. With built-in compliance, audit tracking, and rollback capabilities, Copado reduces deployment risk and ensures regulatory alignment. Additionally, its robotic testing offers end-to-end, scriptless automation that scales across platforms, lowering QA effort and increasing test coverage. These efficiencies contribute to faster time-to-value and can lead to measurable cost savings in development labor, reduced downtime, and fewer production defects—supporting a strong ROI as outlined in the business case justification.
column42: Copado offers a robust set of business capabilities that streamline and govern the software delivery lifecycle. These include centralized version control for managing Salesforce metadata, CI/CD automation to accelerate build, test, and deployment processes, and user story management for full traceability from development to release. It also provides environment management to detect conflicts and dependencies early, and release governance features such as role-based approvals and policy enforcement to ensure compliance and reduce deployment risk. Together, these capabilities support faster, more reliable, and audit-ready software delivery.

column65:
Salesforce is a business team managed SaaS product that has become more and more core to how Global Sales does business over the last 10 years.  They have many complex business process flows, reports, etc. that they maintain, outside IT processes.  Currently, they have no automated way to manage deployments or track changes to the processes logic, site configuration, etc.  Copado provides deployment management, change tracking, and rollback capabilities to a process that covers 8+ Salesforce Orgs (Prod, SI, Stage, and several development orgs).  It replaces an almost entirely manual change management DevOps process.  Compared to competing Salesforce DevOps tools, Copado is widely considered to be the best, both for its user-friendly UI with point-and-click management (targeting a non-IT user base), and enterprise grade control and governance.

Since Global Sales uses Salesforce for sensitive Delta-proprietary data and processes, the Global Sales IT team and Delta Salesforce COE have partnered with Global Sales business and Copado to allow all source code (aka Salesforce metadata) to be stored in the Delta GitLab instance; as opposed to using a public GitHub repo.  This required creation of a solution developed in partnership with the Delta DevOps team, and approved by Security, to expose a public integration endpoint, allowing Copado to connect to the Delta GitLab instance from outside the Delta firewall.

I recommend proceeding with Copado.  It provides much needed process automation and source control that is lacking in this very large Salesforce instance.  Other than initial setup mentioned above, it is not anticipated to require ongoing IT support.

column65:
- Accelerates Feedback Loop: Automating code reviews at merge request time ensures developers receive immediate, actionable feedback, reducing bottlenecks and speeding up delivery.

- Improves Code Quality Early: Bedrock’s foundation models can detect issues like poor structure, security flaws, or non-compliance with coding standards before code reaches production.

- Reduces Manual Review Burden: Offloads repetitive review tasks from senior engineers, allowing them to focus on architectural decisions and mentoring.

- Enables Consistent Review Standards: AI-driven reviews apply uniform criteria across all MRs, minimizing subjective variation and improving team-wide code consistency.

- Integrates Seamlessly into CI/CD: Bedrock’s API-first design and serverless scalability make it easy to embed into GitLab pipelines, enabling automated reviews without disrupting existing workflows.

OfficeSpace software allows Delta employees to book desks and workspaces through an app and web-based portal.  OfficeSpace will sync integration with Office365 and the Delta Air Lines Active Directory to support the hybrid workspace environment. 

OfficeSpace is a multi-tenant environment hosted in Google’s Cloud Platform within the United States.
column25:
11/6/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA, VRA, contract

The desk reservation software solution currently integrated and in-use by employees at Delta, Poppulo’s Workplace, will have support phased out for that application and therefore a new software solution will be necessary moving forward. Poppulo will assist with migration and continued support through November 1, 2025. 

The OfficeSpace App will download directly from Google Play, Apple App Store, etc. but is technically a “web wrapper”— it appears as an app icon on the employee mobile device but redirects to a URL and does not contain native functionality. Therefore, MDM is not needed for this integration.
column40:
The desk reservation software solution currently integrated and in-use by employees at Delta, Poppulo’s Workplace, will have support phased out for that application and therefore a new software solution will be necessary moving forward. Poppulo will assist with migration and continued support through to replacement application.  

OfficeSpace is a new provider to Delta Air Lines and will extend its professional services through a desk and conference room reservation system – a software solution to be used by Delta employees to book collaborative workspaces, desks, and conference rooms. 

OfficeSpace will sync integration with Office365, and the Delta Air Lines Active Directory and all employee personnel data will be managed by CRE and the Delta IT organization.

column84: SaaS solution The platform will utilize a multi-tenant infrastructure/hosting model with O365 integration and Entra ID (formerly AzureAD) (OAuth2.0) SSO integration. For Role Administration: Delta will determine which users hold specific roles, and those users will continue to be mapped to these roles even if the provisioning is updated.
