Re: Note regarding not integrating with Global Authentication.
The content shared during the virtual open enrollment fairs is considered Internal, but HR has confirmed it is not sensitive or restricted in a way that would require breach reporting if viewed externally. While we don’t advertise it publicly, the information—primarily plan details—is widely shared with employees, spouses, and adult dependents, and is even made available to candidates during pre-hire stages.

Because of this broad audience, the sessions are handled in a semi-public manner, and Global Auth integration was not implemented as the user experience can’t be managed for Spouses and Adult Dependents that need this information. HR emphasized that ensuring access to this information is a priority, which is why authentication is not enforced.

column9:
Red Hat Ansible Lightspeed is Ansible Automation Platform's rich generative AI service that enhances user expertise and empowers automation teams to work smarter, make better decisions, and resolve operational issues faster. Boost IT and developer productivity, address skill gaps, and reduce onboarding friction while responding to the complex demands of IT and automation. 

Lightspeed essentially operates as 'code-assist' tool for Ansible developers.
column25:
Here are some additional notes from IBM that provide more context to Lightspeed and also compare it directly to Amazon Q:

Lightspeed is purpose-built for infrastructure automation teams using Ansible. It’s deeply integrated with Red Hat’s Ansible Automation Platform and offers:
•	Natural language to Ansible Playbook generation, including multi-task and role creation.
•	Content source matching and post-processing, ensuring generated code aligns with best practices.
•	Explainability features help users understand the logic behind generated tasks.
•	AI Transparency, Lightspeeds’ “training matches” tab links every suggestion to source code, license, and author.
•	Human-centered workflow, Lightspeed’s AI provides suggestions, human validates.
 
In contrast, Amazon Q CLI is a general-purpose developer tool focused on broader software development tasks. While it supports natural language command generation and code reviews across multiple languages (Java, Python, etc.), it’s not tailored for Ansible or infrastructure automation workflows. It’s more suited for CLI-heavy development environments, AWS-integrated pipelines, and doesn’t provide the same AI transparency or human-centered workflow capabilities as Lightspeed.
 
Lightspeed is designed to accelerate and enhance Ansible automation specifically, whereas Q CLI is a versatile tool for general development tasks. For Ansible environments, Lightspeed offers deeper functionality, better integration, and more relevant AI support.
column35:
https://www.redhat.com/en/technologies/management/ansible/ansible-lightspeed

It is 'free' in that it is provided as part of our current Ansible Automation Platform subscription.

column41: With the inclusion of Lightspeed, users will have to spend less time figuring out the ideal syntax/configuration for their Ansible scripts and can focus on other tasks. Developers can be focused on other day-to-day tasks if they are having to configure Ansible playbooks as often. This immediately generates value if developers are able to perform other work in the time gained by utilizing Lightspeed in Ansible.

column51:
Support model:
Teams involved:
•	Enterprise AI (Pattern owners)
•	CCoE
•	Foundations team (Service Catalog maintenance)
•	Consumer teams (Tenant account owners)
Model approach:
•	Self-service support – ZAP documentation with descriptions, detailed steps, FAQs etc. published by the pattern owners (AI team).
•	Deployment support - Issues related to the pattern’s deployment templates or bugs will be handled by the AI team, raised by the consumer teams via Teams channel.
•	AWS – Platform issues will be escalated by consumer teams to AWS support
•	Releases and Updates - Updates or new pattern versions will be published to the Service Catalog by the pattern owner team after validation in DEV and SI environments.
•	Monitoring and maintenance – The consumer teams are responsible for regular maintenance of the solutions deployed to their respective accounts. They can choose to set up any monitoring other than the basic out-of-the-box system-health CloudWatch dashboards that come with the patterns.
column53:
The introduction of the Generative AI Patterns will have a low operational impact but will enhance the organization’s AI delivery capability through standardization and automation.
1. Skills Impact
Minimal new skill requirements - Consumer teams only need basic familiarity with AWS Service Catalog and how to provide input parameters (no deep infrastructure expertise required).
Upskilling opportunity - Teams gain exposure to using AWS-native AI services like Amazon Bedrock, Lambda etc.
2. Tooling Impact - No new tools required. The patterns use existing AWS platform tools (Service Catalog, CloudFormation/CDK, CloudWatch)
3. Owners - Pattern owners - Enterprise AI team
Governance Consultation - CCoE
Service Catalog maintenance - Foundations team
Deployment and maintenance of solution - Individual consumer teams

DB Chatbot - To enable users to analyze and query their Enterprise data in natural language

column40:
As demand for Generative AI solutions grows across the organization, multiple teams are experimenting independently with similar AI use cases — such as text summarization and conversational interfaces.
This results in duplicated effort, inconsistent security configurations, and lack of standardization in the AI solutions.
To address this, the Generative AI Patterns portfolio intends to provide pre-approved, production-ready templates (published through AWS Service Catalog) that allow teams to quickly deploy standard AI capabilities in their own AWS accounts.
The DB Chatbot pattern is one such standard product that will allow users to query Enterprise data in natural language.

Cost efficiency: No licensing costs; reduces redundant engineering effort.
Governance: Confidence in long-term support from AWS compared to other third-party solutions.

Brand.ai is a domain-specific AI platform designed for brand builders, agencies, and Fortune 500 companies. It serves as an operating system that brings your brand to life, making it easier for teams and partners to deliver consistent and impactful brand experiences. Brand.ai synthesizes every aspect of your brand, from strategies and business plans to physical and digital touchpoints, creating a living source of truth for the entire organization
Our goal in Brand Strategy is to utilize Brand.Ai as a tool to guide and enhance our marketing and brand development, ensuring all materials are strategically aligned with our new brand guidelines, authentically connects with our target audiences, checks for brand consistency, surfaces potential cultural nuances, unifies with our new brand platform stance, and more. column9:
Aerobahn SMAN uses flight information that we send them via our existing FPES data feed.  This includes real-time gate information, On/off times, out/in times, etc.  There is no customer information sent to them.  In addition, SMAN receives aircraft location data from the aircraft transponders to place exact coordinates.  All of this information is displayed in both a map format and table formats for the user to make quick and efficient decisions in real time. Aerobahn tool is needed for direct surface surveillance of aircraft, to know and share with the ATC the arrival intent of inbound aircraft, and to have a tool in place that can communicate with the FAA's TFDM application (terminal Flight Data Manager). SMAN has all of the functionality that a tower operator would want for communicating with the FAA and other local SMAN users.  SMAN can be used to set business rules, charts and reporting, departure metering, deice management, etc.
It has local application authentication and authorization The user account is tied to the license. The user  and password can only be used in one session at any given time. That is the vendor solution to avoid/reduce the sharing of the account since license is per user. An installation of Aerobahn SMAN product at BOS, MSP for phase 1 and DTW and SLC for future phases. BOS will have 12 individual users and DTW will have 18 individual users.

column9: Measure Killer is a free external tool developed by Brunner BI for Power BI Desktop. It identifies and removes unused measures and columns from Power BI models, helping teams maintain clean, efficient, and high-performing reports. We have a huge footprint of PowerBI at Delta and many reports/ datasets have been created with low governance. We need to have this software used at Delta to do Tenant level analysis and work with report developers to fix their reports with best practices.
column25:
Business Benefits
1. Enhanced Performance and Efficiency
Reduces report size by eliminating unused elements, which improves load times and responsiveness.
Streamlines model complexity, making it easier for analysts and stakeholders to navigate and understand reports.

2. Time Savings for Analysts
Automates the detection of unused measures, saving hours of manual review.
Frees up time for analysts to focus on strategic insights rather than model maintenance.

3. Improved Governance and Quality
Promotes cleaner data models, reducing the risk of errors or confusion caused by outdated or unused calculations.
Supports better documentation and version control by keeping models lean and relevant.

4. Scalability for Large Organizations
Especially valuable for teams managing large or complex Power BI environments, where tracking measure usage manually becomes impractical.
Helps maintain performance standards across multiple reports and dashboards.

5. Low Cost, High ROI
$ 1248 per user license for enterprise version with cloud analysis
column40:
As Power BI adoption scales across Delta, semantic models become increasingly complex and harder to maintain. Over time, unused measures, columns, and inefficient DAX expressions accumulate, leading to:

Slower report performance
Increased refresh times
Difficulty in governance and auditing
Risk of breaking dependencies during cleanup

Traditional manual cleanup is time-consuming and error-prone. A specialized tool is needed to automate and streamline this process while ensuring model integrity.
column41:
Implementing Measure Killer delivers tangible business value:

Improved Performance: By removing unused elements and optimizing expressions, reports load faster and refresh more efficiently.
Enhanced Governance: Provides visibility into model usage, dependencies, and access permissions across the tenant.
Reduced Maintenance Overhead: Automates cleanup tasks that would otherwise require significant manual effort.
Better Collaboration: Clear documentation and lineage views help teams understand model structure and dependencies.
Scalability: Supports multi-model execution and tenant-wide analysis, making it suitable for enterprise-level deployments.
column42:
Model Optimization
Identify and delete unused columns and measures
Analyze DAX and M code across reports
Visualize dependencies with tree views

Documentation & Analysis
Export model documentation with expressions and usage stats
View report usage trends and performance metrics
Lineage views for semantic models and data sources

Tenant-Wide Insights
Scan all workspaces, users, and items
Audit access permissions and refresh history
Analyze semantic models, reports, and dataflows

Automation & Integration
Supports Power BI Desktop and Service
Portable and MSI versions for flexible deployment
Multi-model execution and scripting support

column9:
Teledyne Ground Based ACMS Tool software for Aircraft Condition Monitoring System (ACMS) encoding for Teledyne equipped B737Max aircraft.  

This software creates ACMS software for the aircraft, which then defines acquisition and data transmission standards for that aircraft. 

ACMS is a system within all of our aircraft that generates reports (snapshot and full flight) of aircraft sensor data, which help fuel Delta’s Predictive Maintenance, Flight Safety, etc. programs. ACMS software is DO-178C Level E aircraft software, which means that it is classified as user modifiable software and has no effect on the safety or operation of the aircraft. 

We have procured a desktop computer (Watlcamp10857) . This product request form is to have this software installed on the new Delta-IT support workstation.

ReliaSoft software analyzes product life, warranty, and degradation data with various lifetime distributions, plus design of experiments. Its intuitive interface is tailored for reliability engineering, making complex analyses straightforward. 
- Predicts future failures and detect outliers
- Ensure reliability within a specific time frame and confidence
- Perform degradation data analysis
column40: This software will help analyze the patterns of failure modes based on a statistical life distribution. We will apply this analysis to our most expensive assets (rotables components). It will help better inform us when is the right time to accomplish maintenance tasks.
column41: This software will help optimize our maintenance programs and develop mitigation strategies for underperforming aircraft systems which will enhance reliability and availability across the fleet. This improvement is critical to driving customer satisfaction, which in turn supports increased profitability.
column42:
ReliaSoft Weibull++ analyzes product life and degradation data with various lifetime distributions. Its intuitive interface is tailored for reliability engineering, making complex analyses straightforward.
ReliaSoft BlockSim allows you to easily model complex systems and processes using reliability block diagrams and fault tree analysis.
ReliaSoft RCM++ helps perform reliability-centered maintenance (RCM) analysis. It supports all major RCM standards and provides robust features for FMEAs and related analyses.

column9:
This request is to adopt AWS Quick Suite as a strategic tool to support enterprise architecture (EA) initiatives across the organization. AWS Quick Suite offers a set of generative AI-powered capabilities that enable natural language interaction with enterprise data, including diagrams, org charts, domain models, and architecture artifacts.
As a Portfolio Architect, I intend to use AWS Quick Suite to:

-Field architecture-related questions from stakeholders across the enterprise using conversational AI.
-Interact with complex EA artifacts (e.g., organizational charts, capability maps, solution diagrams) through natural language queries.
-Accelerate decision-making by enabling real-time access to architecture insights without manual navigation of documentation.
-Improve cross-domain visibility by surfacing relationships and dependencies across business, application, and technology domains.
-Support value stream alignment by enabling queries that connect enabler capabilities to strategic outcomes.

Value to the Organization:

-Enhanced productivity for architecture and strategy teams by reducing time spent searching, interpreting, and explaining EA artifacts.
-Improved stakeholder engagement through intuitive access to architecture knowledge, fostering better collaboration and understanding.
-Scalable knowledge delivery via AI-driven responses that democratize access to architecture insights across business units.
-Supports innovation and agility by enabling faster exploration of architectural options and impact analysis.

Security & Governance Considerations:
AWS Quick Suite operates within the AWS ecosystem, which aligns with existing enterprise cloud governance and security standards. Usage will be scoped to non-production environments initially, with access controls and data boundaries defined in collaboration with IT and security teams.
column25: 11/6/25: STR approved

column9: We need to evaluate a product called "Devin,the AI software engineer". Devin is a cloud-native AI engineer that spans the entire SDLC—planning, coding, testing, and opening pull requests.
column25: 10/27/25: Request cancelled as request 1796 was entered for a Pilot versus a POC
column40:
Devin is a cloud-native AI engineer designed to assist across the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)—including planning, coding, testing, and creating pull requests. 

The primary need for this product arises from:
1. Accelerating Development Speed: Acting as a junior developer, Devin helps teams deliver features and fixes faster.
2. Large-Scale Code Modernization: Automates refactoring and modernization of legacy code, reducing technical debt.
3. Improved Quality and Reliability: Handles routine bug fixes and testing, minimizing human error and improving code stability.
4. Resource Optimization: Frees up human developers to focus on complex, high-value tasks while repetitive work is managed by AI.
column41:
Implementing Devin as a cloud-native AI engineer delivers measurable benefits across productivity, cost efficiency, and quality:
1. Accelerated Development Cycles: By acting as a junior developer, Devin reduces time spent on routine coding, testing, and bug fixes, enabling faster feature delivery.
2. Cost Savings: Automating large-scale code modernization and refactoring minimizes manual effort, reducing dependency on additional contractor or developer hours.
3. Improved Quality: Continuous AI-driven testing and bug resolution enhance code reliability, lowering post-release defects and associated support costs.
4. Resource Optimization: developers can focus on high-value tasks such as architecture and innovation, improving overall team efficiency.

ROI Impact:
1. Lower operational costs by minimizing manual code maintenance and modernization efforts.
2. Potential savings from reduced defect-related incidents and support overhead.
column42:
1. Code migrations & refactors
2. Bug & issue triage
3. Testing
4. Code modernization

Molecule's datalake hosted on AWS
Molecule’s Big Bang will have data and the DL user will have the ability to:
•	Pull historical data (not just current data).

•	View historical data in time periods or time series (i.e. yesterday, last week, last month, day over day, week over week , month over month, year over year, etc.).

2. Large-Scale Code Modernization: Automates refactoring and modernization of legacy code, reducing technical debt.
3. Improved Quality and Reliability: Handles routine bug fixes and testing, minimizing human error and improving code stability.
4. Resource Optimization: Frees up human developers to focus on complex, high-value tasks while repetitive work is managed by AI.
column41:
Implementing Devin as a cloud-native AI engineer delivers measurable benefits across productivity, cost efficiency, and quality:
1. Accelerated Development Cycles: By acting as a junior developer, Devin reduces time spent on routine coding, testing, and bug fixes, enabling faster feature delivery.
2. Cost Savings: Automating large-scale code modernization and refactoring minimizes manual effort, reducing dependency on additional contractor or developer hours.
3. Improved Quality: Continuous AI-driven testing and bug resolution enhance code reliability, lowering post-release defects and associated support costs.
4. Resource Optimization: developers can focus on high-value tasks such as architecture and innovation, improving overall team efficiency.

ROI Impact:
1. Lower operational costs by minimizing manual code maintenance and modernization efforts.
2. Potential savings from reduced defect-related incidents and support overhead.

column1: IT for Ops MCP on AgentCore
column9: We are requesting AgentCore enablement in our account to enhance observability, automation, and incident response capabilities within our IT Operations. This will support our SRE initiatives by enabling deeper integration with Amazon Q, allowing for intelligent troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and reduced MTTR across our microservices architecture. The goal is to improve operational resilience, accelerate incident resolution, and provide application teams with actionable insights through AI-driven workflows.
column40:
AgentCore is essential to elevate our IT Operations by embedding intelligent automation and observability into our SRE workflows. It enables seamless integration with Amazon Q and other AI-driven tools, allowing us to:

Accelerate incident detection and resolution through real-time insights.
Perform root cause analysis across distributed systems without manual data ingestion.
Reduce Mean Time to Recovery (MTTR) by automating diagnostics and remediation.
Empower application teams with context-aware troubleshooting and guided workflows.
Enhance operational resilience and service reliability across environments.

This capability is critical for scaling our SRE practices and ensuring consistent, high-quality service delivery.
column41:
Enabling AgentCore will significantly enhance our IT Operations by introducing intelligent automation, observability, and AI-driven insights into our SRE workflows. This will:

Reduce Mean Time to Recovery (MTTR) by automating diagnostics and surfacing root causes faster.
Improve service reliability and uptime, directly impacting customer experience and satisfaction.
Empower engineering teams with contextual, real-time insights for faster decision-making and resolution.
Optimize operational efficiency by minimizing manual investigation and accelerating incident triage.
Support scalability of SRE practices across environments without increasing operational overhead.

By leveraging AgentCore, we align with our strategic goals of building resilient, self-healing systems and delivering consistent, high-quality digital services.
column42:
1. AI-Driven Incident Response
    Automates detection, triage, and resolution of incidents using intelligent workflows
    Reduces manual effort and accelerates recovery time.
2. Root Cause Analysis Without Data Ingestion
    Leverages metadata and system context to identify root causes without needing full data ingestion.
    Enables faster RCA across distributed systems.
3. Context-Aware Troubleshooting
    Provides developers and operators with actionable insights based on service context, dependencies, and recent changes.
    Improves accuracy and speed of issue resolution.
4. Integration with Amazon Q
    Enables natural language querying and guided diagnostics.
    Empowers teams to ask operational questions and receive precise, AI-generated answers.
5. Operational Resilience
    Supports self-healing mechanisms and proactive issue detection.
    Enhances system reliability and reduces downtime.
6. Scalable SRE Enablement
    Standardizes incident workflows across teams and environments.
    Facilitates consistent SRE practices without increasing operational overhead.
7. Improved Developer Experience
    Reduces cognitive load by surfacing relevant logs, metrics, and traces automatically.
    Allows developers to focus on fixing issues rather than finding them.
column43: In AWS
column45:
If AgentCore is not enabled, the following alternatives may be considered to support SRE capabilities in IT Operations:

1. Manual Incident Triage and RCA
    Continue relying on manual log analysis, metric correlation, and service dashboards.
    This approach is slower and less scalable, increasing MTTR and operational overhead.
2. Custom Automation Using OpenTelemetry + Amazon Q
    Build custom observability pipelines using OpenTelemetry for tracing and Amazon Q for querying.
    Requires significant engineering effort to maintain and integrate across services.
3. Third-Party Observability Platforms
    Use tools like Dynatrace, Sumologic for incident detection and RCA.
    These platforms may offer similar capabilities but often require data ingestion and come with licensing costs.
4. Enhanced CloudWatch + Lambda Automation
    Use AWS CloudWatch with Lambda functions to automate alerting and basic diagnostics.
    Limited in scope compared to AgentCore’s AI-driven workflows and contextual insights.
5. Internal Runbooks and Playbooks
    Develop and maintain detailed operational runbooks for incident response.
    Effective for known issues but lacks adaptability and intelligence for novel or complex failures.
column46: Delta staff time to build and deploy the product
column51:
1. Ownership & Governance
    Primary Owner: SRE Team
    Governance: Regular reviews by Architecture and Cloud Operations to ensure alignment with enterprise observability and automation standards.
2. Operational Support
    Monitoring: Continuous health checks and performance monitoring of AgentCore integrations.
    Incident Handling: Defined escalation paths for issues related to AgentCore workflows or integrations.
    Change Management: Updates to AgentCore configurations or workflows follow standard change control processes.
3. Integration Maintenance
    Amazon Q & MCP Integration: Ensure compatibility and version alignment with Amazon Q CLI and MCP services.
    Service Tagging & Metadata: Maintain consistent tagging and metadata across services to support context-aware diagnostics
4. Enablement & Training
    User Training: Provide training for application teams on using AgentCore-enabled workflows.
    Documentation: Maintain up-to-date runbooks, prompt libraries, and troubleshooting guides.
5. Security & Compliance
    Access Control: Role-based access to AgentCore features and data.
    Audit Logging: Ensure all actions and queries are logged for compliance and traceability.
6. Continuous Improvement
    Feedback Loop: Regular feedback collection from users to improve prompt quality and workflow relevance.
    Feature Updates: Evaluate and adopt new AgentCore capabilities as they become available.
column65: AgentCore enablement is recommended to enhance IT Operations and SRE capabilities by introducing AI-driven observability, automated incident response, and context-aware diagnostics. It addresses current challenges such as high MTTR, limited visibility across distributed systems, and inconsistent troubleshooting workflows. By integrating with Amazon Q, AgentCore empowers teams to resolve issues faster using natural language prompts and intelligent workflows, without requiring data ingestion. This improves service reliability, operational efficiency, and developer productivity while supporting scalable SRE practices across environments.
column85: Application would be deployed in SRE account in AWS and leverage Agentcore security guardrails.

column9:
Decagon is a customer service agentic AI platform for the enterprise. It uses GenAI powered agents to generate personalized responses, resolve complex issues, and take actions for customers.
 
Delta can leverage AI agents to elevate customer satisfaction (CSAT) and responsiveness to client inquiries across all communication channels. Decagon’s AI agents are designed to comprehend customer intent and context, enabling them to act on requests efficiently.

The pilot of this project was available on delta.com and has now expanded to the Fly Delta App.  Initial public facing traffic is to begin with 1% of US based SkyMiles users on version 7.5 of the Fly Delta app.

Checking status of PIA and VRA

Moving from Pilot to Production

Link to the approved SPAD:
https://git.delta.com/architecture/documentation/-/blob/master/DPEAIEDCGN_DOCS/DPEAIEDCGN_SPAD.md?ref_type=heads
column40: An agentic AI platform is needed to support the development and deployment of Delta Concierge use cases to both customers and employees in future. Delta Concierge was announced by Ed at CES keynote with certain elements to be rolled out starting this year.
column41:
​​Benefits include: 
​Enhanced CX for customers (CSAT, NPS) 
​Accelerate development of use cases for Delta Concierge 
​Capability to deploy Delta Concierge use cases at scale 
​Positive brand impact​
column42: ​​This platform provides the capability to build, deploy, and monitor GenAI agents and workflows for customer servicing at scale. It provides key foundational elements of an agentic AI platform that enables Delta to focus on building out use cases for Concierge.
column43: ​​Data related to users, upcoming trips, internal knowledge articles/policies, and travel requirements will be stored on Delta’s systems and transmitted to vendor platform for processing as needed upon user initiating session. The data will be encrypted during transit and will be stored on vendor systems for a limited duration as context during the active user session. Upon ending of the user session, the data will be deleted from vendor systems in compliance with ERIM requirements, currently 3 years.

column9: Fivetran is a fully managed, automated data movement platform that centralizes data from various sources like applications, databases, and events into a single destination, such as a data warehouse. Fivetran uses high performance, pre-built connectors to simplify and automate the complex process of data ingestion, making it faster for businesses to analyze data and build data-driven insights without the need for manual coding or maintenance.
column40: Fivetran is needed to streamline and automate the integration of data from multiple sources into a centralized analytics platform, enabling faster, more reliable decision-making across the organization. It eliminates the need for manual ETL processes by offering prebuilt connectors and automated schema handling, which reduces maintenance overhead and improves data accuracy. From a business perspective, Fivetran supports scalability, operational efficiency, and data trust, while aligning with modern cloud architectures, ensures secure and compliant data movement, and minimizes the burden on IT teams.
column41: Fivetran delivers business value by automating and accelerating the movement of data from diverse sources into a centralized analytics platform without waiting for manual ETL processes or custom integrations. By syncing data continuously and handling schema changes automatically, Fivetran ensures that business users get faster access to insights—supporting real-time decision-making, improving operational efficiency, and enhancing agility across departments. This speed and reliability in data delivery directly contribute to better strategic outcomes and a stronger competitive edge.
column42:
Prebuilt Data Connectors
Over 300 connectors for popular SaaS applications, databases, and cloud services (e.g., Salesforce, NetSuite, Google Ads, AWS, etc.).

Automated Data Syncing
Scheduled or continuous syncing of data from source systems to target destinations with minimal latency.

Schema Drift Handling
Automatically detects and adapts to changes in source schema (e.g., new columns, renamed fields) without breaking pipelines.

Managed Transformations (dbt Integration)
Supports in-warehouse data transformations using dbt, allowing for clean, modeled data ready for analysis.

Zero-Maintenance Architecture
Fully managed service—no infrastructure setup, no manual coding, and minimal ongoing maintenance.

Data Lineage & Monitoring
Provides visibility into data flow, sync status, and error tracking through a centralized dashboard.

Security & Compliance
Enterprise-grade security features including encryption, column blocking and hashing to protect sensitive data, role-based access control, and compliance with SOC 2, GDPR, HIPAA, and more.

Destination Flexibility
Supports modern data warehouses and lakes like Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Databricks, Azure Synapse, and others.

Real-time Synchronization
Utilizes Change Data Capture (CDC) technology for incremental, real-time data updates. 

Historical Data Sync
Ability to perform initial full loads and incremental updates, ensuring complete and current datasets.

Data Readiness for AI
Provides reliable access to centralized and governed data to power AI and machine learning initiatives. 

Custom Connector Support
For unique or proprietary data sources, Fivetran supports building custom connectors via an SDK.
column43:
All data storage, including raw, processed, and analytic datasets, remains within AWS regions selected by the customer. Data will not leave Delta environments and will be processed in AWS S3 bucket and databases,

Fivetran offers robust data residency and processing designed to meet global compliance and governance requirements. It allows customers to select their preferred data processing geography which helps organizations comply with regulations like GDPR, CCPA, and other data protection laws by ensuring that data is stored and processed within the appropriate jurisdiction.

Fivetran supports over 25 cloud regions across major providers (AWS, GCP, Azure), enabling businesses to deploy pipelines close to their data sources and destinations for better performance and compliance. Additionally, Fivetran offers customer-managed encryption keys, private networking options (e.g., AWS PrivateLink, Azure Private Link), and column-level data blocking and hashing to enhance data security and control.

Requesting access to AWS Transform service for the SOFRS application (Block Code: RACRVPSOFR, iServer ID: D0023336). We are migrating from legacy mainframe technologies (COBOL, Natural/Adabas) to modern platforms (Java, Python) on AWS. AWS Transform supports COBOL 
conversion natively, and we may also explore external plugins specifically for Adabas transformation. This service will help accelerate modernization and align with our cloud strategy
column25:
SOFRS supports DOT statistical reporting and processes flight data received from OSS via the TPF Connectivity for Large System feed. This data includes aircraft times, passenger counts, departure counts, and market statistics used by SOFRS and other Delta departments. AWS Transform will 
be used for COBOL conversion, and we may explore external plugins specifically for Adabas transformation. This request aligns with our cloud migration and modernization goals and supports the broader Revenue Accounting domain strategy.
column40:
The SOFRS application currently relies on obsolescent technologies such as Natural and Adabas, which pose significant IT risk due to limited support and difficulty sourcing skilled developers—many of whom 
are nearing retirement.  Additionally, the mainframe environment is costly to operate, with an annual expense of approximately $1.5M. There are also risks related to handling PII data in legacy systems 
that lack modern security controls. The upcoming Adabas license renewal in two years further underscores the urgency to modernize.
column41: Migrating to cloud platforms enhances security, especially for PII data, and aligns with enterprise cloud strategy. Overall, it enables faster innovation, better data accessibility, and long-term sustainability.
column42:
AWS Transform enables automated modernization of legacy applications like SOFRS by converting COBOL code and supporting Adabas (transformation through external plugins). It enhances development 
agility by reducing manual effort, improves data accessibility for reporting and analytics, and supports secure handling of PII data. The service also enables cloud deployment, which improves 
scalability, reliability, and integration with other AWS services. Overall, it supports faster delivery of business insights and ensures long-term sustainability of critical reporting systems
column43: Data will be stored and processed in AWS US regions (us-east-1) in compliance with Delta's data governance policies. During the migration process, legacy mainframe code will be transformed and stored in Gitlab(Enterprise/CCOE Tool)
column44:
Alternative mainframe modernization solutions include:
1. Micro Focus Enterprise Developer - COBOL development environment but requires significant manual effort
2. IBM z/OS Connect - API connectivity but doesn't modernize underlying code
3. Raincode COBOL Compiler - Code conversion but limited cloud integration
4. TmaxSoft OpenFrame - Mainframe rehosting but not true modernization
AWS Transform is preferred because it provides automated code conversion, native AWS integration, and reduces manual effort compared to these alternatives.
column45:
If denied, alternatives would be:
1. Continue operating legacy mainframe with increasing costs ($1.5M annually) and technical risks
2. Manual rewrite of COBOL applications - estimated 1-3 years and $2M+ investment
3. Hybrid approach maintaining mainframe while building new cloud applications - creates data silos and integration complexity
4. Third-party modernization services - higher costs and longer timelines
All alternatives result in higher costs, longer timelines, and increased technical debt compared to AWS Transform.

## Support Model Overview
Three-tier support model:
- Tier 1: Internal application support team (1-2 FTE) for daily operations and user support
- Tier 2: AWS Premium Support for infrastructure issues and platform guidance  
- Tier 3: Specialized consulting partner for complex application modifications, if needed
- 24/7 monitoring via AWS CloudWatch with automated alerting
- Monthly reviews with AWS Solutions Architect for optimization
column52: AWS Premium Support plus internal team support (1-2 FTE). Escalation path through AWS Technical Account Manager for critical issues.
column53: Positive impact: Modernizes legacy systems, reduces technical debt, improves development agility. Requires upskilling 1-2 team members on AWS services and modern development practices. Eliminates dependency on retiring mainframe expertise
column54: Eliminates around $1.5M annual mainframe operating costs, reduces support staff from 1-3 FTE to 1-2 FTE, eliminates hardware refresh cycles and Adabas license renewals. Decommissions legacy mainframe infrastructure.
column56: SaaS subscription model with pay-as-you-go pricing for AWS services. No perpetual licenses required.
column58: Primary risk: Migration complexity and data integrity. Mitigation: Phased migration approach, comprehensive testing, parallel run period. Secondary risk: Team skill gaps. Mitigation: AWS training program and consulting support during transition.
column61: Phase 1: AWS Transform assessment and planning (2 months). Phase 2: Pilot migration of non-critical modules (3 months). Phase 3: Full migration with parallel operations (6 months). Phase 4: Cutover and mainframe decommission (3 months).
column62: Post-migration: Monitor performance for 6 months, optimize costs, train support team, establish operational procedures. Full production operations with 1-2 FTE support team by month 15.
column63: Must comply with Delta's data governance policies. PII data handling requires encryption and access controls. Migration must maintain 99.9% uptime SLA during transition.

column65:
RECOMMENDATION: Approve AWS Transform for SOFRS mainframe modernization.

ANALYSIS:
- Current mainframe environment poses significant technical and financial risks ($1.5M annual costs, aging workforce, license renewal challenges)
- AWS Transform provides automated COBOL-to-Java conversion with native cloud integration
- Solution aligns with Delta's cloud-first strategy and modernization goals
- Strong business case: $1.07M annual savings, improved agility, reduced technical debt

TECHNICAL APPROACH:
- Phased migration minimizes operational risk
- AWS Lambda + RDS PostgreSQL architecture provides scalability and cost efficiency
- 6TB data migration is well within AWS Transform capabilities
- Maintains data integrity and security compliance requirements

RISK MITIGATION:
- Comprehensive testing and parallel operations during transition
- AWS Premium Support and consulting services for specialized expertise
- Team training program addresses skill gap concerns

RECOMMENDATION: Proceed with POC phase to validate approach and refine cost estimates.

column9:
Revising Architecture for this pattern to use AgentCore,. Amazon Bedrock AgentCore is an agentic platform to build, deploy, and operate highly capable agents securely at scale. AgentCore allows us to easily enable agents to take actions across tools and data, run agents securely with low-latency and extended runtimes, and monitor agents in production - all without any infrastructure management. 

The Enterprise AI and CCoE teams are collaborating to develop a suite of Generative AI Patterns on AWS to be consumed across other teams in Delta. These patterns will provide modular, reusable building blocks that can be integrated into their projects without deep AI/ ML expertise.​
The first three patterns that will be developed are as follows:​
Summarization Pattern - To enable users to receive concise summaries of their documents​
Database Chatbot Pattern – To enable users to analyze and query their data in natural language.​
Retrieval-Augmented-Generation Pattern – To enable users to ingest and index enterprise data, enabling LLMs to retrieve and ground responses in Delta-specific knowledge.​

AgentCore has been identified as the most viable option to host the Analytics agent of the Database Chatbot Pattern.
STR #1755 was already submitted and approved for the Database Chatbot Pattern (SCP). This new STR is to sunrise AWS Bedrock AgentCore and also update the architecture in previous STR, as AgentCore has been identified as the most viable option for this pattern.

column41:
AWS Bedrock AgentCore enables the organization to rapidly build, deploy, and scale intelligent AI agents without managing underlying infrastructure. Key business benefits include:
- Faster Development and Deployment - Provides a managed runtime and orchestration layer, allowing developers to focus on business logic and agent workflows instead of infrastructure setup or scaling.
- Operational Efficiency and Cost Control - Consumption-based pricing ensures we only pay for what we use.
- Improved Integration and Flexibility - Supports multiple AI models (including non-AWS ones) and integrates easily with existing AWS and enterprise systems.
column42:
- Agent Runtime & Orchestration
- Tool Integration Framework
- Memory Management - Provides short-term and long-term memory capabilities for agents.
- Observability and Monitoring - Offers detailed logging, tracing, and analytics of agent activities.
- Model Agnosticism - Supports any foundation model available on AWS Bedrock or through API integration
- Scalability and Reliability
- Extensibility and SDK Support
- Cross-Service Integration - Works seamlessly with other AWS services (e.g., S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, CloudWatch).

column54:
Using AWS Bedrock AgentCore can create reduction and retirement opportunities such as:
Reducing infrastructure management overhead by retiring custom agent-hosting environments or self-managed AI frameworks.
Lowering maintenance costs through AWS’s fully managed runtime, observability, and scaling features.
Retiring redundant tools (e.g., custom orchestration, monitoring, or identity systems) that AgentCore replaces.
Optimizing developer productivity, reducing time spent on infrastructure and allowing reallocation of resources to higher-value projects.

This makes AgentCore a strong fit for use cases where data sensitivity, traceability, and operational control are critical.

Recommended for approval for use with the Gen AI Pattern: Database Chatbot. This is an update to an already approved STR -- 1755 - Shared Infrastructure Component AI Account AWS (Gen AI Pattern - Database Chatbot). The plan is to utilize AgentCore for this particular Gen AI common pattern.

column9:
Proofpoint ITM (Insider Threat Management) and Endpoint DLP (Data Loss Prevention) work together to monitor, detect, and prevent risky or unauthorized data activity at the endpoint level, focusing on human behavior and insider threats.

Key Capabilities Endpoint DLP: 
- Data classification and policy enforcement: Identifies sensitive data (like PII, PHI, IP) and applies rules to control its movement.
- Real-time monitoring: Tracks data interactions such as copying to USB drives, cloud uploads, printing, or emailing.
- Granular controls: Allows blocking, alerting, or logging based on policy violations.

Key Capabilities ITM: 
- User activity monitoring: Captures detailed context around user actions—file access, application usage, network activity, etc.
- Behavioral analytics: Identifies anomalies or patterns that suggest insider risk.
- Flexible deployment: Supports full ITM, DLP-only, or mixed-mode configurations depending on user risk level.
- Investigation tools: Provides forensic-level visibility to understand the “who, what, when, and how” of incidents.

Proofpoint ITM/Endpoint DLP is an agent that can be deployed to a workstation. Agents are only deployed at the request of HR or management.

Notes:  Production implementation will deploy the agent in monitor mode to all Delta workstations, but with limited 20 licenses.  Funding potentially coming in 2026 for an increase in  licenses.  Potential replacement of another security tool.
column40:
Proofpoint’s Endpoint DLP/ITM solution is designed to address the rising threat of insider incidents, which have become more prevalent due to hybrid work environments, accelerated cloud adoption, and workforce turnover. The platform provides comprehensive visibility into user behavior, enabling security teams to detect, investigate, and respond to risky actions with speed and precision. It captures detailed telemetry across endpoints, email, and cloud channels, presenting user activity in intuitive timelines and dashboards that highlight the “who, what, when, and where” of potential threats.

Key business drivers include the need to protect intellectual property, ensure regulatory compliance, and minimize operational risk. Proofpoint’s approach integrates privacy-by-design controls, allowing organizations to balance security with employee trust by masking identities and limiting data access on a need-to-know basis. The solution also supports dynamic prevention, escalating controls based on user risk profiles and offering real-time coaching to reduce accidental data loss.

Deployment is streamlined through a lightweight endpoint agent that avoids system conflicts and reduces help desk burden. With features like Nexus AI data classifiers, data lineage tracking, and automated exports to SIEM/SOAR tools, Proofpoint empowers organizations to modernize their DLP programs and respond effectively to insider threats. Ultimately, it helps businesses reduce security risk, accelerate investigations, and protect sensitive data across multiple channels
column41: Proofpoint Endpoint DLP and Insider Threat Management (ITM) offer significant financial benefits by helping organizations reduce the costs associated with data breaches, regulatory fines, and inefficient security operations. By proactively identifying and mitigating insider threats—whether accidental, negligent, or malicious—Proofpoint minimizes the risk of intellectual property loss and business disruption, which can result in millions of dollars in damages. Its advanced behavioral analytics and real-time visibility into user activity accelerate investigations and reduce the time and resources needed to respond to incidents. This efficiency translates into lower operational costs for security teams and fewer false positives that typically drain productivity. Additionally, Proofpoint’s privacy-by-design approach helps avoid legal liabilities and reputational damage by ensuring ethical monitoring and compliance with data protection regulations. The lightweight endpoint agent also reduces help desk burden and system conflicts, further lowering IT support costs. Altogether, Proofpoint empowers businesses to protect sensitive data, maintain compliance, and operate more efficiently—delivering measurable cost savings while strengthening their overall security posture.
column42:
- Comprehensive User Activity Visibility: Proofpoint captures detailed telemetry across endpoints, email, cloud apps, and browsers. This enables security teams to understand the full context of user actions—who did what, when, where, and how—making investigations faster and more accurate. 

- Real-Time Risk Detection and Response: The platform uses behavioral analytics to detect risky or anomalous activity in real time. It can automatically trigger alerts, block actions, or escalate controls based on user risk profiles, helping prevent data exfiltration before it happens.

- Privacy-by-Design Monitoring: Proofpoint supports ethical and compliant monitoring with features like identity masking and role-based access controls. This ensures that investigations respect employee privacy while still providing actionable insights.

- Dynamic Data Loss Prevention (DLP): The solution includes advanced data classification (e.g., Nexus AI classifiers), policy enforcement, and real-time coaching to prevent accidental or intentional data leaks. It adapts to user behavior and business context to minimize false positives. 

- Streamlined Investigations and Forensics: Intuitive dashboards and timeline views allow analysts to reconstruct incidents quickly. This reduces investigation time and helps teams respond to threats more efficiently.

- Seamless Integration with Security Ecosystems: Proofpoint integrates with SIEM, SOAR, and other security tools, enabling automated workflows and centralized incident management. This improves operational efficiency and reduces manual effort. 

- Scalable Deployment Across Hybrid Workforces: With lightweight endpoint agents and cloud-native architecture, Proofpoint can be deployed rapidly across distributed environments without impacting system performance or user experience. 

- Regulatory Compliance Support: The platform provides audit trails, policy enforcement, and reporting features that help organizations meet data protection regulations like GDPR, HIPAA, and CCPA.
column43: Data is processed and stored in Proofpoint’s secure cloud infrastructure.
column44: Comparable solutions to Proofpoint Endpoint DLP and Insider Threat Management include Cyberhaven, Teramind, Varonis, Forcepoint, and Microsoft Purview.
column45:
Cyberhaven -	Data-aware insider threat detection, DLP, incident response. Strong data lineage tracking and contextual alerts

Teramind - User behavior analytics, activity recording, policy enforcement.	Granular monitoring and real-time alerts

Varonis -	Data security platform, threat detection, access control. Deep file system visibility and automated risk scoring

Forcepoint - DLP, behavioral analytics, cloud security.	Integrated risk-adaptive protection across endpoints and cloud

Microsoft Purview - Unified data governance, compliance, DLP. 	Seamless integration with Microsoft 365 ecosystem

BetterCloud -	SaaS operations and data protection. Focused on SaaS app security and insider risk

column9: Network Security Guidance AI Agent is an AI-powered virtual assistant that accelerates network security incident diagnosis and troubleshooting. The agent provides intelligent analysis across firewalls and SIEM, and connectivity domains with clear next steps and evidence, reducing incident response time from hours to minutes.
column25: Network Security Guidance AI Agent is an AI-powered virtual assistant that will help the network security team accelerates network security incident diagnosis.  You can ask assistant in plain English questions like "why can't users reach the app?" and get intelligent analysis across firewall, SIEM, connectivity with clear next steps and evidence.  Built using AgentCore Runtime with specialized domain agents, AgentCore Gateway (MCP) for secure tool integration, and optional MCP servers for heavy integrations.

column9: The Fees and Entitlement Engine calculates the change fee and cancel fee for orders created using continuously priced offers and Award PNRs. The industry uses ATPCO farebasis code to file the change and cancel fee traditionally. As we move to continuously priced offers, the fare basis code will be generated dynamically and cat 31 / 33 files will not have the respective change and cancel fees. To address this and position the change and cancel fee on market/enhanced brand attributes, the fees and entitlement engine using FareLogix is getting built.

column40: The Fees and Entitlement Engine calculates the change fee, cancel fee for orders created using Continuously Priced offers and revenue award PNRs. The industry uses ATPCO farebasis code to file the change and cancel fee traditionally. As we move to Continuously priced offers and revenue award PNRs, the fare basis code will be generated dynamically and cat 31 / 33 files will not have the respective change and cancel fees. To address this and position the change and cancel fee on market/enhanced brand attributes, the fees and entitlement engine using FareLogix is getting built.
column41:
The industry is moving away from filled fares, that is fares that are provided by ATPCO. The capability to price offers 
from a non ATPCO source has always existed, however the ability to operationalize and account for these non-filled 
products has blocked progress. The challenge Delta now faces is to how to service these fares where the traditional evaluation of change and cancel fees is no longer available to them.  This solution/product targets the accurate sourcing of fees (namely change & cancel/Cat 31 & 33) in ALL award & continuously priced landscapes.
column42:
Increase confidence in servicing non-ATPCO fare products
Support continuous pricing expansion for change & cancel flows

column9:
Requesting Access to AWS Bedrock Service for the SOFRS Application as soon as possible. The Natural/Adabas license cost is huge and is expiring in 2027 and migration needs to be completed as soon as possible in 2026. The limitations of Amazon Q and AWS Transform are as below.

Limitation of Amazon Q- The Amazon Q is good for the development. However, the Q is not providing us the full context of the scope because of its limitation to work on the complete source code which is 3.5 million lines of code. It is limiting us to understand the full functionality that meets our Revenue Accounting Business Users and also meet US DOT regulation requirements.

Limitations with AWS Transform:
Only ~20% of our codebase is COBOL.
The majority is written in Adabas Natural, which AWS Transform does not currently support.

Licensing Costs - Without Modernization, we will be paying about 6+ million licensing costs for Adabas/Natural. 

Block Code: RACRVPSOFR
iServer ID: D0023336

We are currently migrating the SOFRS application from legacy mainframe technologies (COBOL, Natural/Adabas) to modern platforms such as Java and Python on AWS. As part of this modernization effort, we would like to utilize generative AI capabilities to enhance automation, code analysis, and documentation processes.

Source Code Volume:
SOFRS (Adabas Natural): ~700,000 lines of code
BARTS (Adabas Natural + COBOL): ~3.5 million lines of code
column25:
AWS Bedrock provides access to foundational models from leading providers, enabling us to integrate generative AI into our development workflows without managing infrastructure. This aligns with our cloud-first strategy and supports innovation in areas such as:

Automated code refactoring and documentation
Natural language interfaces for legacy system analysis
Intelligent data mapping and transformation
Potential integration with external plugins for Adabas transformation

Access to AWS Bedrock will accelerate our modernization goals and improve developer productivity while maintaining compliance and scalability within our AWS environment.

Business-Driven Modernization:
Our goal is to develop end-to-end business flows with clearly defined use cases that can be reviewed and accepted by business stakeholders.
We also plan to deprecate legacy functions that are no longer relevant or valuable to the business, streamlining the modernization effort.
column40:
As part of our strategic initiative to modernize the SOFRS application (Block Code: RACRVPSOFR, iServer ID: D0023336), we are transitioning from legacy mainframe technologies (COBOL, Natural/Adabas) to modern cloud-native platforms (Java, Python) on AWS. This transformation is critical to reduce technical debt, improve agility, and align with enterprise cloud adoption goals.
Business Drivers:
Accelerated Modernization: Generative AI can significantly reduce manual effort in code analysis, documentation, and refactoring, speeding up the migration timeline.
Innovation Enablement: Bedrock allows us to explore AI-driven solutions for legacy system understanding, intelligent data mapping, and user-friendly interfaces.
Cost Optimization: Automating repetitive tasks and improving developer productivity contributes to long-term cost savings.
Strategic Alignment: Supports enterprise-wide cloud-first and AI adoption strategies.

Technical Reasons:
Foundation Model Access: Bedrock provides secure access to leading generative AI models without managing infrastructure.
Legacy Code Understanding: AI-powered tools can assist in interpreting and transforming Natural/Adabas code, complementing AWS Transform’s COBOL capabilities.
Plugin Integration: Potential to integrate external plugins for Adabas transformation using Bedrock’s flexible architecture.
Scalable AI Workflows: Enables experimentation with AI workflows in a secure, scalable, and compliant AWS environment.

This request is essential to support our modernization roadmap and leverage AI capabilities to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and innovation.
column41:
The adoption of AWS Bedrock for the SOFRS application supports our enterprise-wide modernization and AI strategy, delivering measurable business value across several dimensions:
Return on Investment (ROI) and Cost Savings

Accelerated Migration: Generative AI can reduce manual effort in analyzing and converting legacy code (Natural/Adabas), potentially cutting modernization timelines by 30–40%, which translates to faster time-to-value.
Developer Productivity: Automating documentation, code refactoring, and legacy system understanding can save hundreds of developer hours, reducing labor costs and freeing up resources for strategic initiatives.
Reduced Technical Debt: By enabling faster and more accurate transformation of legacy systems, Bedrock helps eliminate costly dependencies on aging mainframe infrastructure.
Estimated Cost Savings: Based on similar modernization efforts, we anticipate savings of $1000/month from reduced mainframe usage (e.g., Refund Receipt GP3 conversion), with additional long-term savings from decommissioning legacy systems and optimizing cloud operations.

Strategic Business Drivers
Cloud-First Alignment: Supports the enterprise goal of migrating critical workloads to AWS, improving scalability, reliability, and security.
AI-Driven Innovation: Enables exploration of generative AI use cases such as intelligent data mapping, natural language interfaces for legacy systems, and automated test generation.
Compliance and Governance: Bedrock’s managed infrastructure ensures secure and compliant access to foundational models, aligning with internal IT and AppSec policies.
column42:
AI-Assisted Legacy Code Analysis:
Enables natural language understanding of COBOL and Natural/Adabas code structures.
Supports automated documentation and code summarization for faster onboarding and knowledge transfer.

Accelerated Code Transformation:
Complements AWS Transform by providing generative AI capabilities to assist in refactoring and converting legacy code to modern languages (Java, Python).
Potential to integrate with external plugins for Adabas transformation.

Intelligent Data Mapping:
Uses foundational models to infer relationships between legacy data structures and modern schemas.
Reduces manual effort in designing ETL pipelines and data migration strategies.

Natural Language Interfaces:
Enables conversational interfaces for querying legacy systems, improving accessibility for business users and analysts.
Facilitates intuitive exploration of historical data and business logic.

Automated Test Case Generation:
Generates unit and integration test cases based on legacy code logic and business rules.
Improves test coverage and reduces QA cycle time.

Enhanced Developer Productivity:
Provides AI-powered coding assistance, reducing time spent on repetitive tasks.
Supports faster prototyping and experimentation with modernization approaches.

Scalable AI Workflows:
Offers secure, scalable access to multiple foundational models without infrastructure overhead.
Enables experimentation across multiple use cases (e.g., documentation, code generation, chatbot interfaces) within a compliant AWS environment.
column43: AWS Bedrock is a fully managed service that operates within the AWS cloud infrastructure. For the SOFRS application, data will be stored and processed in the AWS US-East (N. Virginia) region, which aligns with our existing AWS deployment footprint and complies with internal data residency policies.

However the above services are not approved at our DELTA
column45:
1. Manual Modernization Approach

Description: Continue using manual code analysis, documentation, and refactoring for Natural/Adabas components.
Impact: Significantly increases development time and resource requirements; higher risk of errors and knowledge gaps due to limited tooling support.

2. Use of AWS Transform Only
Description: Rely solely on AWS Transform for COBOL conversion and explore custom-built tools or scripts for Adabas transformation.
Impact: Limits automation and AI-assisted capabilities; may require additional investment in third-party tools or internal development.

3. External Generative AI Platforms
Options: Azure OpenAI, Google Vertex AI, or standalone Anthropic Claude.
Impact: Requires integration effort and may introduce data residency or compliance challenges depending on platform maturity and enterprise approval status.

4. Open-Source AI Tools
Description: Use open-source models (e.g., Hugging Face) hosted on EC2 or SageMaker for code analysis and transformation.
Impact: Requires infrastructure management, model tuning, and security hardening; less scalable and harder to govern compared to Bedrock.
column46:
While AWS Bedrock does not require upfront licensing or infrastructure costs, initial usage-based charges for model evaluation, customization, and workflow setup should be anticipated. These costs are manageable and scalable, aligning with Delta’s existing AWS cost structure and cloud-first strategy.

AWS Bedrock 6-Month Cost Forecast
Assumptions:

Monthly Input Tokens: 2,000,000
Monthly Output Tokens: 500,000
Monthly Bedrock Flow Node Transitions: 100,000
No fine-tuning or custom model training included

Monthly Cost Breakdown:

Input Token Cost: $1.60
Output Token Cost: $1.20
Bedrock Flow Cost: $3.50
Total Monthly Cost: $6.30

Total Forecast for 6 Months: $37.80

column58:
Risk Categories

Security: Unauthorized access, data leakage
Performance: Latency or model unavailability
Compliance: Misuse of sensitive data or lack of auditability
Vendor Lock-in: Limited flexibility if foundational models change or are deprecated

Mediation Plan

Security Controls: Use AWS Secrets Manager, IAM, and SCPs to restrict access.
Monitoring: Enable CloudWatch alerts and CloudTrail logging for all Bedrock activities.
Fallback Strategy: Maintain alternate workflows or model providers (e.g., Azure OpenAI) for critical tasks.
Governance: Regular reviews of usage, cost, and compliance posture with Delta IT and Cloud Governance teams.
column61:
Target Application: SOFRS (Block Code: RACRVPSOFR)
Phase 1 Goals:

Evaluate Bedrock models (e.g., Claude, Titan) for legacy code analysis and documentation.
Build initial Bedrock Flow to automate COBOL/Natural code summarization and transformation.
Integrate with existing AWS services (S3, Lambda, CloudWatch) for logging and orchestration.


Timeline: 4–6 weeks for pilot setup and validation
Team: Cloud Engineering, Application Modernization, and Architecture
column62:
Mainstream Adoption Plan

Expansion Scope:

Extend Bedrock usage to other Revenue Accounting applications (e.g., BARTS, Refund Receipt)
Enable generative AI workflows for test case generation, data mapping, and user-facing interfaces


Governance:

Usage reviews and cost monitoring via Cloud Governance team
Security and compliance oversight via AppSec and IAM policies


Training:

Enablement sessions for developers and architects on prompt engineering and Bedrock Flow design
column63:
Restrictions

Use Case Constraints:

Only approved for modernization-related tasks (e.g., code transformation, documentation, testing)
Not to be used for customer-facing or PII-sensitive workloads without additional review


Org Constraints:

Must align with Delta’s cloud-first strategy and AWS governance policies
Usage must be tracked and reviewed quarterly for compliance and cost control
column65:
Architect Analysis & Recommendations
Architecture Fit

AWS Bedrock aligns well with Delta’s cloud-first strategy and existing AWS infrastructure.
It integrates natively with services like S3, Lambda, CloudWatch, and IAM, minimizing architectural overhead.
Bedrock’s serverless model supports scalable, low-maintenance AI workflows, ideal for modernization efforts like SOFRS.

Security & Compliance

Bedrock supports enterprise-grade security controls, including encryption, IAM-based access, and audit logging via CloudTrail.
Data used for inference is not stored or used for model training, ensuring privacy and compliance with internal and external regulations.

Scalability & Flexibility

Bedrock provides access to multiple foundational models (e.g., Claude, Titan, Llama) via a unified API, allowing flexibility in model selection and experimentation.
Supports Bedrock Flows for orchestrating multi-step AI tasks, enabling modular and reusable workflow design.

Cost Efficiency

Usage-based pricing ensures cost control and predictability.
Initial forecast for SOFRS is $6.30/month, with potential for scale-up based on adoption.
No upfront licensing or infrastructure costs; low total cost of ownership.

Skills & Enablement

Requires basic enablement in prompt engineering and generative AI concepts.
Can be supported by existing cloud and modernization teams with minimal upskilling.
Training materials and documentation are readily available via AWS.

Recommendations
Proceed with Initial Adoption for SOFRS, focusing on code analysis, documentation, and transformation.
Monitor Usage and ROI during pilot phase to validate cost-effectiveness and business value.
Plan for Mainstream Adoption across other Revenue Accounting applications post-pilot.
Establish Governance for prompt templates, model usage, and cost tracking.
Integrate with Existing Repositories (GitHub Enterprise, Nexus) for workflow and code management.

column9: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore is an agentic platform to build, deploy, and operate highly capable mcp servers and agents securely at scale. With AgentCore you can easily enable agents to take actions across tools and data, run agents securely with low-latency and extended runtimes, and monitor agents in production - all without any infrastructure management. AgentCore is comprised of fully-managed services that can be used together or independently and work with any framework (including LangGraph and Strands Agents), as well as any foundation model - eliminating the choice between open-source flexibility and enterprise-grade security and reliability.

column9:
The GitLab Model Context Protocol (MCP) server provides read-only access to GitLab resources, enabling users to efficiently retrieve and analyze their development workflow data. Key capabilities include:
 
Merge Request Insights: View open merge requests, review status, approvals, and blocking issues
Commit Analysis: Access recent commit history, changes, and associated pipeline results
Pipeline Diagnostics: Investigate failed CI/CD pipelines, job logs, and error details
Issue Tracking: Monitor assigned issues, progress updates, and related discussions
 
Security Model: The MCP server operates with read-only permissions through a personal access token (PAT)
column25:
11/6/25: STR approved
Pending item: PIA

No modification capabilities - cannot create, update, or delete any GitLab resources
Access limited to user's existing permissions within GitLab
Secure token-based authentication without elevated privileges
Complete audit trail of all read operations
This approach provides powerful development insights while maintaining strict security boundaries, allowing developers to quickly understand project status, troubleshoot issues, and make informed decisions without any risk of unintended changes to their GitLab environment
column40:
Developers spend significant time manually navigating GitLab UI to check merge request status, pipeline failures, and commit history
Troubleshooting failed pipelines requires multiple clicks and context switching between different GitLab pages
No centralized way to quickly assess project health, open MRs, and blocking issues
Time-consuming manual process to gather development workflow insights
column41:
Leverages existing GitLab SaaS investment with zero additional licensing costs

Integrates seamlessly with current development workflows
Enables data-driven development process improvements

column1: Build an AI Assistant to analyze IROP affected PNRs and resolve ticketing issues
column9:
Requesting access to Amazon Bedrock and Amazon OpenSearch services to build a RAG based AI Assistant to analyze and process PNR issues related to IROP and ticketing. The AI assistant would also take actions integrating with Delta APIs.

Technology Stack for the POC: Python, MCP
AWS Services: Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.5 foundation models running on Amazon Bedrock, Amazon OpenSearch Service(Serverless).
Development & Hosting Environment: Delta DevSpaces
Integrations: Delta APIs in SI environment using MCP, API authentication using Delta Central Authorizer.
column40:
About the POC:  In the airline domain, IROP scenarios—such as schedule disruptions due to weather, operational constraints, or equipment issues—require timely and accurate updates to passenger itineraries. While the current automated system serves as the primary automation engine for revalidating or reissuing tickets, its certain limitations necessitate a fallback mechanism. This POC aims to build an AI Assistant that can intelligently analyze the ticketing reissue failures and suggest steps to resolve reissue failure to users. Based on instructions from the user the AI assistant would take actions to rectify each issue identified in the PNR and finally reissuing the ticket to the passenger.

The POC would be using AWS services to build the AI Assistant solution.
 - Amazon Bedrock foundation models, used for PNR analysis, formulating queries reflecting current PNR issues, query knowledge base for procedures and guidelines to resolve ticketing(reissue/reval) errors. 
 - Amazon OpenSearch would be used to build the knowledge base.
 - Streamlit is a Python based library used to easily create Web UI for applications. Link: https://streamlit.io/.
 - MCP - Delta approved framework for tools integration
column41:
Improves customer experience and brand loyalty. 
Reduce manual effort by Delta RES agents.
column42:
On demand, serverless, fully managed services.
Would use Bedrock, Sonnet 4.5 foundation model, Bedrock Guardrails and Knowledge base.
column43: The application uses PNR data. Data is processed in the AWS US-East (N. Virginia) region.

column9:
StopOnFirstBuildError is Visual Studio Pro extensions, that halts solution build process immediately if any project within the solution fails to build. This feature is particularly useful in large solutions with multiple projects, as it saves time by not continuing to build other projects once an error is encountered. 

https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=EinarEgilsson.StopOnFirstBuildError

Similar functionality exists in VSColorOutput64

https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=MikeWard-AnnArbor.VSColorOutput64

Zoxide is a blazing-fast, smart command-line tool that replaces cd for navigating your filesystem. It learns your directory usage patterns and lets you jump to frequently or recently visited folders using just a few keystrokes. With fuzzy matching, shell integration
column40: Traditional directory navigation using cd can be slow and inefficient, especially for users who frequently switch between deeply nested or numerous project folders. Zoxide solves this by offering a smarter, faster alternative that:
column41:
Effective in navigation that can have great impacts to all of IT's work flows when in the terminal.
Use Cases for Zoxide
1.	Fast Directory Navigation
	Jump to frequently or recently used directories with minimal typing.
	Example: z projects might take you to /home/user/work/projects even if you're deep in another directory.
2.	Fuzzy Matching
	Navigate using partial or fuzzy matches of directory names.
	Great for when you don’t remember the full path.
3.	Shell Integration
	Works with Bash, Zsh, Fish, PowerShell, and Nushell.
	Seamlessly integrates into your existing shell workflow.
4.	Directory Ranking
	Zoxide tracks how often and how recently you visit directories.
	It prioritizes your most-used paths, making navigation smarter over time.
5.	Interactive Mode
	Use zi (if configured) to interactively select a directory from a list.
	Helpful when multiple matches exist.
6.	Scripting and Automation
	Can be used in scripts to jump to known directories without hardcoding paths.
	Useful for DevOps workflows or CI/CD pipelines.
7.	Cross-Platform Use
	Works on Linux, macOS, and Windows.
	Ideal for users who work across different environments.
column42:
Zoxide is a command line tool / binary that allow you to seamlessly change directories with low effort.
Learns your habits: It tracks and ranks directories based on usage, allowing quick access to frequently visited locations.
Supports fuzzy matching: You don’t need to remember exact paths—just part of the name is enough.
Improves productivity: Reduces time spent typing long paths or searching for directories.
Integrates with multiple shells: Works seamlessly with Bash, Zsh, Fish, PowerShell, and more.
Cross-platform compatibility: Useful across Linux, macOS, and Windows environments.

column9: ScaleOps is an intelligent Kubernetes resource optimization platform that automatically rightsizes workloads and manages cluster scaling to reduce cloud costs while maintaining application performance. The platform uses machine learning algorithms to analyze real-time resource usage patterns, predict future demand, and continuously adjust CPU and memory requests, limits, and replica counts without manual intervention. ScaleOps integrates seamlessly with existing Kubernetes environments, providing automated vertical and horizontal pod autoscaling, intelligent node scaling, and comprehensive cost visibility dashboards. By eliminating the guesswork in resource allocation, ScaleOps typically reduces infrastructure costs by 30-60% while preventing performance issues caused by under-provisioning, making it an essential tool for organizations looking to optimize their Kubernetes operations at scale.
column40:
Delta’s Kubernetes environments (ROSA/OpenShift) protect performance via over-provisioned CPU/memory requests and inflated replica minimums, creating persistent infrastructure waste and operational toil.
ScaleOps provides real‑time, performance‑first automation that aligns container requests and replica counts to actual demand, enabling safe node consolidation and lower EC2/ROSA/Dynatrace licensing without developer intervention.
Existing internal approaches (manual tuning, static policies) cannot react fast enough to traffic volatility (e.g., promos/IROPs), nor do they scale across multi-tenant nexGen clusters.
column41:
Business drivers:
●	- Reduce AWS EC2 and ROSA subscription spend across ROSA clusters.
●	- Avoid incremental capacity purchases (“cost avoidance”) by densifying existing nodes.
●	- Lower Dynatrace host-based licensing by reducing node count.
●	- Free platform/app teams from manual right‑sizing to focus on higher‑value work.
Technical reasons:
●	- Dynamic pod rightsizing at creation time (no manifest changes) improves bin‑packing and triggers autoscaler scale‑downs.
●	- Predictive replica optimization removes HPA latency pressure, safely lowering min replicas off‑peak.
●	- Java‑aware policies respect Xmx/Xms and heap usage; burst reaction + auto‑healing protect SLOs during spikes.
column42:
Real-time container CPU/memory rightsizing (per pod at creation via admission webhook; no GitOps conflicts).
●	predictive, policy-driven HPA/KEDA replica optimization (scale-out ahead of demand; safe scale-in off-peak).
●	Context-aware pod placement/bin-packing to increase node density.
●	Alignment with native Cluster Autoscaler/Karpenter to realize node scale-downs.
●	Performance safeguards: burst reaction, auto-healing on OOM/CPU stress/liveness failures.
●	Workload-level cost attribution and reporting to support FinOps.
column43:
Primary mode (recommended for STR): **Self-hosted**. All telemetry, models, and dashboards run **in-cluster** within Delta’s ROSA/OpenShift environments; data remains in Delta’s VPC/regions.
Billing metadata: minimal metrics (e.g., aggregated vCPU counts) may be shared for license usage reporting.
Optional convenience: A cloud-hosted UI is available; if used, only limited metadata is transmitted over TLS 1.2+ to a ScaleOps endpoint. For STR, Delta will operate **self-hosted UI** to keep data fully in-cluster.
column44:
Native / Open Source:
●	Kubernetes HPA/KEDA (horizontal only, reactive), Vertical Pod Autoscaler (VPA) / OpenShift VPA (restarts required; conflicts with HPA), Goldilocks (advisory).
Commercial:
●	Perfectscale (vertical right-sizing), Kubecost (cost observability with advisory rightsizing).
Note: Alternatives generally lack simultaneous vertical + predictive horizontal automation without HPA conflict and/or GitOps conflict, or require restarts/manifest edits that impede broad automation.
column45:
●	Status quo: Continue manual right-sizing and inflated min replicas → persistent over-provisioning (higher EC2/ROSA/Dynatrace spend).
●	Build in-house optimization: High engineering effort to reach parity (admission control, models, HPA decoupling, Java heuristics, safety reactions) and ongoing maintenance. Multi-year engineering effort with significant opportunity cost.
●	Rely solely on Karpenter/Cluster Autoscaler: Helps with provisioning, but does not solve inaccurate requests/min replicas driving waste.
