column58:
●	**Performance-first policies** with headroom, burst reaction, and auto-healing enabled by default.
●	**Scoped rollout**: start non-prod → selected prod namespaces → full cluster; can exclude namespaces.
●	**Kill switch**: toggle off automation to instantly revert to developer-defined requests; no manifest drift.
●	**Change governance**: Document “no manifest edits; in-pod creation only” to align with after-10pm policy while allowing safe real-time reactions.
●	**Observability**: dashboards and alerts for scaling actions, disruptions, and autoscaler events.
column61:
Phase 0 – Prep: STR approval, security review, RBAC/NetworkPolicy, choose self-hosted UI.
Phase 1 – Non-Prod Validation: Install in next-gen staging clusters; enable rightsizing + replica optimization for low-risk namespaces; confirm SLOs.
column62:
Phase 2 – Production Pilot: Pax ODR 1S/2S representative namespaces; measure node-hour reduction, SLO adherence, deployment latency unchanged.
Phase 3 – Scale-Out: Extend to additional next-gen clusters; adjust autoscaler policies for consolidation as needed.
Success Criteria:
●	≥30% worker node-hour reduction with zero SLO violations.
●	Replica min reductions off-peak with no HPA latency incidents.
●	Documented reductions in Dynatrace/ROSA node-based costs.
column63:
●	No changes to application manifests; optimization occurs at pod admission time.
●      Honors quotas/PDBs/annotations (e.g., safe-to-evict=false).
●	Masters/infra pools not targeted for consolidation; focus on workers.
●	Optional policy to keep environments read-only for analysis only.

column25:
Check with Indu to see if the RAG pattern will work for this use case.

Met with the team and the RAG pattern will not work for these reasons:

Key Gaps Identified
1. Architecture Incompatibility - The enterprise solution is a tightly-coupled system with integrated UI and backend. It does not expose APIs, making it incompatible with our custom UI.
2. Our UI Requirements - We provide functionality beyond basic chat:
◦ Downtime management for reservation specialists
◦ Admin and analytical dashboards
◦ Defect tracking
◦ Custom workflow integrations
3. Technical Differences
◦ We use OpenSearch (already performance-tuned); enterprise uses PostgreSQL
◦ We expose REST APIs for broader integrations
◦ We consume external data sources beyond S3
4. Strategic Direction - We're evolving toward an agentic approach (1-2 months) where the assistant will surface different tools and execute tasks autonomously for reservation specialists. This requires architectural flexibility the standardized solution doesn't provide.
5. Current Status - Our solution is built and ready. Enterprise solution is still in development (1-2 weeks from release).
Pavitra agreed during our discussion that the enterprise solution is not the right fit for our use case, noting it's designed for teams needing quick POCs or lacking resources, not to mandate all teams use it when they have specific requirements like ours.
Given these factors, we'd like to proceed with our existing architecture. Happy to discuss further if needed.

KM-GenAI - 

We cannot use the Km-GenAI solution to host this application due to its intended purpose.

Our application is designed to resolve issues related to RES applications only. For example, if a RES specialist encounters a “502 Bad Gateway”,"Unable to Refund", any technical or functional issues/error on their screen, they can use the app to ask questions and troubleshoot the problem.

Additionally, the app allows specialists to record downtime by selecting the downtime option on the screen, maintaining a conversational interface while generating analytical data from these interactions.

In contrast, Km-GenAI is specifically focused on Delta policies and is intended for use across the entire Delta organization.

column85: • Information Security: Compliant with Delta’s InfoSec Policies, Standards, and Amber/Emerald mandates. • Path to Production: Follows Delta’s Path to Production deployment process. • AI Controls: AI capabilities (e.g., real-time personalization, predictive decisioning) use explainable, governed logic within Adobe’s AI framework. • Secure Architecture: Built with Zero Trust and secure-by-design principles. • Risk Alignment: AI usage aligns with Delta’s risk tolerance, with human-in-the-loop controls where required. • Threat Modeling: Covered under Adobe’s centrally managed security and threat model. • Restricted Data Protection: All models and training data are classified and protected per Delta’s “Restricted” data classification. • Monitoring & Logging: Provides visibility into AI decisioning and supports anomaly and drift detection. • Version Control & Testing: Supports versioned rule sets and AI configurations with testing for robustness and accuracy. • Auditability: AI decisions and actions are traceable for compliance and audit purposes.

column9:
Agentforce is integrated with a Trust Layer to mitigate Generative AI risks. The Trust Layer ensures that responses your agents generate are grounded in your trusted company data. And its zero-data retention policy means that your company and customer information will never be released into the wild. The Trust Layer detects potentially harmful LLM responses and includes event log monitoring for transparency in each user interaction. Topic instructions that define agent behavior also act as guardrails to prevent hallucinations and malicious attacks. The record and field access agents have, are permissions-based and can be set for different agent types and actions.

column9:
EFS utils v2 is the latest major version of the amazon-efs-utils package, an open-source collection of tools provided by AWS to simplify mounting and working with Amazon EFS file systems on EC2 instances.
 
The primary change in v2 is the replacement of the third-party stunnel component with an in-house AWS component called efs-proxy for managing encryption in transit (TLS).
column25: 11/17/25: STR approved
column40: The amazon-efs-utils package is a crucial component for working with AWS EFS because it simplifies the mounting process and provides essential security and management features that are not available with a standard Linux Network File System (NFS) client alone. SAP system requires a higher level of security.
column41: The amazon-efs-utils package is a crucial component for working with AWS EFS because it simplifies the mounting process and provides essential security and management features that are not available with a standard Linux Network File System (NFS) client alone. SAP system requires a higher level of security.
column42:
The amazon-efs-utils package, particularly with the enhancements in v2, provides significant business benefits by improving operational efficiency, enhancing security, and boosting application performance:
Simplified Management: The mount helper utility automates complex configuration settings for mounting EFS file systems, reducing the manual effort and expertise required from IT staff. This allows engineering and operations teams to focus on building features and driving value for the customer, rather than managing storage infrastructure.
Seamless Integration: The package ensures smooth integration with other AWS services like AWS Lambda, ECS, and EKS, allowing businesses to easily modernize applications and build serverless or containerized architectures that require shared, persistent storage
Increased Throughput: The primary technical upgrade in v2, the efs-proxy, increases the maximum per-client throughput limit from 500 MiBps to 1.5 GiBps. This allows businesses to process data-intensive workloads (e.g., financial analytics, genomics, media processing) up to 3x faster, delivering insights more quickly and potentially lowering compute costs.
High Availability and Durability:  EFS is designed to be highly durable and available, storing data redundantly across multiple Availability Zones (AZs). The efs-utils package helps ensure robust connectivity, enabling applications to failover between AZs seamlessly, which is critical for business continuity and disaster recovery strategies.
Streamlined Security Implementation: The utilities simplify the implementation of encryption for data in transit using TLS. This ensures data protection and helps businesses meet stringent security and regulatory compliance requirements (e.g., PCI DSS, HIPAA, SOC 2) without the need for complex, manual configurations.
Granular Access Control: The mount.efs helper enables the use of IAM policies and EFS Access Points to control file system access at a fine-grained level, which is essential for managing multi-tenant environments securely.

column45: Use standard NFS client with reduced performance and security.

column65: I approve the adoption of AWS EFSUtils_v2 for SAP-wide use. This utility significantly enhances our operational efficiency and data resilience by enabling secure, scalable, and automated mounting of Amazon EFS file systems with IAM authentication and TLS encryption—capabilities not natively supported by NFSv4.1 alone. By leveraging EFSUtils_v2, we reduce manual configuration overhead, improve compliance posture, and ensure consistent connectivity across dynamic cloud environments, aligning with our strategic goals for secure, cloud-native infrastructure modernization

column9: AWS Backint is an SAP-certified backup and restore solution for SAP HANA databases running on AWS, enabling efficient backups to Amazon S3 and integration with SAP management tools.
column25: 11/19/25: STR approved
column40: With AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA, backup of business-critical SAP HANA database can be enabled to Amazon S3. Backup is optimized to provide the best performance while keeping the load on your SAP HANA application under control. This increases the speed at which data can be backed up and restored to and from Amazon S3.
column41: With AWS Backint Agent we were able to increase our backup speed by a factor of 10. Another positive aspect is the very easy and quick setup of AWS Backup Agent. Additionally, the recovery process runs smoothly and quickly. Our customers benefit from the solution in every respect, a real added value."
column42:
AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA supports server-side encryption of backups and validates Amazon S3 bucket ownership before backup and restore to and from Amazon S3.
AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA is optimized to utilize the maximum Elastic Block Storage (EBS) throughput and network bandwidth available to Amazon S3 from your EC2 instance. This increases the speed at which your SAP HANA database can be backed up or restored to and from Amazon S3, improving your Recovery Time Objective (RTO).
AWS Backint Agent integrates with SAP HANA Backint API, which has built-in validations to provide reliable backup and restore capabilities.
AWS Backint Agent for SAP HANA can automatically backup your SAP HANA database log files to Amazon S3 at regular intervals to meet your RPO requirements.

column9:
dbt is a platform-agnostic data transformation framework designed to bring software engineering principles into the analytics layer. It enables data analysts and engineers to build modular, version-controlled SQL models that compile into executable queries within the target data warehouse. By leveraging dbt, teams can implement automated testing, enforce data quality checks, and maintain comprehensive documentation and lineage across transformation pipelines.

The framework supports multiple compute environments within Delta—Teradata, Redshift, Postgres, Athena, Glue—and is extensible to future platforms such as Databricks and Snowflake. This abstraction layer ensures consistent transformation logic regardless of underlying infrastructure, reducing migration complexity and enabling cross-platform portability.

Proofs of Concept (POCs) will validate dbt’s scalability and interoperability with IT across diverse business domains (such as Cargo, CXD, OAP, Reservations and Care, HR) by integrating with existing platform-specific workflows. These POCs will demonstrate dbt’s ability to standardize transformation processes, improve maintainability, and accelerate delivery within Delta’s enterprise data ecosystem utilizing connectivity to tera-edw-dev-037661190395 and Teradata data labs.
column40: dbt is needed to solve the problem of managing complex data transformations in a scalable and reliable way by applying software engineering best practices to data analytics. It helps data teams build, test, and deploy analytics code using tools for version control, documentation, and data quality checks, reducing errors and improving the reliability of data used for decision-making. dbt works by enabling analysts to transform data directly in their cloud data warehouse using SQL, creating a modular, documented, and version-controlled system.
column41: dbt provides business benefits by improving data reliability, efficiency, and accessibility through its data transformation tool. It empowers data teams to build trusted data models, automate processes, and deliver insights faster, which leads to better decision-making across the organization.
column42:
SQL-Based Transformations: Users write SQL SELECT statements to build data models, transforming raw data into usable datasets.

Version Control: Integrates with Git to allow for tracking changes, code reviews, and a complete history of data logic.

Automated Testing: Built-in testing frameworks allow users to write tests to ensure data quality and catch anomalies.

Documentation and Lineage: Automatically generates documentation and tracks data lineage, showing how data flows through the system and what the impact of changes is.

Modular Code: Encourages modularity and reusability of code, making models easier to maintain.

CI/CD Integration: Enables continuous integration and deployment for data pipelines.

column44:
- What equivalent survey/feedback products have you considered or evaluated?
              A detailed and thorough comparison was done with Qualtrics as a possible alternative here. However, Qualtrics was unable to natively render a survey in the context of a chat. The only way for Qualtrics to work with Salesforce would have required a tremendous amount of custom code to build a component to capture a survey and retroactively transfer that response to a Qualtrics survey or pilots and flight attendants would have been expected to respond to an emailed survey after the chat. The purpose of the survey is first to verify that the front line employees’ problems were resolved in chat. Sending that question as an email outside of the chat would necessarily lead to a drop in engagement that defeats the purpose of the survey.

- Are there existing Delta-approved survey technologies that could meet this need?
              No, see the above notes. The alternative available technology does not meet the key requirement.

- Why is Salesforce Feedback Management the preferred solution over alternatives?
              Salesforce Feedback Management is preferred because it does allow for a survey to be presented in the context of the chat, increasing the probability of response as much as possible.

We would also not be able to give the business the ability to update the survey questions as they need.

column40: Traditional directory navigation using cd can be slow and inefficient, especially for users who frequently switch between deeply nested or numerous project folders. Zoxide solves this by offering a smarter, faster alternative that:
column41:
Effective in navigation that can have great impacts to all of IT's work flows when in the terminal.
Use Cases for Zoxide
1.	Fast Directory Navigation
	Jump to frequently or recently used directories with minimal typing.
	Example: z projects might take you to /home/user/work/projects even if you're deep in another directory.
2.	Fuzzy Matching
	Navigate using partial or fuzzy matches of directory names.
	Great for when you don’t remember the full path.
3.	Shell Integration
	Works with Bash, Zsh, Fish, PowerShell, and Nushell.
	Seamlessly integrates into your existing shell workflow.
4.	Directory Ranking
	Zoxide tracks how often and how recently you visit directories.
	It prioritizes your most-used paths, making navigation smarter over time.
5.	Interactive Mode
	Use zi (if configured) to interactively select a directory from a list.
	Helpful when multiple matches exist.
6.	Scripting and Automation
	Can be used in scripts to jump to known directories without hardcoding paths.
	Useful for DevOps workflows or CI/CD pipelines.
7.	Cross-Platform Use
	Works on Linux, macOS, and Windows.
	Ideal for users who work across different environments.
column42:
Zoxide is a command line tool / binary that allow you to seamlessly change directories with low effort.
Learns your habits: It tracks and ranks directories based on usage, allowing quick access to frequently visited locations.
Supports fuzzy matching: You don’t need to remember exact paths—just part of the name is enough.
Improves productivity: Reduces time spent typing long paths or searching for directories.
Integrates with multiple shells: Works seamlessly with Bash, Zsh, Fish, PowerShell, and more.
Cross-platform compatibility: Useful across Linux, macOS, and Windows environments.

column9:
Bruno is an open-source API client that stores collections as plain text files on the local file system, making it inherently Git-friendly for version control and collaboration. It is a lightweight and fast alternative to Postman for testing, debugging, and automating API workflows with features like pre- and post-request scripts. Here is a overview of few key characteristics of Bruno:
1. Offline-first: Bruno is a local app that stores API collections in local folders with plain text files, eliminating the need for cloud accounts/logins and a constant internet connection.
2. Git-friendly: API collections can versioned, branched, and merged just like code with seamless integration into Git for versioning and team collaboration.
3. Open-Source: The majority of Bruno's features are free and open-source governed by the MIT License (https://github.com/usebruno/bruno?tab=MIT-1-ov-file#readme).

Although Postman is currently approved, the only version approved is 9.x which hasn't been patched since 2022. In addition, the Scratch Pad within Postman is not as Git-friendly as the Bruno client.
column25: The eCommerce Access Management platform is entirely API-driven. The primary way the API is communicated and shared with consumers is through a API test collection. Today we keep that collection in Postman. We've managed to make Postman work with GitLab, but the process is very onerous and prone to error. We have worked closely with the Developer Experience team to explore several API client applications and even participated in the Postman enterprise trial. Unfortunately, non of that effort resulted in a solution. Bruno has proven to be the best API client we've found that is truly open-source and able to satisfy Delta's privacy requirements while still providing collaboration through existing approved systems like GitLab.

I also participated in the Postman enterprise trial, which ultimately was deemed cost-prohibative. As an architect in Information Security, I have reservations with our use of Postman 9.x, which hasn't been patched since 2022 and has one documented, but vendor disputed CVE (https://www.cvedetails.com/vulnerability-list/vendor_id-34480/product_id-168398/version_id-1757755/Postman-Postman-9.31.28.html). I believe we need an approved alternative that can meet Delta's privacy and compliance standards and integrate with our existing ecosystem of approved solutions. I recommend Bruno as the alternative, until a better alternative presents itself.

US Department of Energy (DoE) provides the index rates for fuel surcharges based on weekly published values. It's free and open data, available through public API. 
The TM system receives these charges automatically from DoE using this API and apply all relevant fuel surcharge conditions to freight orders.
column40: The Fuel surcharge is an additional fee that carriers charge on top of basic charge rates. Fuel surcharges are charges designed to help carriers cover the costs associated with fuel, especially given the constant fluctuation in fuel prices by calculating weekly fuel index rates automatically from DoE using API. The system will calculate and apply all relevant fuel surcharge conditions to freight orders.

* Automating this process improves accuracy while reducing manual updates for charge calculation. This also enhances audit traceability for finance and audit teams for compliance.

* Doing this direct integration ensures that SAP TMS is always aligned with the latest industry fuel benchmarks and that the rates provided are always up to date and accurate for compliance and reporting.

column84: Application Name & Blockcode: No. Mandate Description Evidence/ comments about how this is achieved S1 End-to-End Encryption - All data in transit and at rest must be encrypted, in compliance with our policies. This applies to data within the SaaS platform, and the integration or access to Delta systems. All data in transit and at rest is encrypted. S2 Authentication and Authorization S2.A: All Delta users must be authenticated by Global Auth, including MFA if required by Delta security standards. This requires a federated authentication integration with the SaaS provider. On Demand customers can implement Federated security for the Vertex Central UI. Customers can use their own Identity provider (IDP) and implement Federated security to the Vertex Auth0 IDP through a SAML 2.0 integration. This gives customers the ability to use SSO for the Vertex UI and leverage their own multi-factor authentication (MFA) application. S2.B: Credentials used for outbound APIs (i.e. Delta to SaaS provider) must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Customers are required to update passwords every 42 days. S2.C: All inbound APIs (i.e. SaaS provider to Delta) must be authorized using the Delta API Authorizer and must be processed through Akamai for our standard WAF and DDoS protection. see API link: https://developer.vertexinc.com/ S2.D: Access to the SaaS solution, and roles within the SaaS solution must be controlled using AD groups managed by SailPoint, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved All roles are managed within the application, they are roles based which determines user access. S2.E: Authorization controls within the SaaS solution must be managed to enforce least privilege. For example, general users should not have "tenant" admin privileges. Least Privilege utilized S3 Cloud Access Security Broker - The SaaS solution must be integrated with the Delta CASB, unless there is evidence of technical reasons this cannot be achieved. No, this would be apart of SSO S4 Direct Data Connections (this includes any direct data connectivity such as to databases, message queues, cache services, service bus, file systems, object stores, file transfers, etc.) S4.A: Inbound connections from the SaaS provider to Delta data sources directly via the Internet are not permitted. API, proxy, or other intermediary connectivity solutions must be included so the data sources do not need to be publicly accessible. Yes S4.B: Credentials used to authenticate all direct data traffic must be stored, controlled, and rotated in compliance with our Delta security standards. Yes, stored utilizing Bcrypt5 S4.C: Data access controls, and data that is uploaded to the SaaS platform must be strictly limited to only the data necessary for the SaaS solution to function correctly. Vertex utilizes Rols-based access controls S5 Logging - The SaaS provider must offer logging or a way to view events for important transactions (e.g. logins, high-value transactions, administrative changes, etc.) Delta approved account admin will have access to activity and application logs within the UI. S6 Restrict Network Access - The Delta tenant of the SaaS solution must only be accessible from the Delta network unless there is a business requirement to allow access from the public Internet. Yes

column9:
Palantir Foundry AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) is an extension of Palantir's Foundry data platform that enables organizations to build and deploy generative AI applications securely and safely within their own private networks.

This request is for usage of Palantir Foundry with AIP. AIP supports many LLM’s available in the market like Open AI ChatGPT, Claude etc. This request is specifically for a POC for using Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.0/4.5 model in AIP.


More features
Business Rationale: Several business-critical use cases are contingent on AIP enablement. @Bramlett, Amanda A would you please be able to provide the most recent information here?
column40:
Since AIP is not enabled in Foundry, we are not able to use any of the LLMs in Foundry. 

- Due to this constraint application that are developed in Foundry that need LLM support for log analysis for predictive application we have to get this data sent to Delta managed AWS accounts with access to Bedrock and run it through an approved LLM. 

- This results in very inefficient architecture for the business. This prevents scaling of applications built in Foundry due to rate limits. We are using Claude 4.0 LLM for TechOps Applications Once Claude 4.0 is available in Foundry we can eliminate the need to send data to Delta managed AWS accounts and use this model for building applications inside of Foundry. 

- We are also requesting use of Claude 4.5, as this is the latest model available from Anthropic. This is needed to achieve improved predictive accuracy and contextual reasoning for the use cases that are described in business benefits. 

As additional need for using other LLMs (model families) arise a new STR will be submitted.
column41:
1. AIP for CMM Parsing:
Component engineering, component maintenance, and others have requested parsed CMM content to help evaluate cost and improve planning for material requirements. One such use case "make vs buy" requires CMM content to be extracted from PDF documents and available to determine if it is a better business decision to bring repairs in-house vs continue to use external OSRs

2. AIP for Contract parsing:
Supply Chain wants to extract key information from contracts to ensure "obligations" are explicit and can be efficiently tracked and evaluated across the life of the contract.
Warranty wants to parse contact content and align with component information so that they can make claims and realize lost funds when materials fail prematurely.

3. MRO has a desire to parse contract content to support efficient contract development and customer negotiation.

4. MRO  has a desire to parse service bulletins to understand requirements for new customers and quickly develop contract pricing
Engine Maintenance wants to parse engine service manuals and IPCs to develop comprehensive material master information and digital work scope documents for engine repair (and integration into the existing UPS Foundry tool).
column42:
AIP Overview: Attached document (Palantir AIP Architecture.pdf) has
1- a diagram that describes how AIP interacts with the rest of the Palantir platform; 
2- a diagram that provides a high-level description of the architecture and security controls 
3- details about AIP features.

AIP Governance: There is a strict governance and observability model for AIP built into the platform. There are controls in place at different levels, that can only be accessed and managed via administrators. 
   - Administrators must individually enable specific LLMs in the Control Panel. This ensures that only approved and enabled LLMs will be available on the platform. Follow this link for controlling AIP access. https://www.palantir.com/docs/foundry/aip/enable-aip-features#enable-llms.
  - Platform administrators can restrict available of different AIP applications by user groups. Follow the link for more details - https://www.palantir.com/docs/foundry/aip/enable-aip-features#restrict-aip-usage

AI ethics and governance: The link provides additional details on ethics and governance capabilities in Foundry. https://www.palantir.com/docs/foundry/aip/ethics-governance#platform-capabilities-5

AIP Features: Enabling AIP would provide access to several key features to expedite both business outcomes and developer productivity. Below are some examples:
1- AIP Document Intelligence - enable development of a 'Make vs Buy' tool for the Components team  for use case number 1 - AIP for CMM Parsing and 2. AIP for Contract parsing, which will lead to better decision-making and reduce costs.
2- AIP Assist - expedite training and onboarding efforts, increasing productivity for developers and platform end users
3- AIP Analyst - enable ad-hoc analysis using natural language for business users to enable better decision-making
4- AI Development Tools - AI FDE and other AI development tools will significantly reduce development and iteration time, and enable teams to build production-grade applications with the right permissions and controls, quicker and better. This will help with all of the business cases listed above, in terms of building the applications quicker.

column1: AWS ATX (Formerly AWS SEG (Super Elastic Gumby) )
column9:
Delta has completed the poc for AWS ATX (Formerly AWS SEG (Super Elastic Gumby) ). The GA release for ATX(SEG) is targeted in AWS reinvent tentatively by 5th December, 2025.
SEG is similar to Q CLI in that it is an agentic CLI tool that is designed for large scale code transformations, code interpretations, repeatable code updates (ie upgrade node version, java version, python version. There are several uses cases that during this preview we are looking to evaluate SEG for delta use cases:
1. Generating dependency map for each Delta gtilab repositories
2. To Serve DeveloperHub use-case, re-run atx for generating application level dependency map using repository level dependency map(associated to application).
3. Only member of respective git group and DX team will be able to trigger atx analysis
4. It will be made available to users through Developer Hub (Delta Internal Developer Portal - DEXDPLDHUB), it has Oauth2 authorization code pikce flow for authorization and LDAP & PING for authentication.
5. We are expecting to run for all delta repository and make it available to Delta IT through developer hub

Questions:
 1. Who are the users (and how many will there be)? Developer hub will be levaraged by all of Delta IT. To be able to trigger this workflow the user will be authenticated first thru PING and then fine grain access control will be handled via looking at the user role and see if they are in the teams sailpoint group. There are no direct users of this agent. This agent runs a predetermined workflow when triggered. There is also a CRON job that will run to keep dependencies up to date. Future state we are looking at hooking into gitlab MR's to trigger as updates occur. 
2. Thie references Agentic AI but it appears to be a sub-agent of some sort. It would be good to show this context in the architecture diagram. Currently it doesn't reflect any sort of Agentic AI contect. Diagram has been updated to show the two flows as mentioned above. This agent is essentially Q CLI running in headless mode but is designed for larger scale transformations
3. How will users be authenticated? Answered in question 1 but will sumerize here: Users are direct to PING following PCKE flow before any part of devhub loads. Users roles are validated for access to the project in devhub. If user has access then they can trigger dependency map to be generated.
column25:
We have done the POC as per STR 1676 - AWS SEG (Super Elastic Gumby), now we want to move ahead and enable ATX(SEG) access in developer experience accounts.
1. devexp-si-647088722151 (647088722151)
2. devexp-prd-112078478450 (112078478450)

This agentic flow is leveraging AWS Transform (Its Q CLI transformation feature designed to run at scale and headless so its like a workflow with a predefined prompt). This process will only trigger by CRON or by approved app team to refresh the dependency map data. This data will be pushed to neptune and/or DDB table. 
 
From there when users load the application view in devhub we will not call any AI Flows or uses but will query neptune (graphdb) or DDB (still trying to determine what is best). In the future we are going to use this to tie into a custom agent (STR will come when were ready to support that) to generate SPAD and to help query natural language to understand dependencies amongst our applications. For now its going to be used in displaying dependency mapping and for SPAD generation we will leverage the neptune database (that contains the results of the depenency map) to generate the SPAD in the future
column40:
There are several uses cases that during this preview we are looking to validate AWS ATX(SEG) for delta use cases in staging:
1. Dependency Mapping. Currently there is a gap at Delta to understand what App/Api/Component is calling or dependent on what. 
2. Code Library upgrades. Currently there are several teams that need to upgrade node and python versions. This is one of SEG core use cases to upgrade to latest versions of major frameworks
3. Code summarization: Developer Hub team has an immediate need to onboard existing gitlab repo's/applications into DeveloperHub. To do this we are looking for an agent tool (SEG) to provide the summary of the application so that we can understand the application type and components needed for onboarding
4. Code Library Dependencies: As part of the move from Veracode to Gitlab SAST scans, Security is needing a lockfile added to every repo. Java package managers do not have a concept of this like Node. We are looking at SEG to iterate thru the gitlab repos and create this file to automate this need for the migration
column41:
From the above uses cases there are several benefits we are looking to capture during the POC:
1. We can capture and maintain a dependency mapping of all apps/services at delta
2. We can auto create MR's for teams or teams can automatively create MR's to upgrade language versions to stay in compliance 
3. We can auto onboard the 30K repo's into developer hub vs having each team manual perform this action
4. We can auto create the java lock file needed for SAST migration to Gitlab vs having to ask each team to manual come up with this list
column42: The product offers running code enhancements/summarization at scale with headless mode and AWS pre-tested templates for industry use cases like upgrading node 18 to 22

column9:
RapidX is Hexaware’s platform designed to accelerate code comprehension and requirement specification using AI-driven SMEs.  RapidX Code Comprehension AI SME analyzes legacy code, reverse engineers it, and generates a business blueprint including process flows, execution flows, rules, calculations, and clear documentation in both business and functional terms.  RapidX Requirement Clarity AI SME helps develop detailed functional specifications, including epics, user stories and acceptance criteria, engineering tasks, implementation guidance simplifying the requirements elaboration process. 
Together, these AI SMEs accelerate legacy modernization by transforming the code into functional business blueprints and turning business requirements into modernization specifications.

Upon a successful Pilot analyzing Delta’s Crew portfolio’s static code in a dedicated Hexaware Azure infrastructure exclusive to Delta, requesting to move this to permanent production. RapidX Code Comprehension will be used to generate detailed business insights, blueprints, and functional documentation from the legacy code. This approach will empower Delta with in-depth understanding of the complex business logic and functionality, significantly accelerating modernization efforts, streamlining operational processes, and mitigating risks associated with manual code analysis
column40:
1. Delta's IT landscape includes multiple legacy systems, many of which lack adequate documentation and are supported by limited market skills. RapidX will play a crucial role in extracting and documenting a business blueprint including documenting business rules, process flows, and other critical details from these legacy codebases, creating a comprehensive functional understanding that serves as a solid foundation for accelerated modernization.

2.	Manual reverse engineering of these legacy systems would require significant time and effort. However, the RapidX platform will dramatically expedite this phase by leveraging a set of specialized AI SMEs, supporting every stage of modernization— from functional comprehension and business blueprinting to target architecture design and modernized application development.
column41:
By implementing RapidX, we envisage following business benefits:
1.	Derisk Modernization & Maintenance: With limited SME knowledge and outdated documentation, there is a significant risk that critical business processes and system functionalities are poorly understood, leading to extended timelines, compliance risks, and difficulties in modernizing the system. RapidX mitigates these risks by providing detailed insights and documentation, ensuring a smoother modernization process.

2.	Business Continuity: Legacy systems often pose risks to business continuity. RapidX facilitates the modernization of these systems, thereby enhancing business continuity and reducing the risks associated with outdated technologies.

3.	Improving Maintainability: Outdated and incomplete documentation makes managing complex systems inefficient and challenging. RapidX addresses this by generating comprehensive and up-to-date documentation of the legacy codebase, streamlining knowledge management, and improving maintainability.
Faster Modernization, Quicker Time to Market: Modernization projects are often delayed by limited internal technical expertise and the scarcity of necessary skills in the market. RapidX empowers teams to overcome these challenges, enabling faster project completion and quicker time to market.
column42:
Specific Business Capabilities of RapidX AI SMEs
1.	Advanced Functional Code Comprehension: RapidX thoroughly analyzes and understands complex legacy codebases, providing valuable insights that enable organizations to fully grasp the intricacies of their outdated systems. This deep comprehension is crucial for navigating the challenges associated with legacy systems, ensuring a solid foundation for modernization efforts.
2.	Business Blueprinting: RapidX assists in capturing, documenting, and analyzing business processes, requirements, and system functionalities, forming a comprehensive foundation for system design and modernization efforts.
3.	Enhanced Requirements Management: RapidX creates detailed functional specifications, ensuring that all project requirements are thoroughly documented and seamlessly integrated with standard ALM tools, enhancing the efficiency of the requirements management process.
4.	Target Implementation: RapidX leverages these detailed specifications to generate engineering and implementation guidance, driving the development of a modernized target architecture that is fully aligned with business objectives.
column45: If this request is denied, the alternative would involve a more labor-intensive approach, requiring manual effort to review programs and assess how to rewrite them, or relying on traditional tooling, which would provide a suboptimal comprehension of the codebase. In both the cases, it significant delays time to modernize and increases risks of modernization
column51:
Overview of Ongoing Support Model
Hexaware will manage RapidX ‘s environment at Hexaware environment dedicated to Delta. This includes regular infrastructure maintenance & support, reliability, security & performance monitoring and features upgrades.

1. Technical Support:
•	Description: Regular maintenance, updates, and troubleshooting of RapidX to ensure smooth operation.
•	Requirements: Hexaware will engage dedicated technical support team for resolving issues, patches and performing system upgrades.
2. System Monitoring:
•	Description: Continuous monitoring of system performance, security, and reliability.
•	Requirements:  Hexaware will engage dedicated teams equipped with appropriate tools to track system health and address any anomalies or performance issues.
3. Integration Maintenance:
•	Description: Ensuring ongoing compatibility and functionality with existing Delta IT
•	Requirements: Not Applicable. There is no requirement of Integration to Delta IT systems currently identified for the scope of this STR.
column54: •	Potential to decommission or reduce reliance on legacy applications, increased business agility, significantly reduce operational risks
column58: •	 No operation risk for this STR as Hexaware will manage the services, infrastructures and feature upgrades governed by SLAs
column61: Controlled Launch with select Delta portfolios beginning with the Crew portfolio. Similar or different legacy code from other portfolio will be identified with specific use cases based on the direction from Delta IT leadership.
column62: •	Expand the use of RapidX across the organization based on initial adoption outcomes.

column65:
Overview:
Objective: 
•	Delta wants to modernize set of legacy applications, RapidX is one of the vendor platforms which helps in comprehending/reverse engineering legacy code and elaborate requirements,

Benefits:
•	Increased Efficiency: RapidX aims to streamline and accelerate project delivery by improving code analysis and requirements management.
•	Improved Accuracy: RapidX offers more precise code understanding and requirement specifications, reducing errors.
•	Cost Savings: By automating processes, RapidX is expected to lower manual effort and operational costs, providing a favorable ROI.

Conclusion:
RapidX will serve as a strategic platform for Delta, supporting modernization efforts, enhancing application maintainability, and, with its comprehensive suite of AI SMEs, accelerating the software development life cycle (SDLC).

Recommended to move forward with implementing in permanent production based on success of the pilot

column9: ​​Rider(jet Brains) supports .NET Framework, the new cross-platform .NET Core, and Mono based projects. This lets you develop a wide range of applications including .NET desktop applications, services and libraries, Unity games, Xamarin apps, ASP.NET, and ASP.NET Core web applications.​
column25:
12/1/25: STR approved
Pending items: PIA, contract modification, check to see when the next VRA is due

We have successfully migrated our Xamarin projects to .NET MAUI. Most of these projects can be built using Visual Studio Code; however, the Flight Family Communication project requires Rider for its build process.
column40:
There are only three IDEs available for Mac OS for build Xamarin and .net MAUI apps.  
Visual Studio for Mac(discontinued)
VSCode
Rider 

We have been using Visual Studio for Mac/VSCode with Enterprise subscription for developing our Xamarin Enterprise apps.
We are unable to use the same for .Net MAUI apps due to various technical issues and limitations with VSCode.  

Technical issues: 
#1 – Our Xamarin and Maui Enterprise apps in Delta is designed as a multi-project solution with configuration setup for each environment – Dev, SI and Production.  
VSCode is not able to detect these custom configuration setups. It only runs in Debug/Release configuration which is not compatible with our existing setup.  
Team is unable to run the apps on different environments by switching the build scheme / configuration.  
The info.plist files disappears as VSCode is not detecting the custom configuration names. We cannot run an iOS app without a valid plist file for the configuration. 

 #2 – Configuration based on environment is critical especially in iOS because we have different provision profiles based on bundle identifier. Also, for apps supporting push notifications, we need to use SI configuration which we cannot do in Visual Studio for Mac/VScode currently. This creates a blocker for any development related to push notifications and its testing because we don’t have compatible IDE to do that. 

#3 – Platforms are not detected / allowed. In iOS we have 2 device platforms – iPhone and iPhoneSimulator. 
We create a simulator build for our Daf2 automation. With Visual Studio for Mac, it no longer allows us to create platform configurations which is a blocker for our automation as we are not able to create the simulator build. 

Rider solves all the issues mentioned above. That’s why we want to use Rider as our Primary IDE. 
Rider is compatible for all .net projects, and we want to use Rider as our Primary IDE as it is more advanced than Visual Studio for Mac. If we can get a subscription for Rider, it is possible that we can stop Visual Studio subscriptions. In future, if Visual Studio is required, we can use the community version. 
The Actual expectation of .Net Maui solutions are to work with VSCode but there have been numerous known issues, that clients are facing during their migration from Xamarin to .NET maui.  
 
Note - May be Microsoft will address the issues in future. if that happens, we can use the community-free versions and continue using Rider as our primary IDE for .NET related solutions.
column41:
1. Increased Developer Productivity
Faster Performance: Rider is lightweight and optimized for speed, especially on large solutions.
Cross-Platform: Runs on Windows, macOS, and Linux, which is great for distributed teams.
Advanced Code Analysis: Built-in inspections and quick fixes reduce bugs early in development.

2. Cost Efficiency
Single License for All Platforms: Unlike Visual Studio, which has different editions and pricing tiers, Rider offers a unified license.
Lower Hardware Requirements: Rider often runs smoother on less powerful machines, reducing infrastructure costs.

3. Better Integration
Seamless with JetBrains Ecosystem: Integrates with tools like TeamCity (CI/CD), YouTrack (issue tracking), and Space (collaboration).
Supports Multiple Frameworks: .NET, .NET Core, Xamarin, MAUI, Unity—all in one IDE.

4. Enhanced Code Quality
Refactoring Tools: Rider’s refactoring capabilities are among the best, improving maintainability.
Static Analysis & Unit Testing: Built-in tools help enforce coding standards and catch issues early.

5. Developer Satisfaction & Retention
Developers often prefer Rider for its UI responsiveness, keyboard shortcuts, and intelligent suggestions, which can improve morale and reduce turnover.
column42:
1. Cross-Platform Development
Works on Windows, macOS, and Linux, enabling teams to standardize tools across different environments.
Supports .NET, .NET Core, Xamarin, MAUI, Unity, and even front-end technologies, reducing the need for multiple IDEs.

2. Integrated Quality Assurance
Static Code Analysis and Code Inspections built-in, helping enforce coding standards and reduce defects early.
Unit Testing Integration with NUnit, xUnit, MSTest, and coverage tools for better test-driven development.

column9: Requesting access to use Amazon S3 Vectors for a POC (in accounts: genai-dev-867752000777 and genai-si-629614060031) to explore if it is an improved option for vector DB to use in Bedrock Knowledge base in the RAGBot Generative AI Pattern: Amazon S3 Vectors is a purpose-built durable vector storage solution that can reduce the total cost of uploading, storing, and querying vectors by up to 90 percent. Amazon S3 Vectors is the first cloud object store with native support to store large vector datasets and provide sub second query performance that makes it affordable for businesses to store AI-ready data at massive scale.

column40: Access to Amazon S3 Vectors is needed to support the development of applications that rely on high-performance vector search, semantic retrieval, and AI/ML workloads. The service provides a fully managed, scalable vector index directly integrated with S3 storage, eliminating the need to deploy or maintain separate vector databases. This improves retrieval speed, reduces infrastructure complexity, lowers operational overhead, and enables more efficient storage and search of embeddings generated by AI models. Using S3 Vectors will allow our team to deliver faster, more accurate search and retrieval capabilities while maintaining AWS-native security, compliance, and cost-optimization benefits.

column9: Facial authentication platform with a frictionless touchpoint to interact with other applications – in this case, test digital signage.
column40: This implementation will demonstrate the integration between Poppulo digital signage and Wicket’s facial biometrics software.  Potential use cases include employee events, such as LEAD or Velvet, Museum or welcoming employees to their work area.  The proof of concept is meant to show capabilities and demonstrate new integrations for future implementations.  A successful POC will be a working integration that fully demonstrates how a potential project could leverage both Poppulo’s digital signage and Wicket’s facial biometrics solution.  Delta Air Lines has made significant investments in Employee Communications, Recognition, Satisfaction and Engagement.  This POC is designed to support those investments by creating new and innovative ways to engage with employees through the use of Delta’s existing digital signage network and Wicket’s biometrics platform.  The use cases go far beyond the scope of the POC, but we see this as a stepping stone towards how we might engage with new and existing employees, guests and visitors, and more.
column41: The business benefit of completing this POC is to showcase new technologies and how they can work together with digital signage.  The POC aligns with our strategic goals of trying new technologies for the benefit of employees and passengers.
column42:
Post POC completion, we have identified a number of future use cases.  The Functional, Strategic, Operation and Integration capabilities are numerous.  

-Access Control - Wicket’s biometrics have already been adopted by the entire NFL at the League level for Employee, Player and Media access control and credentialing.    An employee's face is now their key card and allows them access to the appropriate and designed areas of the building they have access to.   Badges no longer need to be replaced or can be lost, because employees would use their face to unlock doors.   

-Payments - Along with access control, an employee's face can also be used to make purchases.  This could be applied to the Delta employee cafeteria or on-premise “store” where goods or services can be purchased.   With a simple scan of their face, their credit card can be charged or deduction from their paycheck can be applied.

-Guest / Visitor Check in - All guests and visitors planning to visit a Delta campus could use Wicket’s biometrics prior to visiting.  This will save time, validate guests ID’s, make the guest experience smoother and easier, and ensure Delta knows who all the guests are at any point in time, and restrict areas they are able to enter.  This is a massive safety and security benefit.

-Delta Conferences & Events - Wicket is already used by Fortune 100 companies like Salesforce and Nvidia for their company hosted events, like Dreamforce.   For any events, large or small, Wicket can act as your onsite registration for easy, smooth and frictionless entry.   As guests enter the conference area, they scan their face and their badge begins to print.

There are also benefits for Delta consumers.  This same technology can be used at Delta Sky Clubs, Ticketing, Boarding, etc.

The potential use cases of this technology are streamlined check-ins for employee events, improving employee morale by welcoming them to the workplace in a meaningful way.  Highlighting the robust capabilities of our product integration is also a benefit as it allows us to find new use cases that would not have been surfaced otherwise.
column43: Data will be stored in AWS US East region. Data processing and hosting will occur within the same region to ensure compliance. Wicket is GDPR and ISO 27001:2022 certified and holds a SOC 2 Type II and undergoes annual Penetration testing.

$0 – any costs incurred will be handled by Poppulo who is hosting this test pilot with Wicket and Delta.  

Post Proof Of Concept, the level of investment from Wicket would ultimately depend on the scope of the project.   Wicket has limited one-time setup fees that usually range in the $10,000 - $15,000 range.
If custom software integrations are required, those can range between $5,000 - $15,000 as a one-time fee, depending on the level of complexity.
As a SaaS company, Wicket has Annual Software License Fees that start at roughly $2,500 per “sensor”, and go down with quantity discounts and enterprise licensing models.

●	Wicket shall provide Support Services to the Customer in the form of (1) error reporting and correction; (2) advice and counsel on the use and maintenance of the software.
●	Scope of Support. Wicket will provide Support Services to the Customer through SMS (215-709-6943) or email (support@wicketsoft.com). Support to be provided seven (7) day per week 8am – 5pm EST and during all event hours with response times as detailed below.

Error Reporting
In the event that an error, defect, or omission is discovered that causes the software not to operate in conformance with the Customer’s expectations, the Customer shall notify Wicket of the problem (including a reasonable description and the severity level). Wicket shall respond to such notice and assign engineers to resolve the issue in accordance with the response expectations set forth below.

Response Expectations
The following specifies the level of response that will be given to any issue reported by the Customer. Wicket shall provide a reporting service by which the Customer can be assured that any issues made known to Wicket thereby will be promptly investigated and corrected. 
●	For any error that is reported during active support hours, Wicket shall respond within fifteen (15) minutes and provide the Customer with regular updates until the error is resolved.  For an issue reported outside of stated support hours, Wicket will respond within one business day.

column61: Due to the nature of facial biometrics and laws pertaining to its use, Wicket is an “Opt-in Only” solution for its users.  Meaning, the scanning of your face is 100% optional to use users, employees, guests, etc.   There is no mandatory use of facial biometrics, nor do we recommend that approach.    As such, the initial adoption plan would be made available to either a subset or all Delta employees as an optional program to reduce the need for badge scanner, ID verification, visitors, payments, etc.
column62: The mainstream adoption plan would stay the same.  It would be up to Delta, as it has been for other Wicket clients, to promote the use and benefits of facial biometrics.

Agentforce Vibes assists you throughout the Salesforce development process with expertise learned from anonymized code patterns. Our suite of AI-powered developer tools increases productivity and provides helpful assistance for complex coding tasks. We enforce development best practices with code generation and our suite of recommended static analysis and security scanning tools. With boilerplate code generation as its foundation, AI-assisted tooling also makes it easier for new developers to onboard to the Salesforce Platform.


Current Capabilities 

Agentforce Vibes generates Apex code from natural language prompts and automatically suggests code completions for you as you type. When enabled along with IntelliSense, this feature makes Salesforce development in Visual Studio Code even richer. Familiarity with Visual Studio Code is assumed.

Agentforce: Code with ease with intelligent Agentforce right beside you. Get started with agentic development workflows and Salesforce automation by chatting with Agentforce in natural language. Agentforce takes action to execute tasks like analyzing unfamiliar code, improving documentation, and completing complex development workflows.

Customization Rules and Context: Create persistent rules and provide context for more accurate, action-oriented responses from Agentforce.

Inline Code Completions: As you type, Agentforce Vibes can suggest code completions, without any interruptions to your workflow. Easily pick the suggestion that works for you. Use this feature in Apex and LWC (JavaScript, CSS, and HTML) files.

Test Case Generation: Use Agentforce to easily create unit test cases for your Apex methods and LWC components, using natural language prompts. Quickly get to required Apex test coverage and get your code ready for deployment.

column85: Agentforce solutions are designed, developed, and delivered to be compliant with our five principles for trusted generative AI. Accuracy: We prioritize accuracy, precision, and recall in our models, and we back our model outputs up with explanations and sources whenever possible. We recommend that a human check model output before sharing with end users. Safety: We work to mitigate bias, toxicity, and harmful outputs in our models using industry-leading techniques. We protect the privacy of personally identifiable information (PII) in our data by adding guardrails around this data. Honesty: We ensure that the data we use in our models respects data provenance and that we have consent to use the data. Empowerment: Whenever possible, we design models to include human involvement as part of the workflow. Sustainability: We strive to build right-sized models that prioritize accuracy and to reduce our carbon footprint.

column9:
We are requesting to enable Amazon Quick Suite- Quick Research in AWS Account# 822334816956

Amazon Quick Suite is AWS’s enhanced, AI-powered evolution of QuickSight. It combines traditional BI with generative AI to deliver end-to-end data-driven workflows. A comprehensive, generative AI‑powered business intelligence platform that enables: analysis, visualization, workflow automation, research, and collaboration—all in one workspace

Core Components:
1. Amazon QuickSight- Provides interactive dashboards, charts, scenario analysis, and natural‑language query interfaces via SPICE in-memory engine. 
2. Quick Research-AI agent for deep, cited research across enterprise and public data sources. 
3. Quick Flows- Enables users to create and execute workflow automations using natural language. 
4. Quick Automate- Manages multi-step, complex business processes across departments and applications. 
5. Quick Index- Serves as a knowledge base, indexing documents, emails, databases, and files for AI‑driven search.
column25:
Internal Delta SharePoint online sites will be used to reference our Accounting Research Library and policy documents. We also want the ability to reference data in our S3 bucket. There are pre-built connectors for both. The SharePoint connector uses delegated permissions, so user will sign in with their Delta ID and can only access files that they have access to.

Background:
Tyler Fenwick from the Financial Reporting Innovation team is requesting that we take Quick Suite (specifically Quick Research) through the STR process so that it can be enabled in the AWS Account he has requested.  This is an AWS Service that is still in the process of being sunrisen and until that point each team will have to take it through the STR Process for it to be enabled. 

The team was apart of a POC with QuickSuite led by Indu Tiwari's team.  During the POC they identified that using QuickSuite could save them ~8-16 hours of research time for Technical Accounting Research that is needed consistently on large transactions.  Based on this research their VP Julia McConnel would like to move forward with setting this up in an AWS which Tyler has already for 10 people to continue to use.  They will connect from their AWS Account to internal Delta SharePoint Sites and their own S3 bucket.  

2min Demo Link:

https://www.bing.com/videos/search?q=demo+of+amazon+quick+research&view=detail&mid=10FE1E2FFBFD73598D8A10FE1E2FFBFD73598D8A&ru=%2fsearch%3fpglt%3d163%26q%3ddemo%2bof%2bamazon%2bquick%2bresearch%26cvid%3da1f5f49f70b84cc89fefe80c0935d375%26gs_lcrp%3dEgRlZGdlKgYIABBFGDkyBggAEEUYOTIGCAEQABhAMgYIAhAAGEAyBggDEAAYQDIICAQQ6QcY_FXSAQg3MTYzajBqMagCALACAA%26FORM%3dANNAB1%26PC%3dU531&mmscn=vwrc&FORM=WRVORC
column40: Several teams in the Controllership need to conduct technical accounting research. It is a time-consuming process. Starting from scratch this takes 20+ hours. Often weeks to complete due to context switching for meetings, etc. This research is critical to understanding the financial implications of significant transactions. Value is time savings and reduced turnaround time to feed back into negotiations.
column41:
The Finance Controllership worked with Indu Tiwari's team on a POC and demonstrated between 8-16 hours of time savings for each research use case.

-Unifies analysis & action in a single platform.
-Empowers non-technical users: Requires no ML background thanks to conversational AI.
-Accelerates decision-making: From questions to insights to workflows seamlessly.

5. Security & Governance: Enterprise-grade with role-based access, row-level security, SSO, FedRAMP, HIPAA, PCI DSS, ISO and SOC compliance; encryption in transit and at rest.

column6: US Department of Energy (DoE - Federal Government)
column9:
US Department of Energy (DoE - Federal Government) provides the index rates for fuel surcharges based on weekly published values. It's free and open data, available through public API. 
The Transportation Management system receives these charges automatically from DoE using this API and apply all relevant fuel surcharge conditions to freight orders.
column40: The Fuel surcharge is an additional fee that carriers charge on top of basic charge rates. Fuel surcharges are charges designed to help carriers cover the costs associated with fuel, especially given the constant fluctuation in fuel prices by calculating weekly fuel index rates automatically from DoE using API. The system will calculate and apply all relevant fuel surcharge conditions to freight orders.
column41:
* US fuel surcharges for transport typically follow a posted fuel indices from the US DOE on a weekly basis.

* Automating this process improves accuracy while reducing manual updates for charge calculation. This also enhances audit traceability for finance and audit teams for compliance.

* Doing this direct integration ensures that SAP Transport Management System is always aligned with the latest industry fuel benchmarks and that the rates provided are always up to date and accurate for compliance and reporting.

column9: Organizations using Quantum Metric spend hundreds to thousands of hours manually reviewing digital session replays to diagnose user friction and understand customer journeys. This manual effort slows down time-to-insight, creates operational bottlenecks, and limits adoption among non-technical users. Felix AI solves this by automating session summarization, turning complex replay data into concise natural language insights that can be used by CX, product, and engineering teams.
column40: Organizations using Quantum Metric spend hundreds to thousands of hours manually reviewing digital session replays to diagnose user friction and understand customer journeys. This manual effort slows down time-to-insight, creates operational bottlenecks, and limits adoption among non-technical users. Felix AI solves this by automating session summarization, turning complex replay data into concise natural language insights that can be used by CX, product, and engineering teams.
column41:
Implementing Felix AI enables measurable improvements in efficiency, customer satisfaction, and ROI:
Operational Efficiency: 80% reduction in manual review time, freeing up staff for higher-value work such as A/B testing and dashboard creation.
Accelerated Decision-Making: Faster issue identification and root cause analysis, reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) by 20–40%.
column42:
Felix AI provides a wide range of GenAI-powered summarization and integration features, including:
Session Summarization: Automatically summarizes user sessions into short, actionable narratives.
User Summarization: Aggregates multi-session behavior for holistic journey understanding.
Real-Time Agent Assistance: Integrates with CRM and call center systems (e.g., Salesforce, Genesys) to provide pre-context to live and virtual agents, cutting handle times by up to 25%.
API & Platform Integrations: Embeds summaries into Voice of Customer (VoC), chatbots, and ticketing platforms such as ServiceNow and Splunk.
Cross-Channel Use Cases: Supports digital, call center, in-store, and chatbot scenarios for seamless experience continuity.
column51: The support model is a usage-based, consumption-based model based on summaries viewed annually, in 10,000 summary increments.

column40:
Delta’s IT landscape comprises numerous legacy systems, many of which suffer from inadequate documentation and rely on niche, declining skill sets. RapidX will play a pivotal role in addressing these challenges by extracting and documenting a comprehensive business blueprint. This includes capturing business rules, process flows, and other critical details from legacy codebases—creating a clear functional understanding that serves as a strong foundation for accelerated modernization.
The RapidX Blueprinting and Forward Engineering modules enable the definition of target system architecture, automated agile story generation, and code creation, streamlining the transition to modern platforms.
Manual modernization of these legacy systems would demand significant time and effort. In contrast, the RapidX platform dramatically accelerates this process by leveraging specialized AI subject matter experts (SMEs). These capabilities support every stage of modernization—from functional analysis and business blueprinting to target architecture design and modernized application development.
column41:
1) Significantly reduced modernization timelines, enabling faster time-to-market for critical features
2) Accelerated transformation powered by Generative AI
column43:
1) Code comprehension outputs are securely stored within the RapidX instance hosted by Hexaware.
2) User stories generated by RapidX are maintained within the platform and seamlessly synchronized with Delta’s Agility instance.
3) Generated code is committed to Delta’s source control repositories, with an associated knowledge graph available in RapidX for enhanced traceability and insight.
4) The platform is fully integrated with Q and Delta’s standard IDEs to support automated code generation, testing, and promotion workflows.
column44: There are no comparable products currently available. RapidX, the vendor’s solution, is being utilized for this initiative. A separate STR (#1888) has already been developed leveraging OpenSearch.

column1: TransPerfect Legal - eDiscovery tools vendor replacing KLDiscovery
column9:
eDiscovery is the process of identifying, collecting, and producing electronically stored information (ESI) for legal or regulatory purposes. It’s commonly used during litigation, investigations, or audits to gather relevant digital data such as emails, documents, chats, and files.

TransPerfect Legal is providing eDiscovery and forensics services for litigation matters. They have specific expertise and tools that are needed (and that our other eDiscovery providers do not have), and that is why we need to onboard them. While they do offer Relativity as well, we are mainly using their REEF Review Suite of tools. Their proprietary tool is perfect for our smaller matters that do not require as many review tools/bells & whistles that Relativity offers at a higher price point. It is used to process, review and produce data that is relevant to the litigation. This process is required for all of our litigations, and certain matters require certain expertise (i.e. an IP litigation is different from a Second Request is different from an Antitrust action.). As such, we cannot use just one vendor for all of our needs. 
Only attorneys have access to the database as all work product and data collections are protected by the attorney-client privilege. 
Any AI being used also falls under attorney-client privilege. We are not generating NEW data, the analytics and AI functions are only used to categorize/review our documents so that we can produce the relevant/not privileged docs. There is a big difference between AI and GenAI, and we have been using AI tools in the eDiscovery space for over 20 years. It is standard practice to use AI tools for efficient review. 
The vendor services being provided are a combination of SaaS and Professional Services.  The technology that the Delta eDiscovery team will be using is not a separate subscription/installation.
column25:
eDiscovery collection transmission:
- SFTP - Standard transmission of eDiscovery collections is by SFTP: TransPerfect Legal has the capability to receive electronic files directly from clients using a secure mode of electronic transmission. We use the Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) that requires SSH to be enabled. All data in transit is encrypted using TLS (version 1.2), VPN, and SFTP. All data at rest uses encryption with AES 256 algorithm.  
- Encrypted hard drives - For very large eDiscovery collections, transmission is by Physical Transmission: As a standard, they transfer data using 2TB encrypted hard drives. Amanda has the additional approvals required by Delta for using encrypted hard drives for processing.

MFA access management:
Amanda (manager for the Law Department's eDiscovery team) is the only one who will be approving access to the TransPerfect Legal workspaces. Only individuals specifically working on the matter (inside attorneys and outside counsel) will be provided access credentials. Also, Amanda audits the access log every month to remove access for anyone who has not logged in within the past 30 days. SSO is not feasible because of all the outside counsel that needs access.

- When a litigation matter is completed and Delta no longer needs to preserve the collected data, the workspace is deleted along with all originally collected data. Then, internally, Amanda's team removes the legal hold from Delta systems (because we preserve the original data in-place in our own environment.) The vendor keeps none of our data. Part of the reason all this goes through Amanda's team – so they can track where Delta's data is and make sure it’s deleted when it’s no longer needed. 

- Contract terms - The SOW lists dates the rates will be applicable, and SCM/Amanda's team reconnects with the vendor when the SOW is up for renewal to determine how to proceed for the next 1-3 years.
column40:
We currently use KLDiscovery for most of our subscription eDiscovery services. We are phasing them out in order to phase in TransPerfect and their REEF tools. 
The ultimate benefit is lower legal fees. TransPerfect Legal enhancements allow us to work more efficiently, thereby reducing our outside spend on document review and analysis. It is more fitting for our smaller matters (with a lower doc review count) than a traditional Relativity review platform. From an eDiscovery perspective, it also makes sense for us to house our matters in a few different locations.
column41:
The vendor services being provided are a combination of SaaS and Professional Services.  The technology that the Delta eDiscovery team will be using is not a separate subscription/installation.  TransPerfect Legal provides that at no cost within their cloud-based platform since Delta is utilizing their SaaS data hosting model and other professional services.
Keeping our (mainly) employment litigation matters with the same vendor/platform allows us to achieve the benefits of legacy knowledge and consistency across all of our matters. This is helpful because for the limited resources available to Delta's eDiscovery team (3 people).
column42: TransPerfect and their REEF tools (and Relativity) give us high-speed analytics and review tools required for litigation matters, regulatory inquiries and internal investigations. It has all the capabilities and audit trails needed to keep our processes legal and defensible. The tool also prepares documents in the format required by our ESI Protocols, producing them in compliance with our legal obligations.
column43:
TransPerfect Legal hosts client data in colocation physical data centers on servers that are wholly owned and maintained by TransPerfect Legal. Delta projects will be managed wholly out of the US-based data centers. The data centers are listed below:
• 125 Belmont Drive, Somerset, New Jersey, 08873, United States (Rackspace New Jersey Two Facility).
• 12100 Sunrise Valley Drive, Reston, Virginia, 20191, United States (High Security Discovery Center).
The Somerset location backs up to their Reston location: 12100 Sunrise Valley Drive, Reston, Virginia, 20191, United States (High Security Discovery Center).
TransPerfect replicates data onsite and offsite and always maintains an onsite passive system that is ready to be utilized in the event of a common hardware failure on the primary system. Should both the primary and backup onsite systems fail, TransPerfect will utilize a secure offsite facility to which the data has been actively replicated. Backup of virtual machines is performed on daily basis. Software utilizes AES-256-bit encryption.
column44: TransPerfect Legal provides similar services to our other Relativity Providers – Epiq, PageOne, Lineal.  Relativity is an industry-standard review platform – which we currently utilize from a handful of different providers (due to their differing offerings). TransPerfect’s REEF tools are a better fit for our smaller matters that do not require a high data volume and/or advanced analytics offerings.
column45:
We have other Relativity providers, but due to the subject-nature of this litigation, we need the specific tools they offer to meet our legal obligations. As stated above, from a privilege, business-continuity and eDiscovery perspective, it makes sense to have a few different service providers in this area.
If we don’t use the model implemented by the Delta eDiscovery team, the alternative is having each of our panel law firms choose their own eDiscovery service providers to handle our litigation matters. This means Delta has no insight into the security of those vendors, there is no guarantee they meet any of our requirements, and our proprietary data is floating around hundreds of places – most of which we cannot track/do not even know.
column46: No implementation costs. We only pay for services based on our actual level of consumption.
column51: Vendor Supported SaaS solution.
column53: Training is provided by the vendor
column61: TransPerfect Legal eDiscovery tools and Professional Services will be replacing KLDiscovery tools and Professional Services.

column9:
SAP TMS will be integrated with UPS carrier to send/receive the following information.

-Parcel Rates: TechOps has a high volume of parcel, particularly in MRO space. When the freight order is created in the SAP TMS and carrier selection is done, an interface will be triggered to CPI that will call the UPS carrier rating engine to retrieve the parcel rates.
-Tracking Events: Business requires SAP TMS to receive and process shipment tracking events from parcel carriers in near real-time. SAP TM automatically sends shipment details to CPI. CPI then calls the UPS tracking API to receive shipment status updates.
-Invoice: UPS will submit the invoices via EDI 210 message that will be received by SAP CPI and split across relevant freight orders in SAP TMS. 
- Label Request: Label Recovery API of UPS is called to retrieve the Labels.
