column84: S1 End-to-End Encryption - All data in transit and at rest must be encrypted, in compliance with our policies. Applies to SaaS platform and integration with Delta systems. All data in transit and at rest is encrypted. S2 Authentication and Authorization S2.A All Delta users must be authenticated by Global Auth, including MFA if required. Requires federated authentication integration with SaaS provider. NA(As user is not logging into the app) S2.B Credentials for outbound APIs must be stored, controlled, and rotated per Delta security standards. API Keys will be maintained in SAP TM and updated as needed S2.C All inbound APIs must be authorized using Delta API Authorizer and processed through Akamai for WAF and DDoS protection. NA S2.D Access and roles within SaaS must be controlled using AD groups managed by SailPoint unless technically infeasible. NA S2.E Authorization controls must enforce least privilege (e.g., general users should not have tenant admin rights). NA S3 Direct Data Connections S3.A Inbound connections from SaaS provider to Delta data sources via Internet are not permitted; must use API/proxy/intermediary. Yes S3.B Credentials for direct data traffic must be stored, controlled, and rotated per Delta standards. Yes(stored in Custom table with access restrictions) S3.C Data access and uploads to SaaS must be strictly limited to necessary data only. Yes S4 SaaS provider must offer logging or a way to view events for important transactions. NA S5 Delta tenant of SaaS solution must only be accessible from Delta network unless business need requires public Internet access. NA

column9: The legacy Fuel Management System (FMS) was written using MS Developer Studio 6.0.  The application is tied to this version due to libraries that require it and we have not upgraded.  For several years this application has been deleted from my desktop after various Radia Pushes.  It was a nuisance, but I just had to reinstall and would continue developing/supporting FMS.
column25:
Validate with Prateek Tharaja if the application can be restricted beyond just the role (i.e. to specific users as this will only be needed for max 2 users for FMS Joe Baden and Mahender Busa)

From Paul Love:
Approving since this is being noted as an emergency to support SOX compliance. 
Unless I hear otherwise, we need Internal Audit (Patrick Noll specifically) to be aware of this as he manages SOX. We should also make sure Darrin Hardy is aware as the sponsor of the Managed Software project to remove aged/old software and Richie Scammacca as the leader of the end user software components.

Software is out of support, need to move off of this as soon as possible. This software remains essential for supporting the Fuel Management System (FMS) due to its required libraries.
We currently have a capital project underway to migrate all FMS functionality to AWS, with a planned Go-Live date of October 1, 2026. Until then, this legacy software is critical for ongoing maintenance and support.

Continued use of MS Developer Studio is required for the below reasons until October 2026:
•	Over the past three years, our team has been actively rewriting the application using AWS technologies. Converting a 25-year-old application while keeping pace with environmental, legal, and business changes is a complex undertaking.
•	Improper code could impact Delta’s financial reporting and SOX compliance, so accuracy and stability are critical.
•	Microsoft Developer Studio is only being used for debugging and break-fix activities on the legacy system—not for enhancements.
•	All users run the application through Citrix. Only developers have a local version of the FMS product for debugging with MS Developer Studio. This setup is NOT internet accessible.
•	IT risk funding for this application has been declined for over 10 years.
•	The business has delayed decisions multiple times while evaluating options ranging from COTS products to small SaaS vendors and even SAP Oil and Gas Module with custom code.
•	We have empirical evidence that Microsoft Developer Studio can run on our current desktop environment, at least for the minimum functionality required.

column9:
SAP TMS will be integrated with DHL carrier to send/receive the following information.

-Parcel Rates: TechOps has a high volume of parcel, particularly in MRO space. When the freight order is created in the SAP TMS and carrier selection is done, an interface will be triggered to CPI that will call the My DHL Rating engine to retrieve the parcel rates.
-Tracking Events: Business requires SAP TMS to receive and process shipment tracking events from parcel carriers in near real-time. SAP TM automatically sends shipment details to CPI. CPI then calls the Shipment Tracking-Unified API to receive shipment status updates.
-Invoice: DHL will submit the invoices via EDI 210 message that will be received by SAP CPI and split across relevant freight orders in SAP TMS. 
- Label Request: Shipment Label API of DHL is called to retrieve the Labels.

Requires federated authentication integration with SaaS provider. NA(As user is not logging into the app) S2.B Credentials for outbound APIs must be stored, controlled, and rotated per Delta security standards. API Keys will be maintained in SAP TM and updated as needed S2.C All inbound APIs must be authorized using Delta API Authorizer and processed through Akamai for WAF and DDoS protection. NA S2.D Access and roles within SaaS must be controlled using AD groups managed by SailPoint unless technically infeasible. NA S2.E Authorization controls must enforce least privilege (e.g., general users should not have tenant admin rights). NA S3 Direct Data Connections S3.A Inbound connections from SaaS provider to Delta data sources via Internet are not permitted; must use API/proxy/intermediary. Yes S3.B Credentials for direct data traffic must be stored, controlled, and rotated per Delta standards. Yes(stored in Custom table with access restrictions) S3.C Data access and uploads to SaaS must be strictly limited to necessary data only. column40:
​​Our caregiving program supports our people and strengthens our business by offering high-quality caregiving benefits that reduce absenteeism, helping to create a more productive workplace.  

​To optimize our investments and focus on highest impact, we completed a program review and RFP in early 2025 and have several recommended changes for 2026. As part of the re-vamped program, we will onboard the vendor, Upwards, in order to address the need for affordable regular care.​
column41:
•	Enhanced Employee Experience by providing assistance with finding affordable regular care 
 
•	Reduced Absenteeism / unplanned absences due to not having childcare/caregiving services 
Just over 10,000 days of emergency backup care were provided in 2024 to 1,700 employees; our expectation is that about 50% of these days of care avoid days of unplanned absences 
 
•	Cost Savings 
•	2024 Investment: $3.4M 
o	Delta purchased 8,000 days up front 
o	1,700 employees used back-up care at average of 6 days per employee 
o	Over half of days (5,436) were used for Pet Care (versus 4,834 for Child/Adult Back-up Care) 
o	Total days used: 10,270 
 
•	2025 Investment: <$2.8M 
o	[As of 9/1/25] 6,200 days used by1,2937 employees projecting to $2.8M by EOY 
o	Additional restrictions have since been added to Pet Care
column42:
Upwards will focus on providing: 
 
•	Childcare Navigation to assist employees in finding affordable regular care (especially with daycare hours outside customary childcare center hours)  
•	Expert guidance and support provided to help identify and enroll in regular care 
•	Includes daycares, nannies, and babysitters 
•	Childcare matched within 24 hours 
 
•	Subsidy Connect to help lower paid employees find affordable childcare options. 
•	Assistance with identifying eligible local government subsidized childcare programs and social services 
•	Care Navigators take employees through the entire process, from application for funds to finding providers

column9: Muck Rack is a cloud-based, AI powered public relations (PR) management platform designed to help organizations, like Delta, streamline media outreach, monitor coverage, and measure campaign impact. It is widely used by PR teams, agencies, and brands to build relationships with journalists and influencers.
column40:
Access to the Muck Rack platform will help the communicators in Global Comms be more efficient and targeted with media list building and pitching efforts, which is a core piece of the team’s day-to-day duties and the primary method by which the team secures media coverage for Delta.

The integrated media monitoring functionality available in the platform will also help communicators quickly identify media coverage related to their pitched announcements and correct any misinformation or negative commentary in the coverage that could potentially have a negative impact on Delta’s reputation.
column41: Muck Rack’s integrated platform that brings together media list building, journalist research and media monitoring capabilities will help streamline the proactive PR process for Global Comms communicators from end to end and improve efficiency, freeing up time for the team to focus on more strategic items that will ultimately move the brand forward in reputation, media prominence and likely consideration in the minds of potential customers

column9: Canva is a tool used by the Global Communications and our partners around the business daily to support priority employee communications. We curate 20+ assets in Canva each week - these vary from email headers and SkyHub posts to flyers, home mailers and policy briefs. Our team does not have the training or licenses for Adobe products that would be the leading alternative to this unmet need.
column25:
Several business units have explored onboarding Canva; however, none have committed to covering the associated costs. Global Communications is willing to procure Canva for its specific use case only, with no enterprise-wide procurement planned at this time.

column40: Canva is a tool utilized by Global Communications and business partners daily to support priority employee communications. Each week, more than 20 assets are curated in Canva, ranging from email headers and SkyHub posts to flyers, home mailers, and policy briefs. The team does not have the training or licenses for Adobe products, which would otherwise serve as the leading alternative to this unmet need.
column41:
Faster turnaround: 
-	Immediate access: Assets can be created in hours instead of waiting days or weeks for agency deliverables. 
-	Agility during urgent communications: Quick response for time-sensitive updates (crisis messaging, policy changes)

Cost savings: 
-	No agency fees: Outsourcing design work can cost hundreds to thousands per project. Canva’s subscription is a fraction of that.
-	Reduced overhead: No need for specialized software licenses (like Adobe) or hiring additional design staff.
Brand Consistency 
-	Shared templates and brand kits in Canva ensure alignment with corporate identity across all assets.
-	Easier to maintain compliance compared to multiple external designers.

Collaboration & Accessibility
-	Cloud-based platform allows real-time collaboration across global teams and partners.
-	Eliminates delays caused by file transfers or agency communication loops.
column42:
Brand Management & Templates: Canva offers Brand Kits to store logos, fonts, and colors, plus template locking for brand consistency.

Collaboration & Workflow: Features include shared workspaces, real-time collaboration, commenting, approval flows, and centralized asset management for teams. 

AI-Powered Tools: Canva integrates AI for design generation, text-to-design, image editing, and campaign optimization through tools like Magic Studio and Canva Grow Insights. 

Content Creation at Scale: Thousands of templates, Magic Resize, and bulk creation features enable rapid production of multi-format assets. 

Integrations & Publishing: Canva connects with platforms like Google Drive, Slack, and social media for direct publishing and workflow automation. 

Security & Compliance: Enterprise plans include SSO, advanced permissions, and compliance controls for large organizations.

column9:
We would like to create an MCP interface to allow members of IT to interact with the components of the Cloud Security Process Portal (CSPP - cspp.delta.com) to ask questions and get data.  There are multiple backend components this will interact with.  These are primarily existing Lambdas and DynamoDB tables that contain information about the status of AMU executions, Akamai onboarding requests, etc.  We're still developing the list of tools, but they will all be read-only.
For example:
"Why did the AMU fail for blockcode ABCDE?"
"Is the akamai onboarding request complete for blockcode ABCDE?"

All users will be authenticated via Global Auth/ Cent Auth, and their authorization will be based on their existing access to the CSPP.

This will use existing approved MCP libraries and custom developed by the Cloud Security Engineering team.
column40: We want to explore the ability for IT developers and engineers to ask human language questions via Q Developer/ Kiro in DevSpaces, about the status of their security process steps (such as Akami Onboarding, AMU, etc.).  This will improve the user experience by not requiring them to login to CSPP.

column9: ASI Network Manager is a cloud-based UI and data aggregation platform with ML capabilities designed for National Airspace System (NAS) monitoring and strategic execution. It serves as a single source of truth (SSOT) for Delta's OCC Strategic Planning Team, consolidating 9+ separate FAA tools (NOD, TSD, Fuser, DIP, CDDR) into one unified platform. The system provides real-time situational awareness, proactive alerting, and predictive modeling to support strategic decision-making for flight operations, including diversion avoidance, IROP recovery, and TMI planning. This addresses the urgent need to replace critical FAA tools being sunset while avoiding $650K+ in costs from FlightAware sunsetting in 2H 2026.
column25:
12/8/25: STR approved
Pending items: contract execution
VRA is #37493405
Urgency: FAA is actively sunsetting 9+ critical tools that SPT currently relies on. Without this replacement, Delta would need to build internally within the next few months. SPT SSOM endorsement: "ASI is the best piece of technology we have received in 20 years!" Implementation planned in phases starting 2026 i1 with NY Metroplex integration.
column40: ASI Network Manager is urgently needed to address three critical business drivers: (1) FAA Tool Sunset - FAA is actively discontinuing 9+ critical tools (NOD, TSD, Fuser, DIP, CDDR) that SPT relies on for NAS monitoring, creating operational blind spots if not replaced; (2) Cost Avoidance - FlightAware sunsetting in 2H 2026 represents $650K+ in avoided costs; building internally would require significant unplanned IT investment; (3) Operational Excellence - current fragmented toolset requires manual data aggregation across 9+ systems, leading to inconsistent decision-making and delayed response times. ASI provides a single source of truth with ML-based predictive capabilities, proactive alerting, and Delta-specific data integration, enabling standardized decision-making and improved operational outcomes (10% diversion reduction, 0.2 point misconnect improvement). SPT endorsement: "Best technology received in 20 years.
column41:
ASI Network Manager delivers measurable ROI through multiple value streams:

COST AVOIDANCE:
• $650K+ annual savings from FlightAware sunsetting in 2H 2026
• Avoids internal development costs (estimated 6-12 months of IT resources)
• Eliminates need to replace 9+ FAA tools being sunset individually

OPERATIONAL SAVINGS:
• 10% reduction in diversions at $10K per diversion = significant monthly savings
• 0.2 point reduction in misconnects for weather/ATC-impacted flights = improved customer satisfaction and reduced rebooking costs
• 10% increase in proactive cancellations = reduced overbooking and rebooking expenses

EFFICIENCY GAINS:
• Consolidates 9+ separate tools into single platform, reducing manual data aggregation time
• Standardized decision-making across SPT personnel and shifts improves consistency
• Exception-based alerting provides more heads-up time for strategic planning
• Faster speed to decision-making reduces operational response time

COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE:
• First mover advantage in next-gen NAS monitoring technology
• Ability to fence off Delta-specific features from industry competition
• Platform foundation for future ODDS model integration and AI decision support

RISK MITIGATION:
• Prevents operational blind spots from FAA tool sunset
• Maintains critical NAS monitoring capabilities for flight operations safety
column42:
ASI Network Manager provides the following business capabilities:

1. REAL-TIME NAS SITUATIONAL AWARENESS
• Consolidated view of enroute, terminal, surface, weather, and planning data
• Interactive map display with flight paths and airspace visualization
• Real-time aircraft positioning and tracking across National Airspace System

2. PREDICTIVE ANALYTICS & MACHINE LEARNING
• Gate-to-gate trajectory modeling using 5 individual ML models
• Predicted OOOI times (Out, Off, On, In) for all flights in NAS
• Demand and capacity forecasting for airports and airspace
• TMI (Traffic Management Initiative) recommendations

3. PROACTIVE ALERTING & EXCEPTION MANAGEMENT
• Automated alerts for flights with projected surface constraints
• Fix congestion monitoring and notifications
• High-impact flight identification based on passenger/crew connections
• Exception-based alerting reduces manual monitoring burden

4. DELTA-SPECIFIC DATA INTEGRATION
• Flight status, positions, and predictions from FPES/SVOF
• Passenger counts from PIDS for connection protection
• Crew rotation data for operational continuity
• Delay cost models for prioritization and financial impact analysis
• Enhanced weather reporting and projections

5. OPERATIONAL DECISION SUPPORT
• NY Metroplex (NY3) near real-time surface display
• Airport saturation monitoring for diversion planning
• Gate throughput modeling for arrival rate decisions
• Projected departure and arrival demand visualization

6. COLLABORATIVE PLANNING TOOLS
• ATC constraint monitoring and coordination
• IROP recovery planning and prioritization
• TMI planning and FAA advocacy support
• Diversion avoidance and recovery coordination

7. STANDARDIZED PLATFORM
• Single source of truth replacing 9+ fragmented tools
• Consistent workflows across SPT personnel and shifts
• Unified decision-making framework
• Foundation for future ODDS model integration and AI capabilities
column43: Data will be stored and processed on AWS (Amazon Web Services) cloud infrastructure managed by Airspace Intelligence (ASI). Specific AWS region(s) and data residency requirements to be confirmed during contract negotiation and security review. Delta will provide data to ASI via Tier 1 integration through secure API access layer. Data residency, retention policies, and compliance requirements will be defined in the vendor agreement to ensure alignment with Delta's data governance standards.
column44: Current State: SPT uses 9+ separate applications including FAA tools (NOD - Network Operations Database, TSD - Traffic Situation Display, Fuser, DIP from NASA, CDDR from NASA) plus OIS, FSM, TCF, COSP, Fusion, and Mosaic. These tools require manual data aggregation across multiple systems. FAA is actively sunsetting/discontinuing maintenance of critical tools (NOD, TSD, Fuser, DIP, CDDR). FlightAware is also sunsetting in 2H 2026 ($650K cost avoidance). ASI Network Manager is superior because it consolidates all these tools into a single platform with enhanced ML-based predictive capabilities, proactive alerting, and Delta-specific data integration. Internal development alternative was considered but would require significant time and resources that Delta does not have given the urgent FAA tool sunset timeline.
column45: If denied, Delta would face two critical alternatives: (1) Build internally - requires significant development resources and time (estimated 6-12 months minimum) that we do not have given FAA tool sunset urgency; this would divert IT resources from other strategic initiatives. (2) Continue with current fragmented toolset - operationally unacceptable as FAA is sunsetting critical tools, creating operational blind spots; SPT would lose situational awareness capabilities, increasing risk of diversions, misconnects, and suboptimal strategic decisions; additionally, FlightAware sunsetting would cost $650K+ in 2H 2026. Neither alternative is viable given operational criticality and timeline constraints.
column46:
One-time implementation costs include:

DELTA IT DEVELOPMENT & INFRASTRUCTURE:
• ASI Adapter system development - Delta-built integration layer to aggregate and transform data from multiple source systems (FPES, SVOF, PIDS, ODDS, METRO)
• ASI Adapter hosting infrastructure setup and configuration (Delta-hosted)
• API development for Tier 1 integration with ASI Network Manager
• Data pipeline development for five data products: FLIFO, Passenger & Crew Data, Delay Cost Model, Weather Data, and ODDS Science Models
• Network security configuration (VPN, firewall rules, authentication/SSO integration)
• Testing and validation of data transformation and API integration

VENDOR COSTS:
• ASI implementation/onboarding fees (to be determined in contract negotiation)
• ASI API access layer configuration and testing support

OPERATIONAL READINESS:
• Initial user training for OCC Strategic Planning Team (SPT) and ATC coordination personnel
• Change management and process documentation
• Operational runbook development for ASI Adapter maintenance

Specific dollar amounts to be determined during procurement and detailed implementation planning. Phased implementation approach (starting with NY Metroplex in 2026 i1) allows for incremental investment and risk mitigation. The ASI Adapter represents the most significant Delta IT investment as it must aggregate data from 5+ source systems and maintain ongoing data transformation services.
column47: None. ASI Network Manager is a cloud-based SaaS solution. ASI Adapter will be hosted on Delta's existing infrastructure or cloud environment (to be determined during implementation planning).
column48:

column52: ASI SaaS subscription fees (to be determined in contract negotiation). Delta IT labor costs for ASI Adapter maintenance estimated at 0.5-1.0 FTE.
column53: Training required for SPT and ATC personnel on new UI and workflows. No additional licensing costs for end users - web-based access. Technical impact limited to Delta IT for ASI Adapter maintenance and data pipeline support.
column54: Enables retirement of 9+ legacy tools: NOD, TSD, Fuser, DIP, CDDR, OIS, FSM, TCF, COSP, Fusion, and Mosaic. Avoids FlightAware renewal costs ($650K+ in 2H 2026). Reduces operational complexity and manual data aggregation effort across SPT team.
column58:
RISK 1 - Vendor Dependency: Critical operational tool relies on third-party vendor.
MITIGATION: 99%+ SLA with penalties; establish data portability and exit requirements in contract; maintain documentation of data feeds and integration points for potential future migration.

RISK 2 - Data Integration Delays: Complex integration with 5+ Delta source systems (FPES, SVOF, PIDS, ODDS, METRO) could delay implementation.
MITIGATION: Phased implementation starting with NY Metroplex (2026 i1); work sessions scheduled with ASI and Delta IT to define requirements; ASI demonstrated 29-day development cycle; dedicated Delta IT resources for ASI Adapter development.

RISK 3 - User Adoption: SPT team accustomed to existing 9+ tool workflow.
MITIGATION: Strong SPT SSOM endorsement ("best technology in 20 years"); comprehensive training program; phased rollout allows feedback incorporation; single platform reduces complexity vs. current state.

RISK 4 - ASI Adapter Availability: Delta-hosted adapter is single point of failure for data flow.
MITIGATION: Design for high availability; implement monitoring and alerting; establish support procedures; consider redundancy in hosting architecture.

RISK 5 - Data Privacy/Security: Sharing passenger and crew data with third-party vendor.
MITIGATION: PIA completed; data encryption in transit and at rest; access controls and audit logging; contractual data handling requirements; security review and compliance validation.
column61:
Phase 1 (2026 i1): NY Metroplex Integration - Deploy to SPT for consolidated NY3 airspace view with Delta data enrichment. Initial user group: OCC Strategic Planning Team focused on NY operations.

Phase 2 (2026 i2): ATL Diversion Recovery - Expand to ATL-focused capabilities with gate throughput modeling. Broader SPT adoption for IROP planning and recovery.

Phase 3 (2026 H2): TMI Reboot - Full SPT and ATC coordination team adoption with Delta-specific TMI model reconfiguration. Complete transition from legacy 9+ tool environment.
column62: Following successful phased rollout (2026 i1-H2), mainstream adoption includes: (1) Complete transition of all SPT personnel from legacy 9+ tool environment to ASI Network Manager as single source of truth; (2) Expansion to all ATC coordination personnel for collaborative TMI planning and constraint management; (3) Retirement of legacy tools (NOD, TSD, Fuser, DIP, CDDR, OIS, FSM, TCF, COSP, Fusion, Mosaic) upon full capability validation; (4) Integration of ODDS science models for enhanced predictive capabilities; (5) Potential expansion to other operational teams that could benefit from NAS monitoring and strategic planning capabilities; (6) Continuous enhancement based on operational feedback and evolving business needs.
column63:
ORGANIZATIONAL CONSTRAINTS:
• Primary users restricted to OCC Strategic Planning Team (SPT) and ATC coordination personnel
• Requires PIA approval due to passenger and crew data sharing with third-party vendor
• Must comply with Delta data governance and security standards for operational and PII data
• Budget approval required for ASI SaaS subscription and Delta IT development costs

USE CASE CONSTRAINTS:
• Initial deployment limited to NY Metroplex monitoring (2026 i1) before broader expansion
• ODDS model integration timeline dependent on additional work sessions between Delta IT, ODDS team, and ASI
• Data feed availability dependent on source system stability (FPES, SVOF, PIDS, ODDS, METRO)
• ASI Adapter must be developed and hosted by Delta IT before data flow can begin
column64: ASI provides vendor documentation and training materials. Integration documentation for ASI Adapter to be stored in Delta IT technical documentation repository.
column65:
**RECOMMENDATION: APPROVE**

ASI Network Manager represents a strategic investment that addresses an urgent operational need while positioning Delta for future competitive advantage. The business case is strong, the technical architecture is sound, and the risks are manageable with proper mitigation strategies.

**Key Success Factors:**
1. Immediate assignment of dedicated Delta IT resources for ASI Adapter development
2. Clear contract terms with strong SLAs and data protections
3. PIA approval before implementation
4. Phased implementation with validation gates
5. Strong governance and continuous improvement process

**Timeline to Value:**
- Contract execution: Q1 2026
- ASI Adapter development: Q1-Q2 2026
- Phase 1 deployment (NY Metroplex): 2026 i1
- Full capability: 2026 H2
- Positive ROI: 12-18 months

The urgency cannot be overstated - FAA tool sunset and FlightAware sunsetting create hard deadlines that require immediate action. ASI Network Manager is the right solution at the right time.

**Approval Recommended.**

---

**Chellakumar Mark Robinson Manonmani (Robin)**  
IT Portfolio Architect, Flight Operations Domain  
Delta Air Lines IT  
December 3, 2025

column9: Contract Insight Enterprise Edition is a contract lifecycle management software solution that enables organizations to streamline and centralize their contracting processes with intake, workflow, drafting and 3rd party document review, unlimited storage, reporting and searching and more. Enhanced by VISDOM, organizations can extract key contract metadata elements, review and analyze contract risk, report on contract data, receive key date alerts, and more.
column40: Cobblestone is a third-party contract lifecycle management tool currently used by DLV Business. At present, it functions primarily as a contract repository, housing more than 4,000 contracts and company records. DLV Business has engaged an external partner to assess its contract processes and assist with clean-up efforts (Analysis and clean-up of metadata associated with old and new contract records). The organization believes that the AI capabilities in the latest version of Cobblestone will be especially valuable in accelerating these efforts and ensuring completion within the engagement timeline. Importantly, Cobblestone is not integrated with any Delta or Delta Vacations data sources and does not contain any personally identifiable information (PII).
column41:
•	Cost Savings: Analysis and cleanup on thousands of old contract records would take months of a time for expensive resources to conduct manually.  
•	Oversight/Compliance: Leverage capabilities on ongoing work ensures compliance to contract lifecycle management processes. 
•	Risk Management: ensure contract terms have key provisions, are fully executed, and stakeholders can understand the status of contracting within their business units at scale. 
•	Opportunity Identification: extract key commercial terms to ensure business stakeholders maximize contract opportunities.
column42:
VISDOM AI: This engine is designed to transform static contract documents into digital data points for improved oversight, opportunity identification, and risk mitigation.

Contract Insight Enterprise provides VISDOM® AI, CobbleStone's AI solution Visdom Basic, utilizes Mistral 's 7B v0.3 (an open-source large language model (LLM)) generative pre-trained transformer language models to offer advanced document analysis. The VISDOM basic tool supports users with features such as chat functionality and clause recognition.

VISDOM Basic serves as the foundational option, equipping users with essential functionalities for clause identification and extraction. This core version is powered by CobbleStone’s proprietary algorithms, ensuring efficient performance in recognizing and processing relevant clauses within documents.

The AI reads contract and finds relevant parts using smart search. It uses those parts to help answer questions or suggest clauses. It doesn’t learn from your data — it just uses it temporarily to give better answers. The system uses a mix of smart language tools and rule-based logic to classify clauses and extract key information.

column40:
SFO Healthy Airport Ordinance was passed that requires Delta to offer Family benefits to employees at no employee cost.  This solution was extended.

Kaiser Permanente is expanding to the West Coast for 4 additional regions [North California, South California, Oregon, Washington]. 

In addition, Kaiser is incorporating AI in various use cases across their enterprise which will impact Delta. 

AI to Anticipate Members’ Care Needs:  

Social Health Needs: Kaiser Permanente is a pioneer in understanding and addressing social risk factors that influence health. We recognize that where we live often affects our health more than genetics. Up to 40% of health disparities can be attributed to social factors, such as access to healthy food, safe neighborhoods, and transportation to medical appointments. We use predictive modeling to systemically identify patients who lack access to these essentials. By analyzing electronic health record data, such as missed appointments or uncollected prescriptions, we can identify patients who might be struggling and reach out to address their social needs. 

AI to Support Care Operations: 

Generative AI for Clinical Documentation: We are using generative AI in the form of ambient listening technology to automatically generate a first draft of clinical notes from in-person patient visits. Physicians review and edit these notes before they are signed and entered into the electronic health record. This tool requires patient consent and can significantly reduce the time physicians spend on administrative tasks, allowing them to focus more on patient care. Before making this tool widely available, we conducted a rigorous quality assurance process, gathering feedback from thousands of doctors to ensure it works effectively for all patients, including non-English speakers. Our approach to quality assurance has been published in a peer-reviewed journal, and ongoing feedback from patients and clinicians continues to demonstrate positive experiences and high satisfaction with the tool. 

How does KP leverage AI to create operational efficiencies and improve the patient experience? Our culture of continuous improvement has consistently led to enhanced health care delivery and better patient outcomes through the application of evidence based practices and innovative approaches. In alignment with this tradition, we rigorously evaluate new AI technologies for their fit for purpose to ensure they are addressing the needs of our employees and patients. For example, our use of AI to support clinical documentation can significantly reduce the amount of time physicians spend on administrative tasks so they can dedicate more time to providing patient care. This may not only improve operational efficiency but also both clinician and patient satisfaction.

This is an AI POC that compares two technical platforms: Salesforce (Agentforce and Data Cloud) and AWS Bedrock. 

Here is the use case: 

Delta’s Pilot Pay team processes thousands of pay adjustment cases each month, often requiring manual review of complex clauses from the 500+ page Pilot Working Agreement (PWA). This use case aims to implement a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline to dynamically retrieve and ground relevant contractual clauses during case intake and resolution.

The use case aims to achieve the following
	• 50–70% reduction in manual clause lookup and pay adjustment errors
	• Faster case triage through AI-powered grounding and clause retrieval
	• Consistent application of pay policies across all pilot case types
	• Framework reusable across other Delta contract domains (Cabin Crew, Tech Ops, etc.)

column9: Draw.io

AI as Judge is an intelligent conversation evaluation system that leverages artificial intelligence to assess customer service interactions with unprecedented accuracy and consistency. This dashboard provides real-time analytics and automated quality scoring for voice conversations using advanced AI models.
column40:
Product Name: AI As Judge Dashboard - AI-Powered IVR Conversation Quality Evaluation System

Business Problem:
Delta's IVR (Interactive Voice Response) system handles thousands of customer conversations daily through the Netomi AI platform. Currently, there is no automated, scalable way to evaluate conversation quality, adherence to Delta's protocols, and agent performance against established business rules. Manual review is time-consuming, inconsistent, and cannot scale to evaluate the volume of conversations needed for quality assurance and continuous improvement.

Solution:
The AI As Judge Dashboard provides an AI-powered evaluation system that:

Automates Quality Assessment - Uses AWS Bedrock (Claude 3.5 Sonnet) to evaluate IVR conversations against Delta's business rules, greeting protocols, escalation procedures, and intent handling guidelines
Provides Actionable Insights - Generates detailed rubric-based evaluations (UAT-12, FTS-23) with scores and specific feedback on what was done correctly or incorrectly
Enables Data-Driven Decisions - Integrates with Redshift data lake to analyze conversation patterns, preview data, and identify trends across customer interactions
Centralizes Knowledge Base - Maintains Delta's IVR protocols, special handling rules, and intent definitions in a Bedrock Knowledge Base for consistent evaluation criteria

Key Benefits:

Scalability: Evaluate unlimited conversations automatically vs. manual sampling
Consistency: AI applies same evaluation criteria uniformly across all conversations
Speed: Real-time evaluation vs. days/weeks for manual review
Cost Reduction: Eliminates need for dedicated QA staff to manually review conversations
Continuous Improvement: Identifies training gaps and protocol violations quickly for corrective action
Compliance: Ensures IVR interactions meet Delta's customer service standards and regulatory requirements
Target Users:
IVR Operations Team (evaluate conversation quality)
Contact Center Managers (monitor agent performance)
Training Teams (identify coaching opportunities)
Business Analysts (analyze conversation trends)
Why Now:
The existing IVR system is operational but lacks quality monitoring capabilities. This creates risk of poor customer experiences going undetected and prevents data-driven optimization of the IVR system.
column41:
Qualitative Benefits:
Customer Experience Improvement
Consistent application of Delta's service standards across all IVR interactions
Faster identification and correction of conversation flow issues
Improved first-call resolution rates
Operational Excellence
Data-driven insights for IVR optimization
Objective performance metrics for continuous improvement
Standardized evaluation criteria eliminates subjective bias
Risk Mitigation
100% conversation monitoring vs. 5% sampling reduces compliance risk
Automated detection of protocol violations and escalation failures
Audit trail for regulatory compliance
Scalability
Solution scales automatically with conversation volume
No additional headcount needed as IVR usage grows
Supports future expansion to other contact center channels
column42:
Business Capabilities
AI-Powered Conversation Evaluation - Automatically evaluates 100% of IVR conversations against Delta's business rules and protocols using AWS Bedrock
Knowledge Base Management - Centralized repository of Delta's IVR protocols, greeting standards, intent definitions, and escalation rules
Conversation Search & Retrieval - Query and filter conversations by contact ID, date range, and keywords
Data Lake Analytics - Direct integration with Redshift for historical conversation analysis and trend identification
Evaluation Dashboard - Web interface to view conversation scores, detailed feedback, and performance metrics
Multi-Rubric Scoring - Structured evaluation using UAT-12 and FTS-23 rubrics with detailed breakdowns
API Access - RESTful APIs for integration with other Delta systems and automated workflows
Performance Reporting - Track quality metrics, identify protocol violations, and generate compliance reports
column84: The Skye Dashboard is not a SaaS platform. It is a Delta-developed, Delta-owned application deployed entirely within Delta's AWS infrastructure (AWS Account 476114128765). Architecture Details: Deployment Model: Infrastructure as Code (CDK) deployed to Delta's AWS accounts Hosting: All components run within Delta-controlled AWS services (Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, API Gateway) Data Storage: All data stored in Delta's AWS account (DynamoDB tables, S3 buckets) Network: Deployed within Delta's VPC with Delta-managed security groups Access Control: Managed by Delta's IAM roles and policies Code Ownership: Source code stored in Delta's Git repository (https://git.delta.com/resenablement/backend/apps/AiAsJudge) AWS Services Used (Not SaaS): The solution uses AWS managed services (Bedrock, Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, API Gateway), which are Platform as a Service (PaaS) components, not SaaS. These are: Deployed within Delta's AWS account Controlled by Delta's IAM policies Subject to Delta's security configurations Audited via Delta's CloudTrail logs Covered under Delta's AWS Enterprise Agreement Third-Party AI Model: While the solution uses AWS Bedrock with Anthropic's Claude model, this is accessed through AWS Bedrock (a PaaS offering), not directly from Anthropic as a SaaS. AWS Bedrock provides: Data isolation within Delta's AWS account No data sharing with Anthropic Delta-controlled access policies Compliance with AWS security standards Conclusion: SaaS Mandates do not apply to this solution. This is a custom-developed application using Delta-controlled cloud infrastructure services.
column85: Compliance Details: 1. AWS Bedrock Usage (Managed AI Service) Uses AWS Bedrock with Claude 3.5 Sonnet model - a fully managed, enterprise-grade AI service AWS Bedrock provides built-in security controls including encryption at rest/in transit, IAM-based access control, and audit logging via CloudTrail No custom AI models are trained or deployed; only AWS-managed foundation models are used 2. Access Control & Authentication All Lambda functions use IAM roles with least-privilege permissions API Gateway endpoints protected by custom authorizer (token-based authentication) Cross-account Redshift access uses dedicated IAM role with read-only permissions No public endpoints; all resources deployed within AWS VPC with security groups 3. Data Security DynamoDB table stores conversation evaluations with encryption at rest (AWS managed) S3 buckets for Bedrock Knowledge Base rules and dashboard files use server-side encryption No PII or sensitive customer data is stored; only conversation metadata and evaluation results Data in transit encrypted via HTTPS/TLS 4. Knowledge Base Security Bedrock Knowledge Base (ID: TSNXI4WDYJ) contains only business rules and protocols (no sensitive data) Rules stored in S3 with restricted IAM access KB content is version-controlled and auditable 5. Monitoring & Auditability All AWS service interactions logged via CloudTrail Lambda function logs sent to CloudWatch for monitoring API Gateway access logs enabled for audit trail Resource tagging (blockCode: RMTPDMCOEV) for compliance tracking 6. Infrastructure as Code Entire infrastructure defined in CDK (TypeScript) for reproducibility and version control Configuration managed via SSM Parameter Store for centralized control No hardcoded credentials or secrets in code 7. Secure Development Practices Follows Delta's Q Master CDK pattern for standardized deployment Separate Git repositories for backend and frontend per corporate policy Code review and approval process via Git workflow This solution aligns with CISA and NCSC guidelines for secure AI system deployment by using managed services, implementing defense-in-depth, maintaining audit trails, and following least-privilege access principles.

column9: TriageBot AI is an intelligent log analysis platform that automatically monitors CloudWatch logs and uses Amazon Bedrock AI to identify, prioritize, and summarize operational issues. The system transforms overwhelming log data into actionable insights, helping operations teams focus on critical problems that require immediate attention. The platform analyzes login patterns, connectivity issues, and user experience metrics across devices, flights, and customer accounts, providing tailored recommendations for different operational contexts including flight operations, device performance, and member experience management.
column25:
Built with serverless AWS architecture using CDK, the platform leverages Bedrock's Titan Text Lite model with context-aware prompts for flight operations, device performance, and member experience analysis. 
TriageBot AI operates in two modes: 
(1) Event-driven analysis triggered by leadership reports through the 4help portal in DSWF, generating PagerDuty alerts with AI driven insights.
(2) On-demand analysis through a web UI where users can enter flight numbers, SkyMiles member IDs, or device IDs to receive immediate AI-generated summaries. 
Initial deployment targets DSWF with planned expansion to kiosk and Sync seatback.
The system required Amazon Bedrock model access enabled in the account- digital-content-dvl, digital-content-si, digital-content-prd
